reviews.text: It had been a while since we had eaten at Cheesecake Factory, but my husband chose it for his birthday. Because they have such a vast menu he felt everyone in the group could easily find something they wanted. I will say the menu has always impressed me. I just can&#39;t imagine how the kitchen staff keeps up! <br>It was busy as usual but we only had a 20 minute wait. Our server was very pleasant, but quite slow. After we ordered, we sat for about 30 minutes before the food came out and I had to have someone find him to get the check, and then to pay. <br>I had the Thai lettuce wraps. My 1st time trying them, but they were good. <br>Interesting they gave a scoop of ice cream for my hubbies birthday. No cake! He didn&#39;t care, but I just think that&#39;s weird for a restaurant that specializes in cheesecake.

This place is always crazy busy.  Is it worth the wait?????  Well, it has to since it was busy from start to finish.  I&#39;m not a cheesecake fan buuuuut I&#39;m here for their food.  One of my favorites is the firecracker salmon that they no longer makes iy, but you fan find the recipe online.<br><br>All the dishes I&#39;ve ever tried are delicious.  For someone who&#39;s not a cheesecake fan, I can absolutely have a slice here.  Just remember, don&#39;t come hungry since the wait is crazy long.
Very tasty! Thanku for allowing Reservations!!! Walked right in! Server Ella was excellent! Very kind and knowledgeable of menu!

Family night (Saturday) at The Cheesecake Factory, my son&#39;s favorite place for wings. I&#39;ll drive the 30 mins or more for a nice meal... we did. I called ahead to see if they were really busy on and they were. I had already prepared my family for the wait. What was supposed to be an 1.5 hour wait was only about 45 mins. We were happy!<br><br>We had an amazing waitress named Brittany. Although her area was busy she was very attentive and cheerful. We ordered a lot of food for only 3 people. All the appetizers were good (wings, tamale cakes and calamari) until we got to the dinner portion.  <br><br>When my food was brought out the server prepped me about how hot my plate was. I don&#39;t think she realized what she brought out from the kitchen was a plate full of cold food. I immediately told Brittany and she apologized. I had her hold one of the stems of veggies and she seemed embarrassed about it all. She brought out new mashed potatoes and asparagus but I didn&#39;t want to wait for a new steak to be made. All the flavors were there but I can&#39;t enjoy a cold piece of meat. Plus it was already late so I just took it home. <br><br>Next time we will just stick to what we like, especially on a weekend. My son was happy he got what he wanted so that&#39;s what mattered most for me. You can never go wrong with their wings and cheesecake! Brittany gave me a complimentary slice for the cold food. That was very thoughtful and I appreciated it. The Cheesecake Factory will always be a place we will go to for appetizers and cheesecake. It&#39;s not a place where I&#39;m looking for them to exceed our expectations. Ask for Brittany if you go to this location. :)

We patiently waited 40 minutes in line for some slices of cheesecake, and when we got to the cash register to finally order, we waited another 5 minutes for them to finally take our order. After taking our order, we are told we have to wait another 30 MINUTES just to get our cheesecake. We were told our original order of 6 slices of cheesecake would take 30 minutes, and when we asked about just 1, we are told it would still take 30 minutes. Terrible and ridiculous.

Recently ordered curbside.  It was fairly delayed.  I ended up getting there by the intended pick-up time only to wait and then leave again.  I ordered lunch and remained underwhelmed.  Lettuce wraps had cold, inedible noodles.  Dry chicken.  And sickeningly sweet sauce.  Chicken potstickers were no better.  The dumplings were cold and dry.  <br><br>My go-to when I&#39;m here would only be cheesecake.

Who hasn&#39;t been to the cheesecake? But if you haven&#39;t, I recommend that you do. Appetizers are always really good. I love the calamari and there chicken wing appetizers. Also try the fried cauliflower. I do tend to get the salmon or steak. The pastas are good too. Especially the shrimp scampi. Most of the food does have a garlicky taste to it. So if you&#39;re a vampire, beware. Prices are a bit higher than your average restaurant, but can still be affordable. <br>And of course, who can forget the cheesecakes. There are so many different flavors from original to Oreo to different seasonal cheesecakes. I am not a cheesecake but all my family and friends are and they love switching up from different flavors when we come to visit.

I came here during my birthday, and the staff made me feel so special and loved! Our waitress was lovely and she made us feel like VIP&#39;s the whole night. The Cheesecake Factory has an extensive menu, and because of that, I got full before I could have dessert. Our waitress offered us the dessert menu, but I declined as it was getting a little later and I felt full. However, she surprised me and came out with a bowl of ice cream free of charge. It came with a small candle on top and was so incredibly sweet! It really made my birthday and I want to thank the Cheesecake Factory for some wonderful service and yummy food! :)

This is usually our Sunday go-to for family dinner. We love the ambiance of the location from the fun wall decor , the layout of seating and the low-lights . The drinks are wonderfully crafted. I suggest the Pineapple Mojito or Moscow Mule! <br>During the COVID-19 pandemic, we certainly miss our almost weekly visit so we did Door Dash of our favorite meals. It did not disappoint! Both entree&#39;s were just as fresh and flavorful as when we visit dining in. The portion size were more generous than usual but my husband certain did not complain lol. I love a lot of spice so I ordered Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp. The mixture of mango salsa, fried plantains and peppery jerk sauce is a party for your palate in each bite. My husband goes for more home style,comfort food so he orders Louisiana Chicken Pasta. It has a slight kick with a creole groove to it. It can be a tad bit oily for me but the &#34;bow tie&#34; pasta dish has always be a staple on the menu. Sprinkle on fresh grated Parmesan cheese and you are good to go!

Our waiter Max was a delight !   The food was amazing,  it was hot , cook to perfection.   The seating was great , due to COVID-19 , social distancing inside was wonderful and mask were required and appreciated.  Thank you Max for the birthday treat, it was very thoughtful .

Ordered online and drove to the restaurant to pick up the food. They have a pretty simple process for food pickup to reduce the exposure to others during this time. They send you a text, you respond with the parking spot number and your cars make/model. Their staff is friendly and efficient with your food pickup. The food on the other hand is average at best. My son was disappointed with his Macaroni burger (looks nothing like the picture on their website). I ordered the Jamaican Black Pepper Chicken and Shrimp. My dish was a good portion size, came with Rice, Black Beans, and Plantains for my sides. I would have liked a little more kick to the flavor or the dish, but overall I was happy with my food.

Long wait, but I assume that&#39;s always the case no matter the day or time of day. First time I&#39;d been there, so I didn&#39;t really know what to get, and went with a safe bet of fish and chips. The food was good, albeit pricey. <br><br>I had a wonderful waitress, and really enjoyed the piece of cheesecake I ordered for dessert. <br><br>I should&#39;ve researched prices more ahead of time to be better prepared, but at least now I know what to expect. <br><br>I&#39;ll go back someday to try different things and branch out.

My wife loves this place! So I come to be nice. I don&#39;t  love it. First of all the menu is all over the place   They have some many choices their chefs must have to go to a month long training class to learn all of it. The brown bread that they bring to your table is really really good. My philly steak was good- as long as I scraped it off the bread. The bread was so hard I felt like I was going to break a tooth. French fries sucked. Mozzarella cheese bits were the best part of the meal.

On my daughter&#39;s 15th birthday last week we visited castleton location. We had to wait almost 2hrs to be seated then another 1hour to get our food. My food was cold and over cooked? How? Then it took over 10mins to bring warm mash potatoes. I was very disappointed. All this for the price point. Also due to covid the place can only be at 50%, so why such a  bad experience? Do Better

Cheesecake Factory does not disappoint when it comes to their flagship food....the cheesecake! There are several options to choose from (sometimes a little overwhelming, but most times it&#39;s nice to have those options especially with kids!) when it comes to your table the presentation is appealing and with the first bite (and the ones after) don&#39;t disappoint the senses.<br><br>When it comes to food there are a lot of options there, as well...which is nice because they have food offerings from just about each food category you can think of ... and the ones I have had have been really tasty. Oh and the serving sizes are huge...so come with an appetite or be prepared to ask for a to-go box.<br><br>Service-wise...overall, it is a decent experience...most of the times I have dined there, the servers seemed to be frantic and in a hurry...especially during the rush times.

There are a lot of choices on the ginormous menu, which makes it possible for almost everyone to find something that looks appealing. There were five of us here for a late lunch on Saturday and we had about a 30 minute wait, which I sort of expected. Once we were seated, the service was good, although it took about 20 minutes to get our food. Probably because I ordered a flatbread pizza.  My Everything flatbread came with a pretty large side salad, both of which were pretty good.  My wife did not care for the avocado toast because the bread was like a thick French bread and too crunchy for her preference.  Everyone else liked the food, but did not consider better than just good.  The menu prices make me expect the food to be better than good, in my opinion.   It was also irritating that Penny wasn&#39;t working. (Big Bang Theory reference)
Ordered the shrimp scampi and got mashed potatoes togo &amp; it&#39;s too far to drive back and there&#39;s really nothing to do.

I was recently treated to my first visit to The Cheesecake Factory on a weekday at the end of April for my 40th birthday. Other than getting dirty looks outside from more &#34;posh&#34; people going into the mall at Keystone at the Crossing, I would say my experience was better than expected.<br><br>Our server, Howard, I believe, was pretty great. We didn&#39;t have to wait for too long, and he seated us in a booth. Our server took our drink orders right away. He had named off their draft beers for me. I don&#39;t remember the brand of what I got, but he had me at &#34;cream ale.&#34; The ale was excellent! We also indulged in the wonderful crusty bread that was on the table. I think one was sourdough, and the other was Pumpernickel.  We were brought a second basket at one point, too. <br><br>The server was patient as we perused the large menu. It was both helpful and guilt-inducing that the calories were listed next to each item. The others in my party had a side salad, the bacon cheeseburger, and the seafood wrap on the skinny menu. It all looked really good!  <br><br>I had the veggie burger and fries from the regular menu. I thought about going for the skinny version, but, hey, it was my birthday, so I thought I would splurge, even though it was an enormous amount of calories for something I&#39;d assume was healthy.<br><br>The veggie burger patty easily crumbled, but it was large and appeared to have been made in-house. It was one of the better veggie burgers I have had. The bun was great, and the burger came with lots of toppings including avocado and pickles. I realized later that the aioli I didn&#39;t want was on it, but it wasn&#39;t a huge deal. The sandwich was already cut in half and held together with toothpicks. Our server also got a cup of mustard for me on request.<br><br>The fries were really delicious! Crispy, not overly salty.  Had I a bigger appetite, I could certainly eat quite a few more of those.  I took half of my meal home as it was. It would be nice to just chill here over fries and beers sometime though.  <br><br>The waiter brought me a cute little complimentary fudge sundae with sprinkles and whipped cream.  It even had a lit candle in it! He and my dining companions also sang &#34;Happy Birthday.&#34; That was pretty cool, as I couldn&#39;t even remember the last time that I was sung to on my birthday.  Our server was also kind enough to snap some photos for us.  <br><br>As I enjoyed my sundae, my companions who treated me to this fabulous meal shared a piece of the chocolate mousse cheesecake.  I got to take a piece home, and it was really good.  I didn&#39;t eat it all at once, as it was rich and I wanted to savor it, but it would be easy to scarf a couple of slices down. The dark cookie-like crust was my favorite part.  It was decorated with a lot of extra whipped cream, too. I&#39;d also like to try the vanilla bean sometime.<br><br>The atmosphere had a much higher ceiling than what I usually like, but it felt nice in there to me.  It was much more reminiscent of an Italian cafe than a chain restaurant.  It was nicely decorated and felt upscale. The restaurant was sunny but had a cool comfortable temperature.  It somewhat reminded me of the Ayre&#39;s tea room in a way. The Cheesecake Factory had real cloth napkins and lovely flatware, even a salad fork.<br><br>The ladies&#39; room also had a high-end design. The only things I didn&#39;t like were that it was a bit too dark, even though I prefer dim rooms, and the faucet was automatic and only provided hot water.  It was clean, modern, and easy to find though.<br><br>Chains aren&#39;t always my thing, but this is a nice one.  I didn&#39;t feel rushed at all or surrounded by any kitschy weird decor like so many chains where it feels like the staff are forced to be too upbeat. The service here was professional and genuinely warm as well as laid back and relaxing. I really did forget I was in a chain attached to a mall. <br><br>We had a great time, and I would return. I won&#39;t ever forget my first trip to The Cheesecake Factory.

Very clean and friendly <br>The servers are all so nice, they come right away with your order, drinks! Everything taste fresh! One of the best places I&#39;ve eaten in Indy in a long time. I ordered cheesecake to go and it is huge lol can&#39;t wait to go back!

I&#39;ve been to cheesecake several times. You really can&#39;t go wrong here. The menu is enormous and has something for everyone! We celebrated Mother&#39;s Day here for lunch. The wait for a party of seven was one hour, which I thought was reasonable for the holiday and being around lunch time. <br><br>I got a mojito. It was a little too sweet &amp; syrupy for my liking. My aunt got the moscato and loved it. Our table ordered the dynamite shrimp for an appetizer. While it was very delicious, it&#39;s a small portion.  If more than two people are sharing, I would suggest ordering two. <br><br>I really like that they now have a skinnylicious menu. I hadn&#39;t been here in at least a year, so that was new to me. I ordered the chicken taquitos and they were phenomenal! Perfect portion, and I didn&#39;t feel miserable afterward. (Had to save room for cheesecake!) My aunt got the BBQ chicken chopped salad half portion, and it. Was. Huge! I can&#39;t imagine what the full size looks like. <br><br>My go to cheesecake is the cookie dough. I love all things cookie dough, so I highly recommended that!

I&#39;ve rarely, if ever, had a bad experience at The Cheesecake Factory! They have such an extensive menu and there has never been a time that I wish I hadn&#39;t ordered a certain dish. My go-to is the Chicken Piccata or Chicken Madeira. Both are delicious and insanely filling. I always have extra to take home. During this visit I ordered an appetizer as my meal. I got the Tex Mex Eggrolls and they were very yummy. It comes with a side of guacamole and it was the perfect dipping sauce! <br><br>Now, let&#39;s talk desserts: I don&#39;t know that it&#39;s possible for them to serve a bad slice of cheesecake. I normally get the Red Velvet Cheesecake, but the past couple of visits I have ordered the 30th Anniversary slice. If you are a rich chocolate lover, then try the 30th! Another great slice is the Cinnabon Cheesecake... it genuinely takes like an actual Cinnabon cinnamon roll in cheesecake form! Delish! Also, their Strawberry Shortcake is huge and insanely good. It&#39;s one of my mom&#39;s favorite dessert menu items! <br><br>TCF is a great option for larger parties and families, too. Their portions are huge (could be shared between two people) and the food is great! <br><br>I highly recommend this restaurant. Friendly staff. Delicious entrees. Delectable desserts. You can&#39;t go wrong!

If I had to pick a chain restaurant as my favorite dinner spot, The Cheesecake Factory is a contender.  I rarely have a bad experience here and I always find something on their humongous menu to satisfy my cravings.  I&#39;m impressed that pretty much everything is made fresh.  Try not to get too full with the complimentary bread, apps and entrees because you&#39;ll definitely want to get some dessert!  Sometimes the timing is off and there&#39;s pretty much always at least an hour wait during peak times though.  However, this location is in the mall so we generally browse around while waiting.  They use a buzzer system but I think I prefer a phone call to alert us when our table is ready.  Not sure if this is feasible or if there&#39;s dead space within the mall but it&#39;s just a thought.

I had an okay experience here and would likely go back for a special occasion. The wait time to be seated was longer than quoted. After sitting, the waiter didn&#39;t come to our table to get drink orders for nearly 5 minutes. The drinks took a long time to come out, and we had been ready to order for a solid 10 minutes before he ever came back to check on us. He was actually super nice and personable but I was in no way impressed by the speed of service from the time I walked in the door to the time I left. It was extremely warm in the restaurant, so everyone in the 5 person group was uncomfortable. My chicken madeira was good, not great, but also not warm. The blood orange margarita was great. The traditional cheesecake was also good.

5 reviews<br><br>3 minutes ago<br><br>Since the Coronavirus we have not eaten out. Today, we ordered carryout from the Cheesecake Factory. Wow, they have an AWESOME system to get our food. It was all done online. We never came close to anyone. When we got home, the food was still warm and very tasty! Most of al . Great service with a huge variety on the menu!<br><br>Must check out The Cheesecake Factory!

Food was good. I haven&#39;t tried much of the menu. I stick with the chicken Madeira. It&#39;s so good that I&#39;ve tried to make it at home. It def doesn&#39;t taste the same though. The asparagus was tender and fabulous mixed with the sauce and cheese. The crab and artichoke dip is pretty good but it&#39;s greasy and the artichokes were tough. Love the lighting in the restaurant, but too dark in the restroom for my liking and for the kids. Didn&#39;t have a long wait - went after brunch. Prices are fair and quality of the meal itself was great. Something about those mashed potatoes too!!! Yum! <br><br>Con: it&#39;s crowded and I mean that as in the side. I don&#39;t like rubbing elbows and back and boobs on people because we are so crammed in.

I just reviewed our meal a few weeks ago and it was very good.  So, we decided to duplicate our order again.  It was great, it was the same again!<br><br>The notch down was for one entree that we added, BANG-BANG CHICKEN AND SHRIMP $19.95.  I took one bite &amp; it was disgusting.  I even tried a bite today.  yuk  The dish reeked of onion/shallots and didn&#39;t combine with the Thai theme at all.  The curry chile peanut coconut flavorings were bland &amp; tasted like something from a can.  I luv Thai but this wasn&#39;t that, nor was it anything close to what one would thing of bang-bang shrimp &amp; chicken, nor was it worth anywhere close to 19.95!  -don&#39;t try<br><br>Flip side:  1st terrible dish from here ever.

Management is incompetent and the service is lousy! The food is standard fare. I have tried this place on at least two other occasions. Last night was &#34;Strike 3.&#34; <br><br>We arrived at 8:20 and were seated around 8:40. This was a vast improvement from last time when we were told we had a 3+ hour wait. The speed in seating considering we could hardly get in, seemed to be a good omen. We were wrong!<br><br>Our party of 6 included our 9yr old granddaughter. The waitress was prompt in taking our orders, but things went rapidly downhill from there. Our food wasn&#39;t delivered until nearly 9:45pm. When it arrived, they had combined our order with someone else&#39;s. The runner from the kitchen made it clear she would rather be anywhere else, but delivering food to tables. She had a lot of attitude. <br><br>We soldiered on. The upshot is they finally managed to bring all the adults their food... but they forgot about our 9yr old granddaughter. By this time she was literally in tears from hunger. <br><br>All she had ordered were the chicken &#34;tenders&#34; and fries with a side of green beans. Probably the simplest and quickest thing to prepare on their menu. It literally took them ANOTHER half hour to bring out her food. We all waited, refusing to eat until she was served. <br><br>The assistant general manager - Keith - apologized  for taking so long to bring the food. We asked how he planned to make it right... His offer was to four free cheese cakes of our choice. By now it was well after 10:15pm. My brother-in-law was so angry he simply got up and walked out leaving his food on the table. <br><br>Long story short, our appetites were ruined. The total bill with tip would have been nearly $200. That is a helluva lot of money to pay to be mistreated. My suggestion? Spare yourself the trouble and avoid this place. <br><br>There are eating establishments all around, many in walking distance where you will get better food and much better service. I do not generally give a place a bad review because I know ANY establishment can have an off night. However after 3 consecutive bad experiences, the problem is not the night. It&#39;s the management.

I went there for dinner and ordered the Orange chicken from the menu.   It was mediocre at best if you ask me. It lacked the orange sauce that orange chicken is made of and the rice was sticky.  Some of the chicken seemed a little too over cooked as well.  The entire dish was dry as a desert.  <br><br>I don&#39;t think that my server asked me if everything was OK otherwise I would have said something about the meal.

I will never bring my business here again. I don&#39;t write bad reviews because of how it can affect the business but this set me off. The hostess behind the front desk was the definition of condescending. It was sad how rude she was. The maximum limit for a table is 6. We had 5 adults and 3 babies under a year old. She said we couldn&#39;t be seated because we have 8 but she could get us tables on opposite ends of the restaurant. I was confused and said we only have 5 and the other three are babies. She looked at me like I was an idiot, raising her voice saying &#34;a body is a body and again I can sit you at opposite ends of the restaurant but you&#39;re going to have to wait an hour and a half now anyways.&#34; She immediately ignored us and turned to the next customer. I didn&#39;t even respond, nor my family. We were more in disbelief as to what just happened. I understand there&#39;s new rules but it doesn&#39;t give you the right to talk that way to someone. It&#39;s sad to see customer service is dead here.

I wasn&#39;t impressed when I ate there. The menu is overwhelming which I&#39;m probably not the first who thought the same, it&#39;s just how do you know what they are known for?!!! You don&#39;t. You just gotta to with your gut I guess haha I ordered a pasta dish and I can&#39;t even tell you what it was, but it was bland and you definitely needed to season the noodles with salt and pepper. I would say the appetizer of the avocado egg rolls were THE BEST THING ON THAT MENU. So I would go back for those if I ever did.

Ordered curbside, said it was going to be done at 5:32 and waiting outside for over an hour and still hadn&#39;t received our food. After calling and getting ahold of the attendant they finally brought our food out which was already cold and partially soggy. Never received a text or was notified that our food was ready. Very disappointing.

I usually just grab a slice of their infamous cheesecake to go when I&#39;m at the mall, but opted to eat here this time around. Met up with a group of girls on a Sunday afternoon to celebrate some birthdays. When we all arrived we had a bit of a wait for a table.  Once seated, my friends decided on the Fettuccine Alfredo(kinda dry and friend rated it a 4 out of 10), Parmesan Herb Crusted Chicken(taters were cold, asparagus could&#39;ve been grilled longer, but the chicken was really good). Famous Factory Meatloaf meal was good. No complaints. We shared a slice of caramel pecan cheesecake. Always delicious.

We stopped into Cheesecake Factory on a Saturday afternoon, and like any time you go, there was a long wait. My husband and I managed to sneak a spot at the bar and were able to eat right away. For two, the bar service is exceptional, they lay down a white napkin and everything, so you genuinely feel like you are sitting down to a nice meal. I have eaten here a few times over the years but I have never found anything I was &#34;in love&#34; with at Cheesecake Factory.  I ordered the Herb Crusted Salmon with a delicious Lemon Sauce, Asparagus and Mashed Potatoes. The salmon is the best thing I have ever had here and will probably be my new &#34;go-to&#34;. My husband ordered his childhood favorite, Louisiana Chicken Pasta. There is a reason Cheesecake Factory is so popular; it is indeed on the top in terms of offering a consistent product wherever you go. The long wait will continue to deter me from going more than once or twice a year, but that is just one less person on the waiting list when you check it out!

I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory multiple times. After many times of coming here I&#39;ve realized it&#39;s just ok. I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll return because if family and friends who don&#39;t live close to one, they always want to experience &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34;.   <br><br>Today I went with the Louisiana Chicken Pasta for my entree. When the server brought out the dish it was only Parmesan Crusted Chicken and pasta. The menu calls for Parmesan Crusted Chicken Served Over Pasta with Mushrooms, Peppers and Onions in a Spicy New Orleans Sauce. Yea, that&#39;s a lot of ingredients left out. The server returned the dish and corrected it. The dish was good after the adding the correct ingredients.  It appeared the table behind me was having issues with their meal also. I don&#39;t usually give restaurants a hard time with mistakes but the manager was not apologetic. He saw what was happening but never came to the table to apologize at all. IMO good customer service will make up for bad food or mistakes. <br><br>So I have a few pros and cons. <br><br>Pros: <br>-Family friendly <br>-Decent cheesecake <br>-Food is consistent in taste <br>-Adult beverages are good <br>-Large portions <br>-Good appetizers <br><br>Cons: <br>-LOUD restaurant not intimate<br>-Menu has a huge selection. Sometimes it makes it hard to make a decision. <br>-Seating is too close. When people walk by your table they seem to be right in your plate. <br>-The waiting area is entirely too small. Half the time you don&#39;t know if people are waiting to get on the list for a table, in line to get cheesecake, or waiting for their buzzer to go off to be seated. <br><br>I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll be back. ‍

The Cheesecake Factory at the Fashion Mall is pathetic. I went there recently to do a curbside for a slice of cheesecake for someone else. Paid ahead of time otherwise I wouldn&#39;t have paid at all for the tiny slice that I was given that I ended up paying $10 for. Highly disgusted at the fact that you&#39;ve shrunk the slices and still charge $10 for a tiny slice. Waste of money and curbside took forever.

I&#39;m not usually a fan of chain restaurants, but this is always a go to when our group is undecided because of the variety of food selections on the menu. They are a bit pricey but give large portions. The drinks are always fun and cheesecake is always on point. There will always be a wait during peak times but we&#39;ve usually been seated no more than 25 minutes. I&#39;ve only received slow service once but other than that, the servers are good with checking up.

Total fan of this chain and sometimes, you need predictability in food in service. We were all just too tired, hungry and spent to try something new while in Indy, so we went with the old faithful. We sat quickly and didn&#39;t need menus. Our server was so sweet and just catered to every request for extra ice, straws, more bread, drinks, etc. The food was great as always and was exactly what we needed after a long day.
They did an excellent job. They got everything right and was very fast. Their new procedures were easy to understand. Great job guys!

I like the food. Their take on tamales was interesting I definitely enjoyed them. My favorite is the chicken and waffle Benedict. It is buttery sweet and has delicious fried chicken finish. The drinks are also really good.
Post COVID Sunday Evening vibes. Ciara, our server, was incredible. She was extremely helpful and her energy was amazing. The food was great.

We hadn&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory in a while but overall had a great visit. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. I loved the lettuce wrap Mexican chicken tacos. I really just wish you could call ahead or make a reservation like 99% of restaurants.

This place is always busy. The food is good but it&#39;s not stellar. Upon waking in we saw a handful of people waiting. I asked for a booth and got a 15 min wait. It&#39;s well worth a wait not to sit in their horribly uncomfortable chairs.  Our server was prompt we ordered drinks. When she arrived with drinks she took our order and we requested bread. The usual amount of bread came out some white and some oat wheat, but not the usual bowl of butters. We received one pat of butter each. I thought this was odd since other tables had the typical bowl of butter. We finished bread spreading our butter thin and asks for another basket of bread. Again the same amount of bread and one pat of butter each. Just weird. I don&#39;t know if she was watching our cholesterol for us or what.  I ordered Tahi Chicken Wraps and husband ordered some chicken dish with rice.  Food was good drinks were kept full. About halfway thru our meal she asked us about desert. We knew what we wanted and wanted them to go. She left and came back while she was gone we got out Slice Of Joy cards out. ( when we purchased gift cards around Christmas they came with a card for a free slice of cheese cake or layer cake. ). She questioned if we could get layer cake. We told her yes but until she finished reading the back of the card she wasn&#39;t satisfied we were correct. This is not our first time at this rodeo. Cake to go was delivered. And enjoyed later that night at home.
It was amazing great service great environment food was perfect the server manager there were super friendly and ver patient will definitely be back

I haven&#39;t had Cheesecake Factory since I was last in Texas (almost 4 years ago)! Their wing appetizer is amazing, they cook the wings just perfect and it isn&#39;t overwhelming with sauce. Their Caesar salad is awesome, and if I&#39;m not mistaken, they make their own croutons. Drinks were pricey (which I will watch how often I order next time). Everything I had was delicious, including their cheesecake, obviously. Will come back again!

First of all. Our lunch was very good and the wait staff great.  However, they did not inforce any social distancing at the front of the restaurant.  We tried to leave, with masks on and there was a woman, with no mask on standing with the door open and when I asked her to please move since she had no mask on, she refused to move and proceeded to get mad at me for asking her to move.  You need to do a better job at keeping people out of the doorway, especially if you don&#39;t require them to wear masks into the restaurant.  What are you goin g to do when it&#39;s mandatory?  I was very disappointed.

Holy Smokes this place is busy! We arrived at 530 on a Sat and we were told there was a 75 minute wait. We were joining friends so we went ahead and waited. It was about  95 minutes later that we were seated. <br>Be sure to grab a menu while u wait because it&#39;s legit 15 pages! <br><br>When we finally had a server,Hannah was very nice and  had drinks out and orders in quickly. Then we waited another 45 minutes for food. Our orders came out one at a time which is odd if you&#39;re in a group. My wife waited another 20 minutes for her meal and by that time my food was cold because I didn&#39;t want to eat while she waited. <br><br>All 4 of us really enjoyed our food though... saving grace! All the chicken dishes were really tasty. <br><br>Cheesecake was a must but it&#39;s a take home dessert for sure! It&#39;s soo heavy after a pretty large meal. <br><br>If you plan to have a meal.. be sure you plan ahead and make this a 3 hour event! I think reservations are needed here sooooooo bad!

The menu was abbreviated and had we known to what extent we probably would have selected another restaurant since this was for a special occasion. The cheesecake selection was still a full selection. The only way to make a reservation is through Yelp. We had some trouble navigating the reservation system and the person who answered the phone was absolutely no help. I finally had to ask for the manager. A short explanation later and we had a reservation. Why didn&#39;t the person answering the phone just explain? Poor customer service. Lots of places crying for customers to come back. A little customer service can go a long way.

My family and I made a reservation well in advance for outdoor seating only. Given the recent COVID guidance and considerations, we verified with a representative of the restaurant that our seating would be outdoor seating. Upon arrival we were told we could not sit outdoors because the restaurant only had one server for the night and the patio/outdoor seating was full at the moment. This is unacceptable. At the very least, a courtesy call to those that reserved a table could have been made. Or the manager could have assisted the outdoor server as she stood there at the front desk not doing much and not offering any reasonable solution. So we drove 25 mins for dinner and did not get the opportunity to eat.

There&#39;s always a problem at Cheesecake Factory. I have experienced problems myself and read the many bad recent reviews. I hadn&#39;t been there in a long time and would have never gone back but it is one of my niece&#39;s favorite places. I wanted to get something to drop off for her in celebration of her birthday a couple of days ago. I did curbside pickup. My niece said her meal was good but my Mexican tortilla salad had the driest chicken that I have ever seen. Like they can&#39;t see that when they put it in the container. And I didn&#39;t get the avocado cream sauce, salsa or sour cream that was supposed to come with it. All you have to do is read all of the reviews. There are restaurants that are consistently good and would appreciate customers&#39; business in this time, rather than an overpriced chain that has horrible honest reviews.

Per usual the Cheesecake Factory has managed to shock and aw. <br><br>Chocolate Godiva cheesecake for my birthday and it was amazing. I needed someone else to help me finish this beautiful cheesecake.<br><br>My meal ended up being veggie appetizers, and I did not miss meat at all. The tempura fried cauliflower was almost too good... I honestly did not want to share. The sauce was sweet with a touch of heat, served with ranch. The stuffed mushrooms were melt in your mouth too.

When I rate a place I judge it on categories. I am placing Cheesecake Factory in the chain restaurant category. With that said I am giving them 5 stars. CCF is always consistent with great food no matter the location. Prices are very reasonable for portion sizes.  Many chain often have trouble with consistency from one location to the next but that is not the case with CCF.  Normally I wouldnt order a steak at this type of restaurant but I did and it was very well prepared and tasted great. I passed on cheesecake but the varieties seem almost unlimited. If you haven&#39;t been to a CCF before make sure that you give them a try. Actually I have found that everytime Im in the area of one I tend to always choose it over other options.

It&#39;s a chain restaurant but I like it anyway.<br><br>I generally try to eat local, small, not chains while traveling and at home. But Cheesecake Factory, because of their extensive menu and quality, is a place that I enjoy.<br><br>Our wait was short because we arrived at 11:45 am, and Kristin was a fun, bright, great compliment to our delicious meal.<br><br>This was our anniversary lunch (26 years, yeah us!) and Kristin asked if we were celebrating anything special, that&#39;s why the plates are decorated in my photo. That was a fun, cute surprise.<br><br>Let&#39;s start with warm bread and real butter! Great crusty white bread and a pumpernickel/oat bread with a great flavor.<br><br>I usually order the skinnylicious veggie salad which has everything in it; cucumber, edamame, asparagus, beets, apples, radicchio, romaine all lightly dressed in a skinny vinaigrette. Yum!!!! <br><br>Today I ordered the Shepherd&#39;s pie which is delicious! Delicious beef gravy, zucchini, corn, carrots, peas, mushrooms, beef with a disk of cheesy mashed potatoes on top.<br><br>Hubby had the bang bang chicken and shrimp which was served with a lovely sweet/hot (notes of coconut, cream and heat) sauce and white (or brown) rice your choice. I tried it and enjoyed it but really wanted my pie and room for cheesecake. He finished it so I&#39;d say he really liked it.<br><br>Dessert, all the cheesecakes sound so good , I normally don&#39;t order dessert and try to be &#34;good&#34; but we both order cheesecake today.<br><br>Chocolate mousse- dark chocolate cheesecake, chocolate mousse and shaved chocolate on top. With the most delicious whipped cream, I could eat buckets of it!!!<br><br>Banana cream cheesecake, so good! Lighter than you would think, not overly sweet, banana cheesecake, Bavarian cream, Fresh bananas and delicious whipped cream. My new favorite!<br><br>The wait is always long but if you can sneak in on a weekday at lunch it&#39;s a consistently good, not too pricy place for lunch.

Obviously the best things there are the cheesecake can&#39;t go wrong with any of them I got a Caesar chicken salad and it was OK I could&#39;ve made a better one at home I was waitress was amazing! <br>My son got the Fettuccine Alfredo ,it was all right.

Maybe being from Chicago spoiled me (Chicago has a bunch of these restaurants around) but this must be the only Cheesecake Factory in Indiana because at 4:50pm on a Saturday THE WAIT FOR 2 WAS 2 HOURS! I&#39;m sorry, but that is absolutely ridiculous and although the food is good I would recommend skipping dining here all together and just getting a piece of cheesecake to go and eating at home. <br><br>I understand that the staff can&#39;t help the restaurant being busy but once we finally reached the counter to inquire about the wait time (yes, we stood in a line for 10 to even get to the hostess desk) the hostess didn&#39;t even look up to greet us (she looked absolutely miserable and I don&#39;t blame her-HAHA) and just asked if we wanted to wait for 2 hours for a table. No thanks. I&#39;ll be sure to eat at this chain back at home in Chicago. <br><br>*Pro top: NO RESERVATIONS

We were treated like cattle.  They messed up our table, told to wait for the next table without apology.  Had to follow up with the hostess to ask her after an hour wait if they plan to seat us since people kept being seated and were given the look of &#34;don&#39;t bother us we are busy&#34;.  They were seriously put off by our presence.   We left and don&#39;t plan on coming again.

The service today was terrible. After being seated we waited twenty minutes for the server to come. After she came she told us that it was the end of our shift and she could only take our drink orders. After waiting another 26 minutes or so again she came back and brought water no drinks and said we may end up with 2 more different servers. After another 15 minutes she brought our drinks and took our food orders and said she is leaving and someone else will bring the food. After another 45 minutes the food finally came. The food was ok although the avocado on my salad was brown. Won&#39;t be coming back to keystone again mind-you this was a Sunday late afternoon.

I tried calling ahead to check the wait time and the phones are disconnected when you try to go past the automated message. Then the yelp reservation page does not work at all. I tried to do both things several months ago and they refused to make a reservation over the phone and the yelp app wouldn&#39;t work then either. Once again I&#39;ll be going to a different restaurant because this one can&#39;t make the tools they made work for their customers.

Weekends are always busy here. But at least you have the mall to walk around. We just come back earlier than they say. It took an hour when we were told 40, so that was long. But we like the cheesecake and had a giftcard and 2 slices free from the Black Friday promotion. When you only come a few times a year it can be worth it. I do think they should take reservations. <br>Portions are HUGE. Like 3 people could share so big. This time I got the Louisiana chicken pasta with fried chicken breast and Cajun pasta. I really liked the spice level. Usually bread is free flowing, but we had to ask for more. I do like the butter comes in a bowl now and our the dish was warmed so it was nice and melty. <br>We got our cheesecake to go. I liked my white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake. There was just no way to eat it right after lunch.

My daughters 18th birthday! Service starts out good then went down hill.....Was it the fact that three dinners were messed up, We didnt even complain...WE DIDNT CHANGE OUR SERVICE DID! Even though the errors were from the kitchen. We didnt blame him, but it seems as though he started to have a problem with us. He forgot about her bday desserts, then asked  us to sing ourselves....(we could have done that at home. )earlier we heard another group of employees singing! Why couldn&#39;t my daughters get the same treatment on her 18th birthday!

Covid or not the lady who is working the cheesecake counter on 9/20 pm was the rudest person that I have ever felt with no reason to treat people like trash we where celebrating our wedding and she was awful

We had a reservation for 6pm but didn&#39;t get a table until 630 but considering what was going on I understood. Had the chicken and shrimp gumbo and it was seasoned perfectly. The servers were really quick and knowledgeable. Prices seemed a little high but you get a lot of food so you have plenty of leftovers for lunch. I definitely will be back.

Absolutely terrible dining experience. It started out well, then went to crap. Started with drinks at the bar. That went well, bartenders were friendly. I left a $50 bill on a $37 tab. Then we were seated.. ordered appetizers, and halfway through the egg rolls, a bartender comes over with a receipt and says &#34;you guys need to close your tab&#34; to which we informed her we already had. In hindsight, I should have asked for my change back. Then began the 30 minute wait for our entree&#39;s. Of course my mothers came out incorrect. The person who brought it out couldn&#39;t quite understand that it was messed up, and the exchange in explaining to her the difference  between white rice and brown rice took a bit too long. It was &#34;fixed&#34; quickly with an obvious re plating of the same food with the rice swapped out. By this point I was ready to leave this establishment. I mentioned our displeasure to the server who was unapologetic, and instead said &#34;I&#39;ll send someone over.&#34; I guess manners are only for management. Someone I&#39;m assuming the manager came over and spoke with us. She informed us that we got our food in about the normal time according to the ticket. I&#39;m now guessing the ticket wasn&#39;t put in after taking our order and that was the hold up. We were offered free items, but we&#39;d had it with this place. Just not what I&#39;d expect from Cheesecake Factory.. but hey Monday&#39;s right.

I came here for my birthday with my husband.  We are fairly gracious restaurant guests and didn&#39;t raise a stink when our food hadn&#39;t come in 40 minutes. At 45 minutes I made eye contact with a manager, and she asked how we were doing, I shared confused because we hadn&#39;t received our food yet (and the people at the table behind us who got there 15 minutes after we did had already received their meals). She checked on it and shared with us there was a glitch and they would expedite our meals and offered us fries or a salad while we waited. We took her up on that offer and felt that was nice due to the delay. When our food arrived about 15 minutes later, we were shocked that our meals were delivered without the sides. When they asked us if we wanted anything, they simply gave those to us instead of our meal sides we ordered. And, both sandwiches (at this point and hour and 20 minutes late) were served not how we ordered them (with no mayo and his sauce on the side). My sandwich and my husbands were COVERED in mayo and saucer but no one came over to see how the order came out. My order seemed like it had just come off the grill,  it my husbands sandwich seemed like it had been sitting under the warmer for 45 minutes as his chicken seemed sweaty and his bread was rock hard. <br><br>We left feeling disappointed that we ended up waiting an hour 20 for food, and being offered a courtesy item, that then impacted our meals we ordered, and that even then They were brought to us incorrectly. <br><br>when our bill came I was SHOCKED to see that nothing was comped or discounted. I&#39;ve reached out to CHeesecake factory online and hope to get a response.

A huge shoutout and THANK YOU to, manager Todd, hostess Dawn and server Amalia!!!! The 3 of you made our experience amazing!! The 3 of you took customer service to a whole new level!!! Very much appreciated!!

Gluten Free: Meh, they have a few options,but limited.<br>Casein Free: Verify with server. Limited at best.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is a hodgepodge of what can seem like never ending options for some. I mean the menu itself could be considered a mini-food novel.<br><br>Highlights/Tips:<br><br>+Menu- It&#39;s extensive and a bit frightening for those who have a hard time deciding on what to eat. There really is a little bit of everything for everyone<br><br>+People with food allergies, gluten specific- the number of choices is extremely limited. Back in the day a pasta used to be offered; however, that appears to no longer be the case. That being said, the risk of cross contamination is extremely high due to the type of foods served here, and you were taking a substantial risk, even with every effort to be made to minimize due to the kitchen setup, but hey, that&#39;s the case with most restaurants you go that don&#39;t have a separate dedicated cooking/prep area.<br><br>-Portion sizes/calorie count- If you&#39;re trying to be good a watch your waistline, your willpower better be strong, because the portion sizes are huge and calorie count matches. Just don&#39;t look at the count on the menu if you want to be left in the dark<br><br>-Parking/wait- this location is at the Keystone Mall, so parking can be a little bit of a pain in the ass, especially during peak times. Waits, especially during the weekends can be long during Sunday Brunch<br><br>- Noise level- If your looking to sit back and relax and have a nice conversation, this isn&#39;t the place. The high ceilings and close tables contributes to the increased noise. <br><br>+ They have a separate counter for the Cheesecake if you are looking to come in and purchase any without dining in.<br><br>Overall, for me, the Cheesecake isn&#39;t for me, but hey, Celiacs and Cheesecakes generally aren&#39;t a good combo in general.

I did a take-out yesterday evening Sunday 4/19/20 of Scrimp Scampi&#39;, my very favorite. It was very unsatisfactory. The single petite container of sauce, wasn&#39;t tasty and flavorful, as it is when served in restaurant. The Scrimp was breaded!!! It&#39;s never breaded, it&#39;s grilled!!! I&#39;m so sad to say I was VERY Disappointed and unsatisfied with my meal. I&#39;ll never order again to under COVID19.

Ordered online for Mother&#39;s Day.  Received email confirmation of my order.  Went to pick up at appointed time - told they are running 45 minutes late in order prep.  Waited 50 minutes to then find out that they didn&#39;t even have my CONFIRMED order.  Left empty handed.

Very average food and restaurant overall. This chain is completely overrated. Went here for dinner last night to celebrate my sister&#39;s birthday. The only thing they did for her is sing after they brought out a cheesecake they charged us for. I&#39;ve never seen a restaurant charge you for dessert during a birthday celebration. Apart from that, look at that menu and those calories next to each meal. All I can say is this is America, and this is RIDICULOUS. How does a person eat over 1000 calories for any of the dishes on the manu? We got a Santa Fe salad which was a large portion but good to share, and guess what, even the salad tasted sweet. This dish did not seem like it should taste sweet whatsoever. I&#39;m guessing there&#39;s a ton of sugar in the dressing. Be conscious of what you eat, people. I don&#39;t recommend coming here.

Melanie made me feel like I was at my local Las Vegas neighborhood Cheesecake Factory.  She would fit in there cause she&#39;s so personable &amp; has fantastic recommendations, although she only eats fish.  I asked her about the Fire Roasted Artichokes, she said people highly recommend it so that&#39;s where we started.  Three meaty medium-sized artichokes w/ a delish green aioli sauce.  Very filling &amp; tasty!  <br><br>Also I asked her about the Spicy Chicken Pasta.  She said she loved the sauce that has a bit of honey sweetness.  I added some red pepper flakes cause I like extra spicy, as my work partner&#39;s mouth was on fire as it already was.  I am not a good judge of spicy.  The sweetness of the honey toned it down for me &amp; was a great touch.  Next time, cause I love peas, I would add more peas &amp; no asparagus.  <br><br>Totally right on point Melanie &amp; very large so sharing both the appetizer &amp; this entree were more than enough.  I highly recommend this location &amp; staff.

The staff is so unorganized. I waited 45 minutes for two slices of cheesecake. My order sat on the counter because it seemed that the staff members on duty on know how to do one task. If you&#39;re going here I hope you plan on lots of wait time.

After calling in March (during the Covid shutdown) I asked if my coupons for 2 slices of cheesecake would be valid after the expiration (since the restaurant was not open). I was told that the coupons would be accepted until the end of summer. I called, specifically because the drive to and from the restaurant was over two hours. Today, when I stopped in, the management refused to honor my coupons. I specifically asked my waitress about the coupon before ordering and she said &#34;it should be fine.&#34; However, she got off work during our visit for the shift change and another server came to replace her. We had already ordered so we couldn&#39;t change our minds about eating here at this point. Had we been told at the beginning of the meal that the promise made to us over the phone wouldn&#39;t be honored, we wouldn&#39;t have eaten here. I am disappointed in the lack of professionalism with management at this location. Be wary of promises over the phone from this location--especially when driving a long distance.

We like places with variety. I&#39;m not going to eat a burger at the Cheesecake Factory, but I do enjoy there specialties menu! We get the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp and Bang-Bang Shrimp dish. They are yummy every time. We have been to multiple locations, but this particular location was the best!! The shrimp was cooked perfectly. I love my seafood cooked thoroughly, but it does suck when it&#39;s cooked too much. Also our waiter was so nice and other waiters and waitresses were helpful when needed. Just a great environment. We will be back to this location. No longer going to the others, great food and service. Thank you!!

I recently watched Tastemade&#39;s &#34;I ate Cheesecake Factory for a week&#34; and if I didn&#39;t have to worry about putting on the pounds I would totally do this. All you CF fans know that the menu is ginormous and there are so many options that there is no way you can get bored! If I were to guess, I&#39;ve only had maybe 10% of the menu and I&#39;ve been going to Cheesecake Factory since 1995 (when I was 6 *cough* cause I&#39;m only 29 *cough cough*). BTW, if you are ever in SF, you should visit the Cheesecake Factory in Union Square. <br><br>Items I would recommend:<br><br>Appetizers: Korean Fried Cauliflower, Stuffed Mushrooms, Chicken Samosas and Fresh Basil, Tomato and Fontina Flatbread<br><br>Salad: Seared Tuna Takaki Salad<br><br>Main: Marghertia Pizza, Pasta Carbonara, Shrimp w/Angel Hair pasta, Seared Ahi Tuna<br><br>BRUNCH. Yaaaassss, do brunch, I love the California Avocado Omelette. Am I bias because I&#39;m a Cali girl..? Abso-freakin&#39;-lutely. But it is very good. <br><br>Cheesecakes: ALL OF THEM. You don&#39;t get this hot, chunky bod w/o trying every single cheesecake *wink wink.*<br><br>This location: Dinner rush does have a little bit of a wait, but I&#39;ll opt for sitting in the bar area when that happens. Staff is always nice, food seems to come out in a timely manner. <br><br>Seriously tho, if someone wants to fund me eating Cheesecake Factory for a week AND a personal trainer I would be totally be down for that.

soooooooo many options of food and cheesecake to choose from. honestly too many for me. it was a tad bit overwhelming. my mom and i split the egg roll sampler which came out quickly. and was suppppper delicous. my mom got the nacho appetizer and i got the chicken romano (server said was the closest to the chicken parmesan). food took an extremely long time to come out. food was delicous and huge portions. we ended up taking a bit of everything home minue the shared sampler. <br>our server wasn&#39;t very attentive which was a bit disappointing, and when we asked specific things about the menu she wasn&#39;t quite sure. we went on a monday at 1pm. so we were after the lunch rush, so not sure why she wasn&#39;t as present.<br>overall minus the experience with the server and slowness of the main dishes, experience was decent. I&#39;d expect a little better from a finer restraunt.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of those places that always reminds me of happy memories. I remember being a kid and thinking it was the fanciest restaurant I had ever been to and then I remember when I first moved to Indy as a young adult and it was the only chain restaurant that I recognized. It&#39;s still just as busy now as it was then. Plan to wait for hours on the weekends (but you can enjoy browsing next door Crate &amp; Barrel while you wait) and prepare to eat huge amounts of delicious, unhealthy food. I usually try to split a pasta dish with a friend so I can focus on the cheesecake. I skip their alcohol list since I think it&#39;s too expensive and I can only eat so much sugar in one sitting. Overall, I hope The Cheesecake Factory continues to serve their delicious food and stays in business bringing more happy memories for forever.

If I could give 0 stars, I would. My family and I rarely have time to get together to enjoy a nice meal, so my parents arrived at 11am. They were the first to be sat, and quickly ordered and appetizer and their food before I arrived to meet them since I have a very quick lunch break. I went ahead and ordered my food. Our appetizer came out (egg roll sampler) wasn&#39;t anything to write home about. Shortly after, my food (fettuccini Alfredo) came out 5 mins after we finished our appetizer, while no one else had their food yet. Come to take a bite of the pasta and it&#39;s completely over salted.<br><br>It took about 10 minutes to try and get anyone&#39;s attention as to why my food came out before theirs (when it should be brought out all at once) and why it took so long to get the rest of my family their food. Finally, we were able to get the manager over to our table and let her know of the situation. They took back the dish, and then brought out the rest of everyone else&#39;s dishes (all pasta) only to find that they too were just as salty if not saltier. We managed to get the manager over to our table again, she said she would make it her top priority to make sure our dishes came out properly. At this point it&#39;s 11:50, the amount of time it takes to rectify a table&#39;s order shouldn&#39;t take over 30 mins on Wednesday lunch. And at the end, she didn&#39;t even comp anything or asked if she could make the situation better.<br><br>I&#39;ve never had such an appalling experience from a chain restaurant. I would expect more from a place if I&#39;m spending an average of $18-21 a plate.<br><br>We will not be back.

I&#39;ve always had a great experience here. I love the fact that they have a skinny menu dedicated to healthier options. I tried the Cobb salad and it was excellent except it was light on the cheese. Service is usually very good as well. Be prepared for long waits at peak times. They also offer a nice outdoor dining area as well. Restaurant can get a bit loud at times as well. The alcoholic drinks are also priced quite high but the taste is phenomenal

I would probably give 4/5 but our food took FOREVER to come out. My mom is not someone to point out slow service but she questioned why it was taking so long. Our server was very nice but the kitchen must&#39;ve been backed up because the food was taking a lot of time to get to everyone&#39;s tables around us as well. <br><br>I got the fish and chips. Not bad but nothing to write home about. I usually get overwhelmed by their menu and have a hard time deciding. I have 2-3 &#34;go to&#34; meals that I usually choose from but I decided to venture outside of my norm. Don&#39;t think I&#39;ll do that again, ha. <br><br>Overall, not the worst visit or meal I&#39;ve had but wasn&#39;t the best either.

The Cheesecake Factory has by far the largest and most diverse menu I have ever seen at a restaurant.  There really needs to be an index in the back to find the page you need!<br><br>We have been coming here for years and have tried many different meals and different cuisines.  We have never been disappointed.  Always good quality and large portions.  We also love the bread that they serve before the meal.  I&#39;m not sure what flavor the darker one is, but it is delicious!<br><br>The crazy thing is that as many times as I have been there, I have never tried the Cheesecake.  If you want Cheesecake, you really have to select a smaller entree or maybe just an appetizer.

Date night! We have been here several times and each time has been a great experience. The long wait always stinks but it&#39;s a given on a Friday and Saturday night. We had a 30 minute wait, not bad! And we were seated outside on one of the nicest days of summer so far! Our server was super nice and quick. We splurged and both got awesome pasta dishes. Very filling and tasty. I ordered the Spicy chipotle chicken penne pasta but subbed out the chicken for shrimp. It was so yummy! Wine was great and heavy pours are always nice :) you have to try the lemon cheesecake.. you won&#39;t regret it! <br><br>Overall we had a great experience and can&#39;t wait to visit again!

The very first thing I tried from The Cheesecake Factory was one of their signature cheesecakes. Since then I have tried several of their other cakes. <br><br>This time I went with their 30th Anniversary Chocolate Cake and was amazed at how they can create so many delicious cakes! Of course, I do have a sweet-tooth but that does not take away from the great dishes on their menu. <br><br>I also tried the fried shrimps platter and their fish and chips (yes, I like seafood ). The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s servings are generally very generous, however, this particular time it seemed a bit less. The shrimps and fish also seemed a bit over-fried. <br><br>Nevertheless, it was a great overall experience capped off with the amazing cheesecake!

We went here for my birthday.  I was pleasantly surprised to be seated within five minutes since it was during Sunday Brunch.   The staff was amazing.  <br><br>They offer a variety of items on the menu some of which can be made gluten free. Just make sure you let your server know your dietary needs.<br><br> The restaurant was very clean and food portion was good.

The drinks were over priced.  The cheesecake was good but with the name cheesecake factory I would expect it to be good. The weight and management staff were extremely pretinsious and we were having a good time at our table with our conversation. Within 5 mins, Apparently we had too much of a good time to offend the pretentiousness of the kitchen management staff and so they had to come over and have a word with us. This is the first and only time I will be there.

Dear lord what is this menu?! It&#39;s like... toooo big, but the decisions I made were great ones! I had the Pasta Napoletana and it brought back memories of the pizzas my family made when I was a kid, so I was in love from the first bite! I also had the Very Cherry Ghirardelli cheesecake and it was pretty dang delicious.

Love Korean cauliflower, edamame, and Guacamole egg roles to start with.<br>Move to Chicken medirea, steak Diane, angel hair pasta, add pumpernickel bread with real butter.<br>Asparagus oh yes and corn succotash  and then YES it&#39;s bring on cheese cake!!!!!!<br><br>OMG. <br>BRING ME THE WHEEL BARROW !
We came to the Cheesecake Factory to celebrate! They made it a happy time and we enjoyed our service! The portion was large, as always!

Stopped to pick up a cheesecake we decided on the whole cake because it&#39;s cheaper than buying four slices lol.  Not sure if it was a good idea, I&#39;ve been having it for days  cheesecake never disappoints love love love it. We had the 30th anniversary! It&#39;s to die for  do yourself and your waistline a favor and opt out for a slice not the whole cake

A few couples were trying to find something to eat this past weekend and I mentioned The Cheesecake Factory.  I have only been there 2 or 3 times over several years. Of course my hubby shot it down.  The other couples loved the idea so he ventured out of his comfort zone and to OUR surprise WE absolutely loved it.  He had a Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo and I had The Factory Combo, Steak Diane and Chicken Madeira.  Everything was delicious and I cannot wait to go back. I will have to try it a couple more times to ensure they r deserving of 5 Stars but as of today they surely have my vote. Excellent food, Excellent waiter, nice atmosphere

It always sounds like a good idea, but somehow I&#39;m always disappointed. I got pizza, but it&#39;s not on par with Bazbaux or the like. The Caesar salad was not fresh. Brown lettuce gives me the heebie-jeebies. <br><br>Flavors are average. Prices are above average. A good place to come if everyone wants a different ethnic food.

This my first time coming to the cheesecake factory all I got was dessert and I got the Oreo cheesecake I got to say that&#39;s five stars all day Oreo cheesecake must try. The mean they have is Big and a lot of different types of food on their menu from orange chicken to cheesesteaks I would be coming back here soon

There was a hair in my food so they sent it back and were nice enough to only charge me for the replacement meal.  My waiter thought it would get him a better tip to place 2 meals on my tab because Another plate was sent to my table.  I was pleasant and understanding, even when the rest of my party finished eating and I was still waiting for food.  He made sure to point out that he didn&#39;t charge me for the plate with the hair in it.  I complained that I was told I would be getting a discount.  He finally decided he was more likely to get a tip from the rest of the table if he dealt with it.

Walked into the restaurant and the hostess looked daggers into my husband and I. We had a reservation and she mumbled something incoherent. Never got a text confirming the table was ready. We NOT be back soon. Thank you Cheesecake. It was an eye opening experience.

Basic...meh, but it&#39;s hot outside and they have beverages and air conditioning. I mean, it&#39;s. it a speciality, it&#39;s a chain. <br><br>* the ultimate margarita is &#34;knock you down&#34; delicious. <br><br>* the Greek salad is grade A.<br><br>* the dynamite shrimp get two thumbs up<br><br>* the Cuban egg rolls were sorta fatty, and not that flavorful. They probably should not serve these. <br><br>In any case, it&#39;s a chain, they did well. See you again on a rainy Wednesday in January.

I am a big fan of this chain, but this location is not a great one. The food always takes a really long time to come out. Today&#39;s experience was particularly bad. It was 55 minutes from the time we sat down until we received our meals. To be fair, they did send a manager over to ask if we wanted a soup or salad on the house, but 1) Cheesecake Factory portions are enormous and we would have barely touched our meals if we&#39;d had bread plus soup or salad and 2) my husband and I both feared that accepting this extra food would have delayed the food we&#39;d ordered even more, and we didn&#39;t want to do that to our (understandably) impatient toddler. My husband and I were both a little annoyed that they didn&#39;t offer to comp any of the food we actually ordered, especially the kids meal, which was only $6 or so and came out at least five minutes after the adult meals (rule #1 of family-friendly restaurants should be that kids meals come out at least as fast as adult meals!). When the food finally came out, none of it was very warm.<br><br>Food taking forever to come out of the kitchen isn&#39;t the waitstaff&#39;s fault, but our waitress wasn&#39;t very attentive and seemed inexperienced. We placed a massive cheesecake order to go (they freeze well) and she kept asking us if we wanted it to go or to eat it there (um, of course we&#39;re not going to sit there and eat SIX slices of cheesecake while our toddler fusses!). The only good thing I can say about the service today is that the person bussing tables in our area was superb. She doted on our daughter and was very attentive. I wish I had gotten her name to commend her to management.<br><br>There&#39;s almost always a wait here - well, I imagine there might not be at 3 pm on a Tuesday, but I&#39;ve never seen it without a wait on a weekend, even at &#34;off&#34; peak times. If you dine at off-peak times, the wait is usually manageable (10-20 minutes) though and you have the whole mall to explore while you wait, which is nice.

Got takeout and the food was so sub par from the meals I have had in the restaurant I don&#39;t want to ever go back even after covid.  Wish I would have took a pic.  I got the oriental chicken salad and my husband got the bang bang chicken and shrimp.  My salad had barely 5 pieces of chicken and none of the usual toppings.  His looked like dog barf with a blob of rice in the middle. Cafeteria food was only thing to describe it.  Never going back.  Horrible curbside service which ended up being that we had to go inside and sort thru multiple bags everywhere on tables waiting to go out.

This is one of my favorite chain restaurant. I come here and I normally enjoy their food. Only time when I don&#39;t enjoy is when I end up waiting too long to get seated and getting my food. I enjoyed my skinilicious lunch special shrimp soft taco.

I went to cheese cake factory for my best friends birthday and we had a wonderful night! When you can walk in, the lights are very dim and relaxing.. the host and hostess were very accommodating and nice. We went on a Saturday and they told us it would be a 2 hour wait, it actually wasn&#39;t a long  wait at all!  it was also a group of 10! Lol <br><br>We sat down, ordered drinks and appetizers! My friend ordered the calamari and it was delicious. She had to send the first order in because it was cold :( but they made up for it! <br><br>I went basic last night and ordered the Caesar salad  it was exactly what I thought it would be so it was a good meal! The portion size at Cheese cake factor is incredibly large! I mean anything you order will be extremely large, so definitely SHARE if you don&#39;t have a huge appetite!

I&#39;m sorry but I will never go back here again for one I got a meal yesterday I got the cheddar burger for this they had to cook it medium well I wasn&#39;t sure so i said ok but let me tell y&#39;all I took one bite out this burger and it was pink as hell like ok it was supposed to show a little pink but the whole burger was pink anyway I talked to the manager and this Bald headass said we can&#39;t take it off the receipt because it&#39;s part of their policy and mind you I didn&#39;t eat the sandwich I took one bite and they couldn&#39;t take it back and even if I order something else it would have still been added aint that some bullshit

We had lunch here today and it was pretty amazing. Everything from the Factory Chicken Nachos, to the Chicken Marsala, to the Dulce De Leche Cheesecake was d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s!!! Thanks Nichole for being so attentive and taking such great care of us!!! It was pretty busy but we only had to wait about 15 minutes. It was well worth it though!!!

Cheesecake Factory should be exactly that and only that.<br>Food was absolutely terrible.I think the menu is too big so its probably frozen.. <br><br>I ordered lasagna, worst I ever had. Told my waiter when he was taking the check, he came back and said the manager said, I didn&#39;t tell them soon enough, because my uneaten lasagna wasn&#39;t enough evidence..<br><br>My son ordered a Mac and cheese burger,which wasn&#39;t even half eaten,  I never seen him not eat a cheeseburger I tried it, it was not good.. I won&#39;t go back for food. Only cheesecake, until they ruin that to.. This was the Keystone Crossing CF in Indy. Don&#39;t go for the food, just the dessert . It&#39;s not the first time I learned this lesson..

I ordered online and went to pick it up,. However the service was really slow and bit unorganized. Even though I got the text that my food was ready to pick up, I waited long time. The food was cold as well.

This place is always busy, I love coming here to get there wings and buffalo blasts chicken. This is place is connected to the keystone fashion mall, always crowed hard to find a seat and long waits. Is it worth it yes and no, when I&#39;m having my craving yes when I&#39;m not no. The problem is it&#39;s the only cheese cake factory in Indianapolis so that&#39;s why everyone flock here. It&#39;s a great place to eat just get prepare to wait.<br>REAL TALK

All around this was just a bad experience. Two stars for the taste of the food only. We went on a Saturday night about 11 pm. Super busy but we were able to snag a table fairly quickly. Once seated we couldn&#39;t talk amongst each other because it is very loud in there. We waited a long time for a server to even greet us then another long time to get our beverages. She said she&#39;d be back to get our order and we kept waiting. When we finally did order our appetizers took about 25&#39; but they were hot and good to eat. The cheesecake took about the same time to be delivered and they were just ok. For the price I expected a better quality but it didn&#39;t do anything for my taste buds. It was the birthday cake and the banana and cream one. Both just Meh.....  for just an appetizer and dessert it took us a little bit over 2 hours from the time we sat to the time we left. To me that&#39;s unacceptable. I understand they were very busy but what is irritating is when my server goes ghost on me but is quickly there to grab the paid bill for her tip!<br><br>Update: management replied to my review thanking me for bringing this to their attention and hope I give them another try. I wouldn&#39;t recommend this establishment to anyone else let alone go there again. To many other amazing places to eat in Indy.

I realized I come here a lot and haven&#39;t left a review ! So without further ado, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. Number one thing is, it&#39;s always busy. If you&#39;re wanting a quick lunch, probably not going to happen. I&#39;ve noticed if you get there around 11:30-12 sometimes you can beat the crowd but just barely. So be prepared to wait or send someone ahead to get on the wait list.I&#39;m pretty sure they don&#39;t take reservations. The food menu is vast, and by vast I mean....whatever you&#39;re in the mood for ...they probably have it! My favorite thing is the gumbo and jumbalya, I know totally random but I love it! The prices vary but you&#39;ll be paying higher for your meal for sure. Service is always nice and polite. I&#39;ve always gotten my food in a decent amount of time. And of course the cheesecake! You can&#39;t go wrong with any cheesecake.... except not getting any.

My friends love The Cheesecake Factory haha.  In the past I&#39;d go for special occasions like birthdays, parent&#39;s day, graduation. . . But I&#39;ve run out of special occasions so we just go when we feel like it now.  <br><br>The portion sizes are large! But you&#39;ll definitely want to save room for cheesecake/dessert at the end of the meal~  The servers are always very accommodating even when it&#39;s pretty busy.  Typically I assume there will be a line on weekends and the lighting might be a little dim for some people during the evening.

I enjoy this chain but this location needs work. Slow service, low quality food, got my order wrong. Lots of complaints in my section as well. Upper management: if you read these reviews, take note! There&#39;s some quality and service issues here that are costing you business!
We ordered food online using Cheesecake Factory website.  They promised food to be ready in 30 min.  Had to wait an hour at restaurant.

You know how as you age random things from your past seem to get smaller? This is exactly how I feel about the cheesecake here! It used to be this larger than life piece of Heaven that you just knew was worth every penny. Tonight it was a measly weakling staring up at me like a pathetic fraud. It seemed to communicate almost apologetically that I had made a mistake and should have chosen a grocery store model instead. Sigh. Gone are the days of the famous slices from above. Just not worth it anymore.

I absolutely love this place ! Customer service is always on point and the food never disappoints. The only thing I dislike are the LONG waits. This place is delicious so they are ALWAYS packed. Luckily, the last few times I went we were able to find an open table in the bar area which is open seating. All of their food is good but I especially enjoy the orange chicken and the Louisiana chicken pasta

Oh the cheese cake factory - I don&#39;t come here often because its a little far from our place but my hubby and I came for a date night because we had a gift card - I will say this... The food was SO GOOD!!! We did get some drinks also - What I didn&#39;t like was that the drink menu didn&#39;t have the prices - I know most people don&#39;t care but I&#39;m married to an accountant and you know he was trying to figure out the price on things - that was my only regret. <br><br>The place is fancy and the service was pretty good :) We will be going again... for a special occasion that is...

Pretty restaurant. Lots of artwork and the ceilings are painted. It&#39;s always busy so make a reservation if you can. The menu is huge! They also have a variety of food like burgers, pasta, salads, sandwiches, and Asian. Don&#39;t forget to take delicious cheesecake with you to go- it&#39;s definitely the best part of going here!

Came here for the last meal of 2018 and they did not disappoint. I started off with a lemon drop martini while we waited for about 45 minutes for our table. We then got an appetizer of nachos which were pretty tasty we just had to ask for more cheese for the chips underneath! My boyfriend got the orange chicken and rice and I got the Louisiana chicken pasta. I loved it. If you want something filling and spicy I recommend this meal. Didn&#39;t get pictures this time around but I&#39;ll be sure to the next visit.

Manager(Valerie)  is a liar! <br><br>I ordered a cheesecake and another desert and when I got home I realized I was given the wrong order. I called the manager and she told me to go back so I can get my correct order. I asked her if there was anything she can do to credit me the time and gas I&#39;d be spending going back (I live 30 min away). She said she could only give me another free cheesecake to make up for the mistake her employees made. I asked if there&#39;s any way I can get a gift card, even if it&#39;s only enough to make up for what I originally ordered and she stated she couldn&#39;t because they didn&#39;t sell gift cards at their location. She also said they would have to go through corporate to order the gift card and it would take 3-4 weeks to ship. This sounded very suspicious to me, so I called a few other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s and they said that they are currently selling gift cards at their locations. This clearly shows what management is like at this location and I will not be returning.

Love! <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory at Keystone At The Crossing is my favorite restaurant and the best one in the country..
