I&#39;ve traveled around the U.S dining at others and no one compares. <br><br>The atmosphere is grand and beautiful, even the music playlist is of the top soulful hits past and present. <br><br>The food selections are plentiful and delicious. I am a vegetarian, but my family is not. So there is a wonderful variety for everyone. I love the kale and quinoa salad with avocado egg rolls or firecracker salmon rolls with a goat cheese and beets salad. <br><br>Also, the staff is amazing! Angela at the hostess desk is always so friendly and accommodating. I always hope she&#39;s working to share a few words.

Very disappointed in our dining experience today as we were celebrating with our 84 year-old mom. I normally have superior service, but not today. The wait time was ridiculous for a 2:00 p.m. meal. The hostess said we could be seated right away for outdoor dining, then said it was being bussed; 45 minutes later we were seated. Our server was not knowledgeable of the menu when asked about a pasta dish or soups. Speaking of soup; they served the soup with a huge pasta spoon, not soup spoon. The food took forever to be delivered and then only 2 of the 3 meals came out together and it was another 5-7 minutes for 3rd meal to arrive. We were never checked on, no water refills until long after meal began. I ordered a key lime cheesecake, but received my check before I even got my cheesecake. I told server the bill was wrong since I never received my cheesecake. I assumed she had forgotten my cheesecake, but instead she replied,&#34;It&#39;s not ready yet!&#34; The cheesecake came out in a to-go container, so of course I looked at it before taking it home; it looked awful. The key lime filling was melted and warm. It was 1/4 of the normal size I get. and I told her it looked terrible and she didn&#39;t even offer me a new slice. I called management immediately upon returning home and was hopeful they might offer some compensation, but it was never offered. Poor management, poor service= no more CCF. My money will stay local.

Came here 10/28 to celebrate. This place was packed and stayed packed. We had an hour wait, which was fine because we just explored the mall. They have a bar which was showing some football games but people eat their dinner at the small bar which made it difficult to order a drink or to hang out at the bar.  Because they were so busy, the waiter seemed a bit rushed but was still polite and nice.  During the wait and seeing all the food being served I got a glimpse of the orange chicken and knew from that moment that&#39;s what I was going to get!  They give you bread, which is nothing fancy, just bread with butter.  The meals were served pretty fast with great presentation. <br>Meal taste: got the orange chicken and the chicken was spot on. Perfectly crispy, not all batter and the sauce was good. The veggies were served underneath and they were ok. The rice did not seem fresh which was a bummer and not sure if that&#39;s just their style or if it was a bad batch.  Chicken was 5/5, rice and veggies 2-3/5. <br>Of course you have to get dessert if here. I got the snickers cheese cake which is amazing. (It was brought out in to go container because we got another one, but the snickers was significantly smaller for same price).  We got the celebration cheesecake and because we were celebrating an anniversary, we asked the waiter to have them write it and he did, he even brought a candle out if we wanted it haha. The Cheesecake tasted great. Cheesecake experience 4-5/5.

I hope the food is worth the wait. I called twice they don&#39;t do reservations and won&#39;t tell you the wait time. I get in here to get a three hour wait. Since I have dietary restrictions I decided to wait. Instead of seating my big party for my birthday, they seat all the small parties. The system they are operating is ridiculous. I have never been here, however they are not making this a good birthday or experience .....

Haven&#39;t been here in nearly four years because the food was so bad last time. I think they&#39;ve changed their menu around a little bit. Had the Mexican lettuce wrapped chicken tacos, and they were awesome! Dynamite shrimp is awesome! Service was very slow. Waitress was in no hurry at all, and tables were left sitting for 10-15 minutes waiting for bread and water. Will consider returning in the future because the food has improved and the skinnylicious menu is perfect portion sizes for me.

If you are considering Cheesecake Factory, don&#39;t. It has really gone down hill in the few years since I was there. Waitress failed to notice that the 4 of us did not eat even 1/2 of each of our meals. I informed her that my shrimp was bad. She asked how? I said it taste like rubber and could possibly be bad.  Too loud. But that may be because we were actually trying to talk to each other.
The food was outstanding and the service was wonderful but it is hard to get seated but it is the best place to chill and enjoy cheese cake.

This was the worst experience of my life. Even with all of the restrictions, there were tables upon tables of food that were not being served to the patrons. I waited in line for 45 minutes to pick up my order I had placed 45 minutes prior. Once inside I had to stand in line another 10 minutes. Once I receive my food it was pale in comparison to anything I have ever received from the restaurant before. I understand there&#39;s restrictions, but this is pathetic. I will not go back.

I&#39;ve been here a couple times, and it&#39;s decent. A bit expensive for my taste, but the food always comes out delicious. With gluten intolerance, I always have to check the menus for gluten free options. They have a decent variety of gluten free options. They even have a flourless cheesecake! The Godiva chocolate cheesecake is a total mouth orgasm. It&#39;s SUPER rich, so make sure you split it with someone you really like.<br><br>The service is pretty dodgy. Food takes a while to come out, and it becomes a bit cumbersome when we&#39;re hungry. They have free bread though. But I can&#39;t have any, which kinda sucks. And if you need something, it&#39;s hard to get their attention, even though there are like 20 servers around the dining room. Maybe I&#39;m just too nice to yell across the table.

I&#39;m a consistent Cheesecake Factory fan. State by state, their menu options remain he same. While this may be upsetting to some, I find it rather comforting that the comfort food I like will be available no matter where I am. I will admit that service varies greatly at each location. <br><br>Setting: this restaurant keeps the same aesthetic no matter the geographic location. Wide booths and tables to accommodate your party, big or small. <br><br>Food: great pasta, chicken enchiladas, pizza, and of course cheesecake. The portions are large enough to be shared, I don&#39;t share, but it can easily be done.  The bread they serve is always fresh and moist. They offer a fresh dusting of cheese with each dish upon request. <br><br>I remain a fan

This was an amazingly delicious holiday meal.  This place is always full of energy and seasonal cheer. Food was spot on as usual. Service was even better. This is a busy place but the crew knows how to handle busy. Had appetizers, salads, and entrees.  Each built on the next.  This was a welcome unwind during a whirlwind season. Never have the room for dessert. Best to take with us. They have many locations nationwide, but this one is wonderful. Thanks to staff and management.

National cheesecake day never tasted so good! Since it was half price cheesecake, I tried the banana cream one and it was heavenly! Unfortunately almost everyone else had the same idea and the place was packed! It seems like they are always full around peak dining hours with a decent wait. Try to go between normal meals if you can, but other than that the food was lovely! We were sat outside in the sun without an umbrella which got really hot and uncomfortable super fast. Maybe don&#39;t use that one on super hot days? Definitely a more expensive food place so keep that in mind. My salad was about $15, but it was good!

With my 21st birthday coming up, I decided that The Cheesecake Factory was where I wanted to go with my family and friends for dinner. I had always had great experiences at this location and was excited for some of my family and friends to try it for the first time. Unfortunately, I was smacked in the face with picking this restaurant as our dinner location. I had a large party so I called prior to my birthday and asked if they did reservation for my party size and they said no. This was irritating but nonetheless I decided it would still be worth a 30-45 minute wait. On the day of my birthday, I called and asked how long a wait would be for my party size and the seating manager said if I were to get there in the next 30min-1 hour, we would be seated right away. My party size even got smaller so I called again to make sure it would still be the same. Now mind you, I called THREE different times to make sure that we wouldn&#39;t have a long wait and it was all for nothing! I get to the restaurant and all the manager, who I had previously talked to TWICE, could say was it was a miscommunication and we still had to wait 45 minutes and we couldn&#39;t even be sat together. Once again, remember it&#39;s my birthday dinner so I&#39;m extremely upset by this point! I have never been so disappointed in my life and then we waited almost two hours before we even got sat at our two different tables that were BACK TO BACK! The manger literally told us we would only have to wait at least 45 minutes but I guess that changed and no one decided to tell us. Thank goodness the table across from us finished eating not too long after we got seated and we were able to move tables so that I could see the people who drove hours to be with me for my birthday. Not to mention that I also drove a hour to come this location. The only thing that was worthy of a star at this location was the food and our server. Everything else was downright terrible. My birthday was completely ruined and I more than likely will never return to this location. Complete trash service from the managers shows you how important your business means to them. If you choose to go here, GOOD LUCK!!

We have ate at the one in Jacksonville, FL quite a bit and this one has the same experience. So  it seems they keep the experience the same across multiple locations.<br><br>I ate the best ever peanut butter Thai curry here aka Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp. I have been to authentic Thai restaurants that didn&#39;t even offer this dish. I have made it at home. I have ate it at other restaurants. This is hands down the best ever.<br><br>45 minute waits on Saturday evening. First come first serve if you can get a high top in the bar area and don&#39;t have kids. We were 20 minutes into a 45 minute wait when a high top opened up.

The restaurant was packed when we arrived around 6 pm on a Saturday, but I guess not too surprised. Our wait was an hour and it ended up being a little over that estimate. Luckily, Cheesecake Factory is attached to the mall so we were able to walk around. Their menu has something for everyone- anything from burgers to pasta, chinese to seafood. I went with the tomato basil pasta- I liked it better the last time I got it but still pretty good. Many other options seemed tasty but felt a little rushed to make a decision. We were celebrating our anniversary so I liked that they wrote &#34;happy anniversary&#34; on our cheesecake plate. They brought our other cheesecake out in a to go box, either wanting us out quickly or expecting us not to finish the one on the plate. Overall, will return but the cheesecake is definitely ranked higher than the entrees

Cheesecake Factory is a great place to take your family . Not only do they have a huge variety of different cheesecakes , but they have a huge food menu. I pretty much get the same two things Chicken Madeira and Lemon Herb Roasted chicken. They are my favorites. I also love the red velvet cheesecake ! I always go to this location because it&#39;s about 15 minutes away from my house, but I prefer the greenwood location. I just think the greenwood location has better tasting food and the staff is very quick. This location is located at the fashion mall so it&#39;s very common that the parking lot is hectic and wait times for food maybe 30 minutes or longer. I would suggest coming here on weekdays or late at night on the weekend.

This restaurant was phenomenal! I loved my waitress and despite the crowd, out food came out at a good time. We ordered bread which was amazing as usual. We got some of the pastas and burgers but when it came to dessert, the cheesecake was fantastic!! I strongly suggest the cookie dough one. It&#39;s perfect after a good meal- not too rich but not flavorless either. It was a bit of a wait but we were able to shop around. Right when we sat down it seemed like the waitress can out and asked what we would like to drink. Overall I loved the meal and the service. Can&#39;t wait to come again!!

We visit this location pretty regularly. Unfortunately, things are changing for the worst. The cheesecake slices are smaller and the service hit a record low this evening. <br>I had a drink this evening that was truly bitter, couldn&#39;t drink it. We told our server and noticed no change in our ticket. We had to ask if it could be removed. The server inquired with the manager, who never came to our table. The server came back to say &#34;they don&#39;t remove drinks.&#34;

Oh boy this place is good. You better bring yourself a large appetite though bc these portion sizes are absolutely massive. <br><br>Our waitress was very kind and helpful, bringing us bread after bread, and water after water. Although the restaurant was very busy and I could see her running around, she made sure to keep everyone happy.<br><br>The one downside to The Cheesecake Factory is the high end pricing and how busy it can get. It is not a rarity for this place to have over an hour wait (which really shows you how popular it is). <br><br>It&#39;s great for family dining or a date, or even a quick stop in after a long day at the mall!!

My family and I visited the Cheesecake Factory at the Fashion Mall located in Indianapolis.   Fortunately, we didn&#39;t have a wait to be seated the evening we went as it was on Christmas Eve.  Our waiter was extremely friendly and efficient but our food was average at best.  My husband and I ordered 2 different steak dinners and mine was rather dry and bland, vegetables were overcooked as well.  While I know this is not a steak place, I still expected better than what I was served that night.  My daughter had the 3 cheese pasta which was just ok as well.<br><br>We did indulged in a slice of original cheesecake with strawberry topping for dessert as this is what the restaurant is known for - happy to report it did not disappoint on the dessert front but a slice can run a minimum of $6.00 - a bit expensive in my opinion but it was Christmas Eve and we were celebrating.<br><br>This is a chain restaurant - nothing to write home about but still glad we tried the place out.  I doubt we will be returning anytime soon.

I do, and always have, liked this place. It&#39;s usually crowded, yes, and fairly expensive, but the food is really great! On a Thursday night at 5:45, we only had to wait 5 minutes to eat outside on a gorgeous day and our waitress was a delight. All the menu items have the calories on them and it&#39;s astounding how caloric their food is. Cue the skinnylicious menu: this is a fairly large menu of items under 590 calories and everything we tried was delicious. I got the steak medallions which came with mashed potatoes, tomatoes, mushrooms and 4 small pieces of steak. It was really delicious and even more so that I knew it was under 400 calories! Also their cheesecake is always to die for-don&#39;t look at the calories for those! Overall, we had a very nice experience again and will be back!

This is a pretty standard Cheesecake Factory location, food is decent and the cheesecake is insanely good. <br><br>Both are pretty over priced in my opinion.. Cheesecake is definitely worth the splurge though... <br><br>My wife loves the White chocolate raspberry and I like the smores and banana cream cheesecake. Both are delicious but I am sure many of the other cheesecakes are also extremely tasty.<br><br>The food is all pretty good but nothing incredible from the stuff I have had. <br><br>My wife does like the tamale cakes and I sometimes get the buffalo blasts because they are decent and quantity is very large (enough for me to have dinner and food the next day.. this is an app) <br><br>This location is at the fashion mall so you will almost always expect a wait, more or less depending on the day.

I come here every year on my birthday and every now and again. The food is always top notch and the service matches. Except for tonight, we arrived at the beginning of rush so we expected a wait for food, no problem. However we did not expect to wait 15 minutes to be greeted by our server after we were sat and then another 5-10 minutes for two waters. I didn&#39;t see our server out on the floor for a majority of that time, and we didn&#39;t even get a proper greeting. He didn&#39;t tell us his name or ask how we were doing. He went right in with &#34;I&#39;m sure you know what you&#39;d want to eat by now&#34;. The food arrived very quick which was great considering how busy the place was. However we still sat with empty glasses waiting on refills and extra empty plates crowded around our small two top table. The worst part was feeling like we didn&#39;t matter to the server as he often checked in with other tables around us and rushing by us.

Our food was given to the wrong table, the manager approached our table and offered us soup or salad as we waited which we thought was nice but declined as we just finished our appetizer and didn&#39;t want to ruin our appetite for dinner. After nearly an hour wait, the meal comes out Luke warm. Then the bill comes; the FULL bill. <br>VERY poor customer service in my opinion! Another reason why I try to avoid chain restaurants at all costs!

My food was 30 minutes late for pickup.  The server gave me the wrong order.  I asked to speak to the manager.  She blamed me for not coming inside to pick up.  I sent them a text and called.  The manager belittled and talked down to me.  I was blamed for the inconvenience.  Apparently it was my fault that this other person and I had the same first name (even though I gave both first and last).  Then I was reprimanded for not giving the make of my car when I called (even though I wasn&#39;t asked).  Somehow it became my fault that they were understaffed and the other manager was interviewing.  Since my card was charged when I got the wrong order, I said I would just keep the cheesecake that I accidentally paid for and they refused and took it inside and threw the whole thing away (which I hope is the truth with Covid going around), otherwise some person got food that I had breathed on.  I feel really bad for the staff that work under her.  Sometimes a simple apology goes a long way.

This is the first time we&#39;re eating at the Cheesecake Factory. Definitely something that you can&#39;t forget, beautiful decor, friendly waiters and staffs, clean and delicious starting breads and butter. My family had the Cheddar Stuffed Burger with fries, Herb Crusted Salmon, Fried Fish Tacos, and Seared Ahi Tina with white rice. So, why the three stars? The salmon and mashed potatoes were under-seasoned but the salmon was very fatty and juicy, the $14 burger unfortunately tasted just like a $6 burger, the fish taco was undercooked and very under-seasoned as well, however the ahi tuna was excellent. Will we come back again? Yes, but now we know what not to order.

Never. Ever. Again. My mother in law &amp; I arrived at 8pm and were told there would be a 30minute wait. Fine. Turns out we weren&#39;t sat until 9:06pm. Our server was very attentive, we explained to her that my mother in law has a nut &amp; shellfish allergy so she helped us navigate the menu accordingly. Our appetizers were amazing and our main course arrived right on time. Everything was delish! <br><br>Our visit took a sudden turn for the worst. We were ready for dessert. I ordered a plain strawberry cheesecake and my mother in law ordered the cookie dough cheesecake. Server said we had made great choices and eventually brought the food to our table. After taking one bite of the her cheesecake my mother in law starting coughing, sneezing, and could barely breathe. Turns out the cookie dough cheesecake was made with NUTS!!!! <br><br>I called our server over and told her this was unacceptable and that she wanted a strawberry cheesecake instead. Server said NOTHING. 10 mins later she arrived back with a strawberry cheesecake, our bill, and very weak &#34;sorry about that.&#34; We waited over 20 mins for her to return to our table. She never did so we paid in cash and left.<br><br>The manager wasn&#39;t notified or anything. I think we deserved more than insincere sorry. We didn&#39;t expect free food or anything but at the bare minimum we wanted to speak with someone in management to ensure this wouldn&#39;t happen to anyone else. <br><br>I will NEVER go back to this location.

I pulled up to the drive up parking space and called in my order. The sign says 10 mins. However, it took closer to 20 mins for the total transaction. I ordered carrot cake. The lady brings the order out to the car about 15 mins later. In the meantime, a lady pulls up in front of me , goes in, and leaves before my order arrives. The waitress brings my cake without any napkins or plasticware. I thought she would have a portable device to swipe my card at the car, after all, this is their &#34;To order &#34; lane/spot. She took my credit card back inside which made me totally anxious because my card is out of site now. She brings me a napkin with the tip of my fork exposed , not in plastic or wrapped up... unbelievable!!! Good grief- food service police- where are you?

Yum, love the brown bread! I had the lunch portion herb salmon with mashed potatoes. It was very tasty and the portion size was remarkably large for a lunch portion. And I&#39;m not complaining. You definitely get your money worth in the food quality and quantity. The service was really good as well. Thank you Miss Tracy.

I&#39;ve been going to this restaurant ever since it was built at that location. The food is getting worse by every month! Ordered Avacado egg rolls, instead of nice looking rolls some crap arrived half burned. The waiter didn&#39;t seem to notice that egg rolls were an odd shape and burned.<br>The prices on their dishes have gone up over the years. Same food, same ingredients, higher price!<br>The wait for the food is VERY LONG now. We went recently twice and every time we had to wait for our food for at least an hour!!!<br><br>The bill! They&#39;ve been &#34;suggesting&#34; tip and they calculate to pay the tip on &#34;taxes&#34; so for example if your bill was $100 and you pay 7% state tax, that&#39;s $7.00, $107 they bring you a bill suggesting to tip 15%(very minimal) or 22% the highest based on $107 bill and NOT $100 bill! I don&#39;t think it&#39;s legal to charge tips on taxes...

I just can&#39;t seem to jump aboard the Cheesecake Factory bandwagon. A friend picked out the place and I decided to give it another try. Here&#39;s why I&#39;m still feeling &#34;meh&#34; about this place.<br><br>-They don&#39;t take reservations...and thus, there is always a long wait. Luckily we only waited 10 minutes but by the time we left there were 50+ people in the entryway waiting their turn.<br>-My group was 7 people and they put us in a booth w/ 3 people to a side...and one random chair on the end (that was me). I felt like I was in people&#39;s way all night.<br>-Their menu is huge, for better or for worse. Lots of options, but also not great if you&#39;re a semi-indecisive person like myself. <br>-Also, those portions. They consistently rank on the nutritionist nightmare lists w/ all the calories in those dishes. I try to eat in moderation and I feel like that&#39;s a difficult task here.<br>-The name for the lower-calorie options is Skinnylicious. Why can&#39;t it be called Healthylicious? Just looking for less gargantuan portions here, people. <br><br>BUT, my skinnylicious veggie burger and green salad was a solid B+. I&#39;ve had better veggie burgers, but it sufficed. I wished the dressing had been on the side, but I should&#39;ve requested that. And the avocado roll appetizer was yummo :)<br><br>All in all, I would much prefer heading somewhere w/ more reasonable portion sizes and yummier food. There are many more options in the Keystone Mall area that I would pick hands down over the Cheesecake Factory (ahem Seasons 52 ahem).

I was initially let down when receiving the disheveled salad in our carry-out order and even more disappointed in the lack of veggies included in my salad. The comparison to the Vegan Cobb Salad photo featured on the website and generally received when dining in at the restaurant. I&#39;ve opted to dine elsewhere since; I urge you... order carry-out with

We got seated right away during the dinner hour on a weekday. The restaurant was busy especially in the bar area. We were promptly greeted by a very friendly waitress that was incredibly attentive the whole visit. <br><br>If you&#39;ve never been to a Cheesecake Factory the menu can definitely be overwhelming. It took us awhile to narrow down what to order. We ended up settling on a glass of malbec, a glass of the Cheesecake Factory House Cab Sauv, the chopped salad on the skinny menu (under 500 calories), and a factory burger with sweet potato fries. The menu now has calories informations on every menu items (including drinks) which made the decision process even difficult for two calorie conscious people. The portions at Cheesecake Factory are always large for someone that doesn&#39;t eat much so don&#39;t let that steer you away from a decision. <br><br>The salad was a decent salad overall with a good flavor. The factory burger is served on sourdough bread with onion and cheese which combines for a unique flavor. Their sweet potato fries were crispy and hot which are 2 key attributes for any fries. <br><br>Overall the food was good and the service was excellent!

Overrated!  My wife and I went in recently for a casual lunch.  Who knew that all we&#39;d see of the wait staff was upon entry.  My wife and I are very understanding people, yet, no explanation was given, as to where our meals were, why she never came back to check on us, why we had to ask for refills on our drinks, and why we waited for our check?  We had to seek these items out.  <br><br>This will be our last visit.  Very disappointed!

This used to be one of my favorite restaurants and I&#39;m not sure what has changed recently but I don&#39;t feel like management cares much anymore. Every time I eat here the food taste different, even though I order the same dish every time. This tells me that the kitchen staff isn&#39;t calibrated and management isn&#39;t paying attention to this. I used to love the food but now it&#39;s pretty bland. Portions also used to be pretty generous and now they&#39;re not so much, for the price you pay. I give it two stars because the cheesecake is still very delicious but I&#39;m just not a fan of the food anymore.

This chain restaurant is good, for dinner and lunch and Deserts !!! The cheesecake are excellent and so many kinds and flavors. Food served in big plates and definitely enough, most of the time you will have some left over to take with you. One more thing about the food, I will stay away from the steaks, I have tried the ribeye, ny strip and the filet and none was that good. <br>Parking is good most of the time you can find space to park, rash hours around 6pm-8pm, wait time is between 45-60 minutes depend on the day and time you arrive, there is no reservation so your only choice is to get there early or late. For my past experience on Fridays wait time is at least 45m and we arrive around 8pm. On the other hand if you get there around 9:30pm or 5pm there is almost no wait.<br>Service is good never had a bad experience  always I get what I want. <br>Favorite appetizer - avocado rolls, salmon firecrackers.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurant. I&#39;ve been to several occasions but they were all in the Indianapolis area. I visited Keystone Cheesecake Factory this past weekend and enjoyed every moment of it. When waiter, Sean, was the best. He was professional yet friendly and very helpful and informative in my election for dinner I love their strawberry lemonade, it tastes just like I made it at home. I will be visiting Keystone Crossing Cheesecake Factory again in the near future. My family and I are all decided on a 5-star rating.

Service was very accommodating and trafficked people smoothly through National Cheesecake Day. 1/2 price all cheesecakes! I recommend the Oreo dream extreme for all cookies and cream lovers. Perhaps the red velvet cheesecake if you&#39;re feeling a major sweet tooth. These two in particular are bigger than the other cheesecakes, so take advantage of the deal! <br><br>Oh and the service staff were fantastic!

Chopped Cobb Salad is my go to - the lunch portion is usually satisfying. The rye bread is yum. The mint tea is yum. And then I end up trying cheesecake after attempting to convince myself I&#39;ll be healthy!

I expect so much more from The Cheesecake Factory family. This particular location needs to step up their game. I suggested going here because I didn&#39;t want to eat at food court but I swear, eating fast food would have tasted fresher. <br><br>I sit down late to our table because I went to go buy a last minute gift. Our waitress came by and asked for my drink order. I asked for water. She came back and took our food order...said she would bring the water to me in just a minute. Five minutes later, still no water. I ask the girl who was clearing tables if I could get a water. She got attitude and passed me off to a waiter. Eventually I got one water from my waitress and one water from the waiter about 10 minutes after ordering. We ordered the Crab and Artichoke dip. It came out and it tasted terribly....more like canned tuna. The bread that came with it was rock hard and not hot. We sent it back and the manager came over. This was the only reason I&#39;m giving this place three stars...because the manager took it off our bill and was friendly (but that&#39;s also what any manager should do). I always order the same thing...the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp and Chicken. Normally, everything on my plate is piping hot when it comes out. The rice tasted two days old (and I know my rice...I&#39;m asian), my beans were cold and the chicken and shrimp were just warm. I told my boyfriend, that heir timing in the kitchen must be off. He agreed and said his pasta dish was cold and the shrimp in his were barely warm. There was no point in sending everything back. We were hungry and didn&#39;t feel like waiting even longer for our food after we didn&#39;t have breakfast and our appetizer failed. Everything tasted good flavor wise, they must have been short staffed in the kitchen to get timing right. We ordered some more food to go for my sister and a couple pieces of cheesecake for later. For over $100 bill, we could have driven down to Fleming&#39;s and gotten two steaks and two sides. Instead I decided to choose Cheesecake Factory and they let me down.
This place is consistent, always busy, food and service are both good.. the menu is so large and lots of options to choose from and the cheesecakes area yummy as are the other desserts.

Stop number 2 for my birthday. It&#39;s just something about the cheesecake! It&#39;s so amazing that we dine in just so dessert. Hey what&#39;s not to love about a great cheesecake. They even sang me Happy Birthday . That was awesome.

Loved our first visit! <br><br>Despite having to wait 70 minutes for a table, the food and service made up for the wait! The bread was delicious. And the appetizer, Dynamite Shrimp, was absolutely amazing! We couldn&#39;t get enough. My entree, Crispy Pineapple Chicken &amp; Shrimp didn&#39;t disappoint either! My husband couldn&#39;t stop sneaking bites. He ordered the white chicken chili and was pleased with the flavor and serving size. And of course, desert had to happen. The only thing we regret is, sharing the piece of white chocolate raspberry cheesecake. Next time he&#39;s getting his own!

I am writing right now because we ordered food to go from the Cheesecake Factory and the order was VERY wrong and incorrect in so many ways. I called and asked to speak to the manager, was polite and calm with her, and she was SO rude and told me it wasn&#39;t their fault, then HUNG UP on me! What and why did this happen?<br><br>My boyfriend and I have literally spent hundreds of dollars here and have been loyal customers. They mess up our orders frequently, and we still put up with it. And when I called and just wanted the situation to be corrected - was absolutely horrified by how awful this woman was to me. She did not accept their mistake or even apologize, just kept interrupting me and then hung up on me mid-sentence. I never raised my voice, never fought, just wanted the food to be corrected. <br><br>So to the Keystone Cheesecake Factory and the Horrible Awful Manager - we are NEVER ordering from you again. As someone who works in business and finance (Top 10 Business School) I can promise you that. And I will tell every single friend and every single family member of our experience. <br><br>This is the worst possible way to be a &#34;manager&#34; and Cheesecake Factory should be ashamed of itself for even hiring this individual. I can&#39;t believe this was the response when I called in and never raised my voice, simply only asked for what was just. It is not just to completely mess up our order, leave out an item, then yell at the customer that it is not your fault. It is 100% your fault, and this &#34;manager&#34; didn&#39;t even apologize or offer to fix the situation - just interrupted me ten million times and hung up on me mid-sentence. <br><br>This is the worst experience we have ever had with a restaurant, and I truly hope corporate and her own manager have a SERIOUS talk about this, and it comes with negative consequences, because no manager in the world should treat a loyal customer this way.
Their was no wait at all. The food is always amazing! The staff was very friendly and quick.  Will be coming back soon.

Cheesecake Factory was one of my favorite restaurants growing up. As I&#39;ve gotten older, I haven&#39;t visited many times and I forgot why until my last visit. <br><br>1. They don&#39;t take reservations. I understand. They are a popular spot; however, I arrived with a group of 12 or so women and we waited 2+ hours for a table. <br>2. The quality of food has gone down. I always would get the orange chicken. It was okay but not something I&#39;d get again for the price.<br>3. The service is just okay. After waiting 2 hours for a table, the service started out well. I&#39;m sure we waited 30 minutes for our food which was okay because we all wanted to talk and catch up. However, getting our bill took the absolute longest. At least another 20 min from when we requested it. <br><br>I won&#39;t be suggesting Cheesecake Factory - especially not with a large crowd. I prefer a spot with reservations and prompt service. On the plus side, it&#39;s a nice place to stop for lunch as they aren&#39;t as busy and they have lunch specials which are easier on the wallet.

I love this place but unless you get there right when the doors open, expect to wait. Although the wait is long the food is delicious and the staff is always friendly. I get the same delicious pasta ever time I go and it never disappoints. They have a great variety of drinks and of course a large selection of cheesecake. I love working my way through the cheesecake menu and have yet to find one that I don&#39;t like. If you are looking to splurge a bit on a nice meal, the Cheesecake Factory is a must!

WARNING: If you plan to go here after 6PM, bring a snack because you will be waiting. It&#39;s like hitting the jackpot if your wait is under 30min. Unfortunately, they don&#39;t take reservations, but sometimes that a key indicator that the place is a local favorite. <br><br>The two things I love most about this place are the extensive menu and the ambiance. You could look for days at the spiral bound menu with entrees from every inhabited continent.  There is literally something for EVERYONE. ATTENTION GF PEEPS (gluten-free people): they have gluten-free buns and a gluten-free pasta option. <br><br>Every time I come my server is friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. <br><br>My one question leaving the restaurant: has it been decorated with an Egyptian theme or Mediterranean theme????

We ordered carryout the other night. First, they made us wait on hold at the curbside service for about 10 minutes then they could find our meal, then they didnt give us the broccoli we ordered so my husband took everything out order by order. When we got it back to the hotel, it was one of the worst meals we have had. My chicken piccata was horrible. It had this weird milky sauce all over. The kids corn dogs were not cook all the way.  I wont be rushing back, especially for carry out. Waste of 70$.

I go here about once a month for birthdays or special occasions and the staff is always friendly and the food is always delicious. I have tried the pasta, the tacos, the salads, and of course the Cheesecake and everything is delicious. The service is very friendly and the portions are huge. <br><br>Cons: they do not take reservations so you have to go at an odd time or wait.
Good food, good drinks, good atmosphere. Seated quickly. Prompt service and friendly staff.

Went for lunch, fish and chips were great.  Love fish and this rates up there with my top 3 battered fried fish (the top 2 being in Florida).   A little pricey but consider the area the restaurant is located.  Server was ok.

The food here is above satisfactory. And the service is fantastic, our family comes here pretty often but I was especially satisfied this time around because of the service. We came in for a family lunch and our waiter(Jerome), did a fantastic job of making sure all of our needs were satisfied and made regular check ups on our table. Two thumbs up for the service. Thank you.
Very nice place. Great complimentary bread! Great for people looking for G free options! highly recommend the 4 cheese pasta! Also, awesome cheese cake! yum yum yum

Although this is my first check in, I frequent here regularly. This visit, we were celebrating a birthday. Our server, Lauren, was very engaging, and nice.  I ordered Chicken &amp; Biscuits... and a carry out order of Steak Diane (which wasn&#39;t supposed to be put in until I requested). However, my carry out order actually arrived BEFORE my actual meal!  I was slightly irritated, but Lauren did take it back, and put in a new order.... which was indeed cooked &#34;medium&#34;, so I&#39;m fairly confident that I received an entirely new steak instead of a reheated one.

Hi, my name is Emily and I&#39;m a cheesecake addict/expert. <br><br>It is on my bucket list to try every flavor of cheesecake on the Cheesecake Factory menu and let me tell you...I&#39;m well on my way.<br><br>So now, here is my obnoxiously long review about all of the cheesecakes I have enjoyed:<br><br>Toasted Marshmallow S&#39;mores Galore: YUM. If you like the camping original, you&#39;re going to love this piece of cheesecake! The chocolate cheesecake with the mallow melted over it is absolutely phenomenal.<br><br>OREO Dream Extreme Cheesecake: Definitely one of my favorites. The Oreos are mixed into the cheesecake and they add a delectable crunch!<br><br>Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake: Moist layers of red velvet cake and their original cheesecake covered in cream cheese frosting. How can you not love this?<br><br>Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake: Peanut butter. Chocolate. Fudge cake. Caramel. Hi. This is a Reese lovers DREAM.<br><br>Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake: I am more of a chocolate eater, but this banana cream cheesecake topped with Bavarian cream and fresh sliced bananas hits the spot on a summer day.<br><br>Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple: Mom sent me an entire cake of this and I had no problem finishing this creamy cheesecake swirled with caramel, peanut butter, Butterfinger, and Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Cups.<br><br>Dulce de Leche Caramel Cheesecake: Not my favorite because I am one who loves a rich dessert, but for those of you looking for a more light piece of cheesecake that&#39;s easy to finish, this caramel cheesecake if your go to.<br><br>Tiramisu Cheesecake: I love tiramisu and I LOVE cheesecake. Mix these together and you&#39;ve got one hell of a slice of cheesecake. Another coffee flavored piece, so I love! <br><br>Kahlua Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake: Wow. If you&#39;re a coffee drinker this cheesecake is for you. The rich brownie and Kahlua cheesecake, topped with chocolate mousse and chocolate ganache was a real treat in my coffee loving mouth.<br><br>Chocolate Chip Cookie-Dough Cheesecake: Probably one of my favorites so far. Creamy cheesecake loaded with cookie dough. SO FREAKING GOOD.<br><br>Chocolate Raspberry Truffle: I actually meant to order the white chocolate raspberry truffle when I ordered this one. It was good, but I am not a fan of chocolate and raspberries so it wasn&#39;t my fave. I would like to try the white chocolate for sure!<br><br>Wild Blueberry White Chocolate Cheesecake: If you love fruity desserts this is a subtle blueberry cheesecake that is a great end to a meal.<br><br>Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake: A delicious heavy cheesecake with caramel and fudge topped with caramel turtle pecans and chocolate. It was good but not my favorite!<br><br>White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut Cheesecake: Now don&#39;t get me wrong, this cheesecake was delicious, but probably my least favorite of all I&#39;ve tried. It&#39;s a rich slice of cheesecake swirled with macadamia nuts and caramel with a blond brownie crust. If ya like nuts, give it a try!<br><br>White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle: If you&#39;re looking for a piece of cheesecake that is heavier on the cheese than the cake, then this is your slice of heaven. Swirled with white chocolate and raspberry, this piece of cheesecake was sweet at the beginning and tart at the finish. Delicious!<br><br>I have also tried the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. Parmesan crusted chicken served over pasta with mushrooms, peppers, and onions in a spicy New Orleans sauce. I tried this the first time I visited the Cheesecake Factory and have a hard time not ordering this when I return. DA BOMB.<br><br>My only complaint: so many people = extra long wait. So plan accordingly.<br><br>Well, until I try another piece of cheesecake, that&#39;s all folks!

I was not a fan of cheesecake factory before only because I was intimidated by the menu. I went online and looked at pictures of some of the food that they offer and  I ordered carry out. when I got my food not only was the serving enough for two people, the food was the best I&#39;ve had in a long time. I definitely recommend this place to anyone trying to grab a bite.

Dinner out with family and a friend. We each had something different t and everyone was happy with heir choices: over easy eggs breakfast for dinner, chicken costelleto, Margarita flatbread and skinny licious tacos. Took a turtle, strawberry and Godiva cheesecakes home. This place is always so busy and infamous for it&#39;s super slow service. Our server was great! Still slow but I will blame that on the volume of people and bad computer system. Gave our server 2 gift cards to apply to our meal. Stupid computer system only applied one. Working through that mess added 20 minutes to our time. Dinner for four took us two hours. If you have the time, enjoy.

I think because they&#39;re so busy, the service isn&#39;t great. We had a party of 7 that arrived at 6pm on a Thursday. The wait was only 25 minutes since we decided to split into 2 tables. Otherwise, we were told our wait would be an hour. Portion sizes are huge, so I&#39;d recommend splitting. I ordered their special of the day - salmon with lemon butter, mashed potatoes, and broccoli. It was tasty and came out hot.

For some this may be a plus, but for me--I hate the menu that&#39;s as thick as a Gideon Bible. For crying out loud. <br><br>I do appreciate the skinny menu for those of us watching our waistlines, and there are plenty of vegetarian options.<br><br>The wait staff always seems bored. I&#39;m sort of bored there as well, so I get it. <br><br>It&#39;s loud in there. The wait is always sort of awful and there&#39;s nowhere convenient to wait once the benches are full, which it seems like they always are.  Parking is tough as well unless you valet. <br><br>The cheesecake is yummy and the food is pretty good, but I don&#39;t get the allure. I mean, if I&#39;m meeting a friend and they want to go there I won&#39;t argue. But it&#39;s not a place I would suggest.

I came here for the first time today and I was very satisfied with my visit. <br><br>I want to start of with our waiter, Doug (Douglas), who was very kind and attentive towards our table. He kept reassuring us about our orders and was very willing to fulfill our request.<br><br>For appetizer we got some gyozas. I really enjoyed the sauce.<br><br>Then for the main dish I got the chicken salad sandwich which was also very delicious and the bread was nice and crunchy. It also came with some fries and ketchup. I only managed to finish one sandwich because it was very filling.<br><br>For dessert, I got the S&#39;mores cheesecake, which was also good, but I could barely finish it.<br><br>Overall I enjoyed my experience here and the food was very delicious. I would like to come back again in the future.

Despite it being a chain, I love the Cheesecake Factory because the food is always made consistently well no matter where you go (at least from my experience) and the ambiance is nice and perfect for almost any occasion. Whether I&#39;m wanting to drop by in my gym clothes after a workout to meet with friends or coming to celebrate a birthday or anniversary, the Cheesecake Factory never fails me. The menu is so huge that there is something that can satisfy any person you bring whether they&#39;re a vegetarian, gluten intolerant, or just plain picky about their food.<br><br>While their cheesecakes are delicious and very well known, don&#39;t forget to try their smoothies too! My favorite is the tropical smoothie!
I love coming here food is alway good <br>Service is faster I will recommend the cheesecake to everyone

The food is always terrific and the service was fantastic. BUT...Cheesecake factory in Indy in has a fascist sign at the bottom of their entrance. A hard to see hiroglific saying no firearms allowed. Forcing law abiding, legally armed citizens to make a choice of either ignoring their fascist rules or going elsewhere for their high end over price food. I won&#39;t say which I chose but on a side note; their white chocolate caramel macadamia cheesecake to die for. In a state like Indiana where the owning and carrying of firearms is legal, I find their anti American anti gun policies unacceptable.

The wait was longer than stated and they were annoyed when I went to check out how much longer after waiting 15 minutes over the time. That was annoying, but aside from that it wasn&#39;t bad. I would recommend they have a texting system for the wait, they do have the vibratory, but they don&#39;t work outside the restaurant and seeing as they are attached to a mall it would be worth it to walk around the mall while you waited.<br>Onto the food. It was delicious I had the chicken fettuccine Alfredo and it was fantastic. We also had spinach dip as an appitizer and that was phenomenal. They were not stingy on the chips which happens so often when you get this app.<br>Our waiter was great always on top of our drinks and what we needed!

This in one of my favorite restaurants, never disappointed. Visiting Indianapolis with friend trying out for the VOICE.  I had Bellagio Chicken and delicious as always. Enough food for two meals. Also had fried Mac &amp; Cheese Balls, best I ever had.  My friend had fish tacos, and enjoyed as well. Place was packed, we only had to wait 15 minutes for table, but did take a little while to receive main dish. Well worth the wait. I will definitely be back.
We celebrated my daughter 14th Birthday today. All I have to say Gabriel our server was 5  stars all the way. He is by far the best server I have EVER HAD!!

WARNING: This entire review is about the Red Velvet Cheesecake. <br><br>Ok.<br>I don&#39;t REALLY have to do a Cheesecake Factory review do I ? We all know the love and likes about our favorite factory and while I&#39;m sure someone out there has found a reason or two not to love that place, I won&#39;t litter this short review with information you&#39;ve already heard and read before. Fact is, I actually have not eaten at Cheesecake Factory in quite some time. No particular reason other than I&#39;ve just been eating at other places......<br><br>but I NEVER order cheesecake from anywhere, except the factory!!!!!! I remember there was a time that I didn&#39;t like cheesecake. Then I started liking n bake Jello cheesecake but couldn&#39;t stand the taste of REAL cheesecake minus the quick box fix minus all it&#39;s fillers. I couldn&#39;t acclimate my tastebuds to the cream cheese taste. Finally a few years ago, I started eating real cheesecake.  Then, one random day in my life, I ordered a piece from Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m pretty sure I&#39;ve known people and heard them rave on and on about the Red Velvet Cheesecake from the Factory, but as someone who didn&#39;t like cheesecake in general, I couldn&#39;t fully appreciate it ............that was until I had my own. <br><br>Now I&#39;m borderline obsessive compulsive spontaneous disorder about the darn cheesecake. If Cheesecake Factory would have a chef teach me this recipe and how to make it to perfection, I&#39;m not sure I would even want to put my hands in the pot. I only want it from the Factory. I refer to them as the Factory due in part to it being their name but also because if ever there was a place that should be known, revered and respected for the crafting of specialty cheesecakes, it is CF !!!!! What can I say???<br><br>How do describe it? Do I talk about the special twisted frosting on the backside of the cheesecake that sometimes I like to dip my fork into, grab one on the end of it and eat it in little tiny bites before diving into the cake? ?? Or do I discuss the delightfully appreciated marriage between red velvet cake, complete with the perfect amount of moist, and the cheesecake itself, which is creamy, soft yet sturdy and plain old beautiful??? <br><br>Do I tell you when I get cheesecake from the Factory, I indulge until I have overdosed and then get mad because even though I almost always save some for later, it&#39;s never enough??? I guess I could say how long I would be willing to stand behind the counter of cheesecakes, watching them taunt me with all their choices, and wait for them to box up my red velvet....i would do it for an hour. I would literally wait in line for an hour for a piece of Red Velvet Cheesecake Factory Cheesecake. Yes I would and no I have not ever done it; I&#39;ve yet to need to. <br><br>But I would. <br>I would go get some right now if I worked across the street. How do people work at Keystone at the Crossing and not find themselves tastebud-diving into a slice of cheesecake. I can only imagine that ALL their other choices of cheesecake are equally as heavenly as the red velvet, but I can&#39;t say for certain that I will ever know. Sometimes, I can be a creature of habit. And right now, my only acceptable habitat of cheescake devouring is Red Velvet, Cheesecake Factory, Keystone at the Crossing, <br><br>ASAP all the time !!!!!

Everything here is delicious! I think that&#39;s the concert. However, located in the mall, this spot is busy 24/7. Portions are huge and calories are abundant but can you really enjoy Cheesecake Factory without the cheesecake?! Sometimes you just need to splurge on a Hershey&#39;s piece but there&#39;s something about a plain cheesecake that makes my day! Service is pretty good since they&#39;re probably used to being busy. We went for an office lunch and we were out in 45 minutes!

There was no wait and the waitress was nice. I&#39;m not a fan of the veggie burger. It literally taste like a rice cake that&#39;s falling apart. The macaroni is my favorite and i love it. I was just not a fan. My husband had the bacon bacon cheeseburger it was tasty for him! He enjoyed it.

They need a better waiting system. They don&#39;t do reservations when you actually need it. Then, when you find out that the wait is over 90 minutes, they expect you to agree to be held hostage in their claustrophobic lobby because their little pager things don&#39;t work outside the restaurant and they don&#39;t take your phone number to text or call you when your table becomes available. I had about 10 people for my birthday and tried to plan ahead for securing a table but because of their poor system, they lost out on that money and repeat business. <br><br>Luckily P.F. Chang&#39;s took our call, fit us in and we didn&#39;t even have to move our cars. Oh yeah, and don&#39;t even get me started on Cheesecake Factory&#39;s parking lot. Jesus Christ! I don&#39;t care what it would take but clearly a multilevel parking garage is necessary.<br><br>Pros: Food, Decor<br>Cons: Parking, Wait time/reservations system, Price of food doesn&#39;t always match quality, Layout is too crowded

Love the Cheesecake Factory, but this was the worst experience ever. Just went for cheesecake through the bakery, and after seeing the servers standing 3 and 4 deep to just get their orders out, should have turned around and left. 7 people behind the counter plus a manager. there was one person just putting strawberries on slices of cheesecake and loading them in the freezer.  The others were just total chaos!<br><br>I had to wait for over 45 minutes just to get two pieces of cheesecake.  <br><br>For stopping in the middle of the afternoon (I was there from 2:50 - 3:45) this is just bad.<br><br>Don&#39;t go to the bakery if you are in a hurry! Or have any other plans!

The meal that wasn&#39;t. Attended an early afternoon movie, and then went to The Cheesecake Factory for a late lunch. The restaurant was 20% full and requested a large booth for the 4 of us. They sat us in a small booth in the bar. We couldn&#39;t have a conversation because the music was too loud and we made a request to be moved. Waited until they got a manager to talk with us. Plenty of empty booths and waitstaff; he took us to another section with only small booths, but we would have to wait for one to be cleaned. We left. There was obviously no customer focus. The manager lacked class, was rude, was less than accommodating, and obviously didn&#39;t want our business. We have eaten at many Cheesecake Factory locations and have never had this kind of experience. We will not return to this location.

Is it just me, or does this restaurant seem to be going downhill lately? The Cheesecake Factory used to be the place my family always wanted to stop in when visiting from out-of-town. The service was always excellent, the atmosphere is great, and it seemed like it didn&#39;t matter what you ordered from the menu: it was bound to be delicious and beautifully-plated. This hasn&#39;t exactly been the case lately, and it&#39;s not just this location. <br><br>Maybe we came on an off day, but during Sunday brunch before rush, three plates of food managed to come out at completely separate times. While drinks were refilled on the regular, the bread and condiments we asked for were forgotten and required several reminders. My entree managed to arrive well before my side and looked like it had been thrown onto the plate without care. And, as it turned out, it had been made incorrectly and was completely unappetizing. I ended up having to order a totally different dish.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;re really lucky that your cheesecake is so damned good. I thank you for the gentle reminder of why I enjoy shopping in and eating at local businesses!

How can I best review Keystone at the Crossing&#39;s location of The Cheesecake Factory?<br><br>Let&#39;s compare it to a Yelp event. Weird, you say? I think not. <br><br>As I was sitting around at the recent White Night event sponsored by Yelp, I was struck by the diversity of those attending including diversity of ethnicity, diversity of economics, diversity of sexual orientation, diversity of ability, diversity of status and much more. While there were certainly those who lingered with their friends, as a whole the event was enveloped by a spirit of goodness, community, fun, acceptance and a sense of people watching not out of judgment but out of appreciation and delight. <br><br>As an adult with a disability who looks, shall we say &#34;different,&#34; I felt comfortable at this event despite my own long-existing self-consciousness that isn&#39;t so much overwhelming but always sort of underneath the surface. I was surrounded by people from across all walks of life and felt genuinely comfortable there - as if in that strange and wonderful little community I had a place where my weirdo flag could fly high. <br><br>Now then, let&#39;s go over to The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Located inside Keystone at the Crossing and one of two Central Indiana locations for the 185 location chain that began in 1978 in, not surprisingly, Beverly Hills. Famous for the 50+ types of cheesecakes and a menu that includes a wide range of foods including salads, pizzas, &#34;glamburgers,&#34; pasta, super foods and a relatively newer &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu, The Cheesecake Factory has long been blasted by health conscious folks for its high caloric desserts and excessive serving sizes on some high calorie foods. This location is nearly always crowded it seems, a preferred dining option for the Keystone area hipster crowd and gold-plated mall surfers. <br><br>Going into The Cheesecake Factory is sort of like walking (or rolling) into a mini-Beverly Hills, though with a distinctly Hoosier flair tossed in. It&#39;s sort of like faux Hoosier hospitality meets hipster meets &#34;It&#39;s okay if I eat this huge piece of cheesecake because I&#39;m heading straight over to meet with my personal trainer named Skippy.&#34; It&#39;s the kind of place where you people watch, but pretend you&#39;re not. It&#39;s the kind of place where you can&#39;t help but look at the handbag on the table next to yours just so you can chuckle when you eye the Coach label. <br><br>Okay, I&#39;m exaggerating a little. <br><br>I was seated at a two top, which here means being on one side of one of those half-booth/half-table set-ups. It&#39;s the kind of arrangement that allows for a chair to be put on the outside of the table to allow for an extra diner. I waited a few minutes for a server, but when Mansy arrived he was fine throughout my time there. I ordered my usual unsweetened iced tea with fish &amp; chips as the meal. I did get my usual refill. The order was, as Buddy the Elf would say, ginormous. The fish, in particular, was quite good. I found the french fries to be lightly seasoned yet surprisingly plain and too crisp for my liking. They also give you a nice serving of cole slaw with it and I did enjoy it. <br><br>Here&#39;s the comparison, though. <br><br>I didn&#39;t feel as comfortable here. It reminded me of those early elementary school days when the school jock made fun of how I held a spoon because, as I&#39;ve noted, my fine motor skills aren&#39;t always the greatest. Is this low self-esteem? Maybe a touch, but I also think there&#39;s an overwhelming air of inauthenticity (Is that even a word? I like it.) and I found myself not feeling particularly relaxed. It&#39;s not to say that everyone here is rich or beautiful or in shape or anything like that, but there&#39;s a level of pretense here that made me glad I was using a gift card for an over-priced meal while surrounded by people with too much plastic in their pockets and their cheeks. <br><br>Ouch. Sorry, that was a little harsh. Yet, that&#39;s how it felt for me. I don&#39;t hate The Cheesecake Factory. They have enjoyable outside dining, good but not great food, friendly if not exactly inviting servers and while they&#39;re a splurge they&#39;re not an unreasonable splurge. My meal came in at right around $21 without the tip. <br><br>When it comes down to it, I suppose I&#39;ve reached a point where I value authenticity, community and genuine service more than I do a hyped &#34;experience.&#34; Even as a customer, I want to be comfortable. I want to belong. I want to feel like you see ability rather than disability. On the flip side, I want to feel like if my disability does come into play that you won&#39;t blink an eye. We are all humans, after all. <br><br>I felt that at White Night. Here? It was different. I was &#34;different.&#34;

The Baja Chicken are delicious! It&#39;s the right mix of flavors and the chicken is perfectly grilled. The chipotle sauce gave it a nice heat. The rice, I&#39;m sure is good, but mine was old and stale. The beans were good as well. The black out cake was OUT OF THIS WORLD DELICIOUS! I had to eat it over the course of two days because it was very rich!!

We placed an order for dinner through Door Dash for delivery.  When the dinner arrived (took about 1 hour).  The salad which I ordered was &#34;Almond-crusted Salmon Salad&#34; - served over kale, shaved brussels sprouts, arugula, avocado, Quinoa &amp; cranberries.  The issue was salmon was plain (not almond crusted),  very few brussels sprouts, no avocado, no quinoa. <br><br>When I called to complain to Manager of Cheesecake Factory (we did not want anything - just wanted him to know someone in the kitchen didn&#39;t know how to make this salad).  He informed me it was Door Dash&#39;s problem.  They are supposed to check the food and make sure it is correct.  My issue is - how are they supposed to know how the food is prepared?  <br><br>If anyone is thinking of using a delivery service for food delivery - please be aware of this.  The restaurant claims no responsibility.  Also - these delivery guys deserve 30% tip or more to bear this responsibility.

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s before and know what to expect but this particular visit was not very pleasant at all.<br><br>We went on 8/20 and had a wait time of about 30 minutes for a party of two...not too bad.<br><br>The service though was horrible.  The whole section we were in had the same waitress and it appears that she let all her tables go.  We all were waiting long periods of time to place our orders or get refills as well as waiting for things like a replacement napkin.  It took us over 20 minutes just to pay the check!!<br><br>The food was meh too.  One had the burger which was overcooked and not very flavorful.  The burger itself was quite bland and the bacon was over crisp.  I had a salad which was delicious and a decent portion.  The salad was fresh and the ingredients were plenty. <br><br>The long wait times and poor service even discouraged us from eating dessert while dining.  I did take a piece to go but that often isn&#39;t quite as good after a three hour drive home.

What can I say, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory!  This is a favorite brunch spot on Sunday&#39;s. I love their Thai Chicken lettuce wraps!  They are always fresh and very good... And since it&#39;s a lot a veggies I don&#39;t feel too guilty if I get a slice of cake to go!

Wow, the food was horrible.  Monster burrito was all white rice with a tiny bit of chicken.  Pasta dish wasn&#39;t cooked and wasn&#39;t worth the 17.00 price tag.  I couldn&#39;t even chew it.  They replaced it with lettuce wraps with not even a half chicken breast.  Sad.  They used to be a great restaurant , now, the cheesecake is the only thing worth eating and that is better taken home at 8.50 a piece for plain vanilla bean.  Don&#39;t waste your time or money!

So the only reason I even downloaded yelp was to do this review. This was the most horrid experience I&#39;ve ever had... I don&#39;t complain ever, I always eat my food from restaurants and I don&#39;t even tell the servers if my order is wrong. But I couldn&#39;t even handle this. Everything is so cold and hard we had to throw 120 dollars worth of food away, my entire family was in shock. I mean jaw dropping shock.... you&#39;ll understand once you see these pictures (none of the food was even edible so not a single bite was taken because most of it was a health code violation and raw) the fish and chips was served exactly how you see it literally I did not touch it at all it came exactly like this, same as Brussels sprouts.... this is insane. I&#39;m in absolute shock..... <br>This was the fish and chips I ordered but there wasn&#39;t any fish to eat.... just skin or something I&#39;m not sure what that was I had to call and ask... I did not bite off of anything this is exactly how i opened the container. <br><br>Brussel sprouts we didn&#39;t even know what they were until we dug around in them.... <br><br>And the last picture we also had to call and ask what it was.... <br><br>We ordered 3 pieces of cheese cake and never ever got them.... so no pictures for those...

Cheesecake Factory is a big trademark for the cheesecakes in United States and it got really really popular outside the country because of the Big Bang Theory show. As the hot Kaley Cuoco alias Penny used to work here on the show. No wonder, people from other countries would love to try this place out. After the show, I think they started hiring pretty women as waitresses. Because, today I saw 7 waitresses out of them 4 were so pretty. I call it as the Penny effect. <br><br>Anyways, coming to the food. I dropped in here at 9:30 PM for a dessert with my friends and this was my first time to visit Cheesecake Factory in Indianapolis. This place has huge doors which are like the palace doors. Once you enter, woohoo, those chandeliers, beautiful yellow lightning, Wow. I loved this place. It was very big, I think this is one of the biggest Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to. We were greeted well and within a minute we were guided to a booth and were seated. We got a pretty waitress who took care of us very well. We ordered our food and the order came out within a few minutes. <br><br>One of my friend  ordered  jambalaya which she claimed the dish as &#34;amazing&#34;. Me and my other friend tried out the Godiva chocolate cheesecake and chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake. They were absolutely scrumptious. Oh boy, needless to say, I feel Cheesecake Factory is a connoisseur in making mouth watering cakes. I love them so much. <br><br>I loved the ambience, I loved the service, I loved the cheesecake and the waitresses are pretty, kind and well trained and they know what they are doing. <br><br>That&#39;s it. I don&#39;t see any reason to not to give 5 stars! It&#39;s a fantastic place.

Okay so.... this heavy Mexican hostess tells me it&#39;s a 30 minute wait while I watch a lot of people waiting on the bench. I start my stopwatch and timer.  We waited. 24 minutes in. She lied and said they already called my name. Which is bs. I stand there and say you got 6 mins before the timer goes off as your promised time. We sit n I order, my spoon was dirty n covered in like a toilet paper napkin. The food comes out and there a bigger blob of tissues n napkin.  I assume this is a nice place to celebrate my daughter 5th birthday.  They called the manager over n said  he&#39;ll take care of that one dish. Possibly the last time I&#39;ll be here

Be prepared to wait a long time after you order. The food here is decent, I especially like the Thai chicken wraps.<br><br>Today, the appetizer showed up after the entrée. If we had not waited 30 minutes before the entrée showed up, we would be fine with it. <br><br>No manager excuse can make that up to me, no apologies that the kitchen was backed up, that is simply poor service. <br><br>There are about 100 other places to go to before you go here, skip it and find someplace better.

A &#34;typical&#34; Cheesecake Factory in a large chain of restaurants. The food is average (nothing really special about it) and the cheesecake is good (I mean it&#39;s in the name right?) Came here on a weeknight and had a 30-min wait after arriving. Be prepared to expect a longer wait on weekends and peak hours. Once we were seated, our server was spot on and friendly. I ordered the burger and some cheesecake for dessert. The burger was ok and the cheesecake was good, like you&#39;d probably expect. This is a chain restaurant, so don&#39;t expect anything different from this restaurant or another one. Would I be back? Yes, at some point... but I won&#39;t be running back necessarily.

This isnt my first visit here but maybe one I wasn&#39;t the most happiest with. When we arrived the hostess started to sit us at a table. We asked for a booth and she told us no we cant have a booth that they were shutting them down those sections. About 20 min later there were people sitting in the 3 booths across from us....yes the &#34;closed section.&#34; Throughout the meal the server got &#34;lost&#34; a few times and we would be waiting for her return. When we got the check, the cheesecakes of another tables were put on our checks so we had to have to corrected. The food made up for the experience and is the reason I gave it 3 stars

I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory a million times and this is the first time I&#39;m reviewing it.  I&#39;ve been on a strict no-carb low sugar diet lately, but that doesn&#39;t mean I don&#39;t want to go out or have a treat!  Decided to use a gift card one night and I ended up ordering from the small plate menu.  I got the lettuce Asian chicken tacos.  They are served like regular tacos in those little holder things but the &#34;shell&#34; is thick lettuce.  The chicken was glazed with an Asian sauce and topped with pickled vegetables so crunchy and good!  It is accompanied with 2 Asian sauces for extra zest.  I also got a slice of low-carb cheesecake to take home and it was sooooo good!  It was made with Splenda and on a walnut crust.  If I didn&#39;t order it, I would have never known it was low-carb. <br><br>The four stars is because the waiting area is the stuff nightmares are made of!  Not enough place to sit; always a huge wait and just loud!

After not eating here for years we have gone several times this past year. We have always had great service even on half price cheesecake day we got a table and had excellent service. <br>I like getting the Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta. It has Broccoli, Oven-Dried Tomato, Eggplant, Artichokes, Olives, Pine Nuts with garlic. I always take half of it home with me. I love the brown bread and totally can&#39;t get enough of it. They always hook us up with an extra loaf to take home for the rest of my pasta the next day. I did get the Marsala Chicken and didn&#39;t enjoy it as much. <br>On our last visit my friend got the Farfalle with Chicken and roasted garlic and she loved it. She let me taste it and it was really good and I am getting it next time we go. <br>You can never go wrong with the cheesecake of course. I try to get different slices when we go, but I do love the lemon raspberry one and the peanut butter cup was is amazing. They are all good! we usually get it to go. <br>On cyber Monday we bought a gift card online and got 2 slices of cheesecake free! Not sure if that is a once a year promotion. I think I saw it twice, but had missed it the first time. It&#39;s worth watching for such a great deal!

Absolutely love this place, despite it always being so hectic. If you don&#39;t time it right, you&#39;ll be waiting 45+ minutes for a table/booth. The menu is literally endless and anyone can find something they&#39;ll love for lunch or dinner! By far my favorite item is the Crusted Chicken Ramono (substitute for white sauce); I&#39;ve also had their BBQ pizza and buffalo sandwich. The Renne&#39;s special is an amazing deal for lunch and you&#39;ll always get more food than you&#39;ll ever need. Not much of a cheesecake fan so I can vouch for it but Service and food are always on point, if you haven&#39;t been here before, it&#39;s time to give this chain a try!

I&#39;ve never been disappointed in the service or food at Cheesecake Factory. I can&#39;t steer away from the Chicken and Biscuits. Our service was perfect this particular visit. I love the environment at Cheesecake Factory. And to no surprise, our cheesecake was DELICIOUS! Will definitely be back.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory for a nice meal after a long day in the Indianapolis Convention Center. As I arrived to the Cheesecake factory with my 3 other friends the waitress automatically is upset she has been sat with customers 19-23. She is already beginning to become irritated with us presuming we will not tip her well (because we are younger customers). We were extremely respectful regardless of the attitude she tossed at us. We wait a while then end up having to ask for drinks &amp; the bread because it is taking so long. Eventually our food arrives my friend gets a fettuccine alfredo bowl, I get a margherita pizza. Both are not up to cheesecakes normal standards; the alfredo is sitting in a liquidy soup of what was supposed to be sauce (looked like coffee creamer), my margherita pizza genuinely taste like soap (it is not good at all). We tell the waitress that we do not enjoy the food she tells the manager and he comes &amp; tries to mediate the situation. Granted the manager was professional, we receive new food. My friend reorders the alfredo the new one is significantly better the waitress even agrees. I change my order to mini sliders with bacon, no onion or pickle; my order arrives and there is no bacon and the food arrives long after everyone is done eating. At this point I have sent my food back already to receive another wrong plate. These burgers have no bacon at all, I proceed to walk up to the manager because I am idly waiting for someone to check back in (as no one does). I notify him that I would like to just scratch the whole thing because my friends are done eating I can&#39;t even bag the food and go I would have to wait again &amp; I&#39;m fed up at this point. To top all of this off he then proceeds to charge me for a mini side salad (which is all i got to eat since this whole ordeal took up so much time). All in all I would not recommend this cheesecake factory, it is certainly not up to par with cheesecake factories I&#39;ve been to before. If you can avoid going to this cheesecake factory you should. Fashion Mall in Indianapolis.

The cheese cake factory was soo good! I always love the food there! The bread is good too! I got the fettuccine Alfredo and it it was pretty good. I also got the Cinnabon cheesecake and it was delicious!  The best dessert I have ever had! The only down part was the time it took for the writer to bring us our drinks. The atmosphere was very nice too ! Over all I loved it!

This is probably my favorite place to eat now, the food was over the top. And our waitress daysia was the best, very helpful and kind. She told us about the menu and what was the best on it. I&#39;ll definitely be back soon.

Really good cheesecake, service was pretty slow. The waitress or manager (?) Heidi was just awful and rude. Disappointing that one person can ruin a good place for you. I suggest visiting another location as this one employs people like Heidi.

We ended the semester with a dinner in order to fellowship and break bread with one another. Cheesecake Factory seemed to be a central location with regard to the students in the classroom. While I enjoyed my colleagues, there was nothing really memorable about the dining experience. There was a reservation &amp; since I was running behind schedule, there was no wait for me. I doubt there were any issues. Our waitress was nice, could&#39;ve frequented the table to check on us a little more. We had to try and wave her down, lock eyes a few times. I ordered the Korean Fried Cauliflower and an order of Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta. The Cauliflower was VERY good - it&#39;s actually what prompted a 4 instead of a 3-Star rating. The pasta? Sent it back. Flavor was a bust for me. No issues with removing it from the check. Parking can be hard depending on holidays or peak times in the day, but I had no issues finding a spot fairly quickly. Overall, it was an ok dining experience.

If you&#39;ve never been to a Cheesecake Factory then you need to go. The food is delicious! It is pricier than other places but it is worth it. Plus, it&#39;s not a complete visit until you order a slice of their cheesecake. They have an Oreo one that is to die for. Their traditional one is very good too. I will say there is almost always a wait when going here, so call ahead.

Such a disappointment! Was looking forward to date night at Cheesecake Factory at Keystone Mall. After being seated for 30 minutes our assistant server said she couldn&#39;t find our server to take our drink and food order. Finally she came saying she was trying to correct an emergency in kitchen. Our drinks and appetizer came out with no issues. My entree came out cold, not warm but literally cold. I sent it back to either reheat or remake, our server came back out explaining it wasn&#39;t made properly the first time because they gave me the last of what I had ordered. They asked me to order something different, my boyfriend is a gentleman and wouldn&#39;t eat until I received my food. I explained by then his food would be cold as well. He sent his food back explaining we no longer wanted to eat here (after being there for 2 hours). We asked for the manager, Heidi came out and acted very nonchalant and basically said well just pay for your appetizer and drinks then (ummmm we didn&#39;t have anything other than that so you are not doing us any favors). We were completely disgusted at the service, and management. We ended up leaving at 11pm and eating Burger King in the way home. Completely HORRIBLE experience! Ruined the entire evening! We were so looking forward to the cheesecake!

After numerous years of hearing about The Cheesecake Factory and not having dined with them before, my family received a $25 gift card from a neighbor. I was super grateful for the gesture and excited to try their cheescake, mostly because Penny from the Big Bang Theory worked there for years and that&#39;s one of my favourite shows. <br><br>So we made a family date and hopped into the car to make the kind of long drive to arrive at The Cheesecake Factory.
