Upon our arrival it was pure chaos. There were crowds filling up both entrances and no clear way to find the hostess desk. No one greeted us or any guests as they arrived. There was zero direction from the restaurant or staff as to which way the desk or anything was. After quickly accessing the situation we decided to get our cheesecake to go, once we found a place to even order some. <br><br>We made our way through the crowds, elbows out as that was the only way to keep our kids from being trampled, and FINALLY found a counter to order cheesecake to go. By the time we got to the counter I was ready to say f this let&#39;s leave, but pushed passed those feelings to soldier on and do our best to salvage our family date. After looking at all of the sub-par cheesecake flavours to choose from, we settled on getting one of their original cheesecakes. Had we not choosen that option, we would have only been able to get 2 pieces of cheesecake on a $25 gift card. For those prices these cheesecakes should be, by normal standards, out of the world excellent. They fall tremendously short for all the hype I have been hearing about The Cheesecake Factory for almost a decade. Once we arrived home we even dressed up the cheesecake with whipped cream, fresh blueberries, and slivered almonds. To say they made a big impact would be a lie. I&#39;m not sure anything could really improve their cheesecakes beside a complete overhaul of the recipe and their baking practices. <br><br>I have not even mentioned trying to find the bathroom while we were waiting. We could not find it through the crowds nor could we find an employee to even ask until we were in their way as a few were delivering food to a table. I had to stop in their path and ask them for directions before moving. The employees were not very friendly, but I could tell they were busy. This is still no excuse though. <br><br>As we made our way back from the bathroom (which was not so tidy at all) to the to-go counter, which was a crowd nightmare yet again, a manger quickly pushed through us and moved directly to the hostess stand. Not once did he look back to see if he had knocked someone over or to say excuse me or to even make an attempt at an apology. <br><br>To say that this was just an off night would be nice. I wish I could believe that! I really do. But we arrived around 5:30. This is still the beginning of the dinner shift. How do I know this you may ask? Because I have been in this industry for over 17 years. There are zero excuses for any guests to be having this experience or any similar experiences at such a well known restaurant and chain. Customer service still stands where owners and employees care about their guests. Those are the businesses I will continue to support. I give thanks to The Cheesecake Factory for shaping how I view their business and customer service practices. It sure does  make this foodie&#39;s list of Must-See&#39;s shorter. We will not be visiting The Cheesecake Factory again. <br>*** If I could, I would give a 0 star rating and that is not something I take lightly ***

Tried to use Door Dash for the free cheesecake and it didn&#39;t work, said the location was not in delivery area and it is less than 4 miles from my location. Food is subpar and over priced and once did not like a sangria I ordered and they said they would not replace it with something elsw because &#34;it was made correctly.&#34; I could order another drink but they had to charge me for the one I did not like.

Visited this Cheesecake Factory after finding out they were one of the few restaurants still open after 10pm on the Northside. Per the usual the menu is huge so it took me forever to decide what I wanted plus I wanted cheesecake. Knowing the calories involved I got their chicken tortilla salad. I wrongly assumed it would be a decent size salad it was actually two mounds of salad that I could have shared with someone else. It was good but I know to never order it again by myself. By the time I was done with the salad there was no room for cheesecake which was probably a good thing. The service was not the greatest since it wasn&#39;t that busy. My friend asked for ketchup for her burger and it literally took 30 minutes for her to bring a little saucer of ketchup. I was just thinking after that long wait could have at least brought a bottle back lol. It took us way longer than necessary to get our check as well. I think I will stick to carryout for Cheesecake factory.

I gave this place two stars only because it is the Cheesecake Factory. Today was horrible, and no it was not busy because there was no wait. Ordered our food, white chicken chili, a house salad and a veggie burger with fries. Then a couple came and seat next to us and 5 to 8 minutes later ordered. Some pasta dishes. Got there food, ate it, got boxes and a dessert. We still didn&#39;t have our food. Waiter came by twice and never even address us or gave a reason for the delay. As they are leaving our food comes but we had already decided we were good and would pay for our drink and would like to go but our waiter didn&#39;t come back until the food did. He brought a manager over and our first sorry was finally given and he wanted us to eat the food and they would give us a slice of cheesecake. Sir, my chili looks like it&#39;s been sitting the last 35 minutes like I have. We will pay for the drinks but you can take the food back. He took the food and left. 8 minutes later the waiter came back and said the manger is going to cover the drinks and we were good to go and he is sorry he put our order in first but it is quicker to cook pasta then a salad and a bowl of chili that we all know is precooked. I can honestly say i don&#39;t think I will return and Cheesecake Factory is my place to get cheesecake from. Disappointed is an understatement.

Met a client today at the cheesecake factory. We had a  really good experience and the food was beautifully prepared. The portions are huge and the cost is inexpensive.<br> As many times as I&#39;ve been here I always seem to get the same thing (the chicken little fingers with mashed potatoes) my favorite.. cheese... but today I decided to try the chicken quesadillias lunch portion.<br> Fresh hot and huge. It came with guacamole and sour cream. I also had the mini crab cakes (4 tiny cake balls) which was pretty good as well and of course the warm bread and butter. Now don&#39;t eat too much before your meal comes because you may not have room left in your tummy.<br> All in all this place is super cool the Ambiance is warm and cozy at the same time. The waitstaff are friendly and pleasant. Parking is ample and there are lots of stores to visit while your in the are connected to the Cheesecake factory. They also have the best cheese cake hands down to me. You just have to have some cheese cake when you visit and they have LOTS to choose from. From double chocolate to vanilla bean you are sure to be pleased. I most likely the strawberry cheese cake when in season. The turtle Cheesecake and the triple coco cake! With some milk!! Ooowha weee!!! Stop the madness!!<br> One last thing.. the rest rooms are clean. This is another biggie for me because if the restrooms are clean it makes me believe the Kitchen is just as clean as well.. just saying..<br> Hope this helps!

Me and my wife stopped here for dinner while we visited Indianapolis. I ordered the Steak Diane and Shrimp Scampi combo plate. The steak was cooked perfectly and the wine sauce in the Shrimp Scampi was perfect. The meal hit the spot. <br><br>The services was on point as well. She was able to answer any questions we had about their specials. From walking in to paying the bill only took about 1 hour. Was way to stuffed to try one of their cheese cakes but I will definitely be back to a cheese cake factory to try their desserts!

A  mortifying experience.<br>We came in around lunch tim,  approximately 12:30pm. So, we waited about 15 minutes to be seated. Then we waited for about 20 minutes before our server came to take out drink order. Then another 20 for the drinks to come to our table. Our order was took and we began to wait again to wait again. After about an hour the manager came to our table and told us that there were some  complications in the kitchen and they were making my mac &amp; cheese bits; they came out about a half hour later. Around 2:30 our food came out. All of the food was improperly prepared i.e., there was onions on a over cooked  burger that ask for no onions,  tomatoes all over the food that requested no tomatoes because of a food allergy, and yet another over cooked burger. Needless to say although we enjoyed our time with each other our birthday meal was completely ruined. I would not  recommend  The Cheesecake Factory. The food was  overpriced for the  situation.

Can&#39;t go wrong when you go to Cheesecake Factory and get cheesecake. I ordered the chipotle chicken dish and I was expecting it to be spicy. It wasn&#39;t spicy at all, just mild. Service was so so at first and then our server by the end started to be more lively. <br><br>Cheesecake was amazing...that&#39;s what they are known for. It&#39;s good for a group gathering.

Service was amazingly over the top. We were hoping to enjoy the outside patio, and got seated there and placed our order but were interrupted with a major thunderstorm. The staff was extremely polite and prepared for the situation and had us moved inside and taken care of immediately. Food was amazing, will definitely be back.

I&#39;ve been here a few times. The most recent time was 6pm on a Saturday and our party of 3 was expected to have a 30 minute wait. However, we saw some openings at the bar after 5 minutes and snagged those. Kevin, one of the bartenders, was extremely helpful and professional. As always, it was so hard to decide what I wanted for my meal since the menu is so extensive. I decided on parmesan herb crusted chicken with green beans and mashed potatoes. Very tasty! There were three chicken breasts so this meal became 3. Can&#39;t visit without getting cheesecake, so I got the toasted s&#39;more. It was not my favorite but it was still delicious just more chocolate than I would have liked.

The family loves this place. Always get generous portions of food here. The wife always gets a salad and sweet potato fries, and I get the spaghetti and meatballs. Great place and the service is always awesome.

&#34;Cheesecake&#34; as it is called in short is my GO TO restaurant when you want to eat out but can&#39;t make up your mind on where to go. Their expansive menu and delicious desserts make it a good choice for when you just can&#39;t seem to figure out what you want to eat. Their portion size is generous and cost is very reasonable as I always pack home leftovers and eat them for lunch the next day (that&#39;s a deal in my book!) <br><br>As far as service goes, 9 times out of 10 i am met with prompt and courteous service. This last time I went however was just abysmal. It wasn&#39;t any busier than it usually is (meaning a big group of 5 or more people will guarantee an hour plus wait). My group of 6 people waited much longer than told (1.5hrs) waited another hour for our entrees to come out, then another and another half an hour to get our desserts to go and our bills settled. If I did the math right, we were there for a little over 3hrs total. I don&#39;t think it would&#39;ve taken that long had our server 1) not dragged her feet waiting on only four tables 2) asking our party of three couples if our check was going to be separate rather than assuming it would be on one bill. She just dropped off one very disorganized check and disappeared making us wait another 10mins to tell her we need it split. <br><br>Again, this is was an outlier to my usual experience here but still very disappointing. <br><br>FYI, for a restaurant with such a notoriously long wait time, they do NOT take reservations or call aheads!

Ordered a whole cheesecake online to pick up for an office birthday. That was 51 minutes ago. I was told they&#39;d be right out when I called from outside. 31 minutes after calling, still nothing. I call back and they aren&#39;t sure if they have my order or not now. Really. I mean, really now. If it weren&#39;t requested by the birthday girl, I wouldn&#39;t have even tried this location again. Corporate needs to send some trainers out to get this place in shape.

I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at Cheesecake Factory. Their meals are plentiful and the desserts are irresistible! <br><br>The menu is overwhelming with choices. There&#39;s no way everyone&#39;s appetite can&#39;t be satisfied. My favorite meal is bang bang shrimp or Mac n cheese balls for my starter, the Louisiana chicken pasta for my entree and the chocolate tower truffle cake for dessert (to go). The portion sizes are hefty, including the salads. <br><br>It&#39;s great to go with friends as they can accommodate large groups. The service is always friendly. Or if you&#39;re just having a craving for something sweet, you can walk right up to their dessert counter to grab a piece of cheesecake or the entire cheesecake to go.

Met friends here on Thursday evening and were told at 6:40 pm it would be an hour for party of 5. Ended up 2 hrs.  Food was ok but when it came time to order cheesecake they were out of 8 or 9 types,  including original.  Too pricey to come back.

I love the atmosphere in this place. :) Even though it&#39;s usually pretty busy, it&#39;s always worth the wait! I&#39;ve come here for a lot of lunch dates with good friends -- and it&#39;s the perfect spot for it. The food options are endless (and good quality) and the staff are generally super friendly. <br><br>During my last visit, I had the potato soup with a side of ceasar salad. Delish! And super filling. <br><br>Even though I&#39;m not a HUGE cheesecake fan, obviously this is the place to splurge. And after you&#39;re done grabbing a bite to eat, you can easily get your shopping on. Overall, it&#39;s worth the visit!

Have always loved this place and rarely go to Indianapolis without making a stop here.  Bread is delicious.  Normally, I have Chicken Bellagio but tried the Chicken Madeira this time.  Chicken was moist, tender &amp; flavorful.  Asparagus was perfectly cooked.  Mashed potatoes were delicious.  My son always likes the burgers.  I&#39;ve never had a bad cheesecake from here.  This time we tried the Lemon Meringue and all I can say is WOW!

Depending on when you go this place can be pretty packed but neverthrless this place is huge and they set accurate expectations on when you will be seated. The mall is connected so you can shop or browse while you wait.<br><br>In regards to the service level they are great.  Once your name is called you are immediately seated and a waiter or waitress greets you immediately and takes your drink order. Even with the restaraunt being  jam packed our sever came by several times to make sure everything was great and brought the food out in a speedy manner I&#39;ve seen restaraunts that were less busy take longer to bring out food.<br><br>In regards to the food it was wonderful, the presentation on the plate was awesome, the flavors blended excellently together and the portion size was nice,  oh yes and the cheesecake was to die for as usual. I can&#39;t wait to go back!

This place never disappoints. I had an Asian chicken salad. It was delicious! Our waitress was very good &amp; knowledgeable. She gave us a few suggestions. We took home a slice of carrot cake cheesecake. It was unbelievably yummy! If you&#39;re in the vicinity you have to check it out.
Terrible wait with reservations over two hours to get your food <br>Not worth the wait either Poor management slow slow slow service

Get here early, or bring a snack for the line. My party of 2 arrived at 6 pm, and the line to simply get our names on the waiting list was to the door. All in all, our total wait time for a table was 80 minutes. The plus point is that this location is connected to the mall, so at least you can let those idle minutes slip by shopping. <br>Despite the wait, the service was fantastic. The hostess for the waiting list was cordial, despite the antsy and hangry customers bestowing upon her, and our server was very prompt and accommodating. Even when our Eggplant Parmesan was rather undercooked, our server immediately notified a manager who apologetically replaced our dish and gave us an appetizer on the house to muse over in the meantime. For a packed restaurant, the service was amazing.<br>The food, however, was meh. It tasted like a chain restaurant food. The thoroughly cooked Eggplant Parmesan was too bready and lacked much of a taste; the sauce was scant and the seasoning was dashed. The pesto pasta served alongside it was also very dry. That being said, I didn&#39;t have high expectations going in, knowing it&#39;s a chain restaurant.
Had the combo steak Diane and chicken Madeira. With backed potato soup. Finished iff with raspberry cheesecake awesome.

I like the Cheesecake Factory overall.  However,  this last visit left me a little disappointed.  I had the Shrimp Scampi.  It was not good. The shrimp is fried and placed on top of a scampi sauce, which causes the breading to become soggy. The use of lemon in their scampi sauce was overpowering.  I could not finish it. It was not appetizing. <br>  The strawberry shortcake was delicious!  They give you such a big portion as well. I was also dissapointed with the amount of time it took us to be seated. We waited for over an hour.

We met our fam here to celebrate our grandmother&#39;s birthday.  They were unable to seat our party together so we ended up at three distinctly different tables with separate tabs.  Our waiter had an issue understanding that we were obviously not seated together and our bills would be separate.  Just so you know I enjoy the cheesecake factory and have spent allot of money here personally and buying dinners for my team at work (I work in the area). I have my usual go to&#39;s and enjoy the occasional lemencello cake from time to time.  Yesterday, our experience was riddled with disregard, ambivalence and incompetence.  From our waiter not understanding our seating and bill situation to me ordering a blood orange margarita that tasted as if 1 cup of pure white sugar was mixed into it. I was thoroughly underwhelmed with my dining experience.  I asked the waiter if I could exchange my drink for something different and less sweet.  I was informed a manager would have to be consulted.  The manager came by and advised I couldn&#39;t change my drink but he could make me another one.  I obliged and the manager returned with a watered down version of the drink I just sent back. Water was added to my drink and it tasted terrible.  When he asked if I liked my drink I told him no and I would never order another.  He laughed/grunted and left to, I assume, add extra water to other drinks.  3.5 hrs later because the service was sooo slow we recieved our bill and had to wait another 30 minutes because of course, you guessed it, the bill was incorrect.<br>Do better cheesecake factory! Do better!

Way overpriced and dirty.  This location was filthy the bathrooms and the table needed cleaned . Way over priced and the cheesecake everyone raves about was ok and came warm. This was my first and only time I&#39;ve gone and I was excited when I entered and super disappointed when I left . The table we were seated at was gross I had to ask for something to clean it with so my kids weren&#39;t sitting in a sticky booth .

Unbelievable horrible service!  This has been a recurring theme here. We have been waiting over 35 mins just for the appetizer to come out.  We have seen our waitress just 2 in that time span. Not likely that we will come back to this place

We had a nice meal. Waited 20 minutes for a table at 6pm on a Friday night. We got a very attentive server, and overall the experience was great. The noise level was a little high, due to the lack of any sound absorbing materials on the ceiling or walls, but it wasn&#39;t too bad. The jambalaya was filling and flavorful. This restaurant is located in the Keystone mall north of Indy.

This is our favorite spot for special days!! Today at lunch we had Brittani H! She had a full section and was right there when she was supposed to be! She let us know all the key things about the menu and got our drinks quickly! I got the cheddar stuffed burger with caramelized onions on brioche bun!! Best burger ever!! We always get the fried macaroni cheese!! Love them so much we get 2 orders!! Both of my son&#39;s got chicken Alfredo dinner!! Giant portions!!! Of course our main concern is which dessert to try!!! It takes us 2 days of looking at the menu to pick our cheesecakes!! Hahaha!! My boys had a golf outing to attend and we were in and out quickly!! I got chocolate mousse Chzcake!! They had a celebration Chzcake and and a white chocolate raspberry Chzcake!! OMG ALL PERFECT!! we highly recommend going there! Weekday lunch at 11:45am was perfect. No wait yet! Ask for Britt

Going before 6pm on a Wednesday evening we were seated quickly &amp; our server Bree was wonderful: attentive without hovering.  She brought us warm wheat &amp; sourdough bread to nosh on while we went over the menu. The butter was served cold which made it a little difficult to spread over the bread but it warmed up a bit after a few mins. Our drinks were refilled without having to flag someone down &amp; extra lemons given for our water.<br><br>We started off with Chicken Samosas &amp; it was a great choice.  The spicy chicken came in a crispy wrapping with a cilantro dipping sauce. These were good enough to be an entree had there been a few more. My husband chose a turkey burger with a side salad which he really enjoyed. I ordered the Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp...a symphony of flavors that didn&#39;t disappoint. The menu states:  &#34;A Spicy Thai Dish with the Flavors of Curry, Peanut, Chile and Coconut. Sautéed with Vegetables and Served over Steamed White Rice.&#34; You can substitute brown rice for white if you prefer. The portion was HUGE &amp; I was able to save half for lunch today (btw it reheats quite well).  We would have had dessert but we were quite satisfied &amp; didn&#39;t want to overdo it...though from past experiences at CF the cakes are just as good as the cheesecakes.

We had a horrible experirence with a female manager here. Our order was wrong and this individual did not apologize - did not offer to fix the situtation - and brushed us off as if we weren&#39;t even human beings. I refuse to dine at a restaurant that does not treat its patrons with respect, especially when orders are wrong and no apologies are even offered. This was a horrifying experience that no diners should ever have to go through: long wait times, dirty table, wrong food, and rude/immature management.

We will NEVER return to this restaurant again! We waited 45 minutes for our food and once it was brought to us, we realized it had been sitting in the window dying. Pasta was dried out and my burgers toppings were hot..who wants hot lettuce and tomato on their dried out burger!? Also, plate was hot which is not a problem but, a warning would have been nice. <br>Server only checked on us at the end of the meal to see if we wanted boxes. Seemed like he was in a hurry for us to leave.<br><br>Now, we work in the restaurant business so we get that sometimes you just have those off nights but, this was just unacceptable. We had to ask for a manager because the food was just not edible. We didn&#39;t want to wait another 45 minutes on new entrees so all he had to offer were desserts. He took one meal off and still charged for one dessert. We didn&#39;t go in with the intentions of getting our meal for free but, it would have been nice if they would have taken these entrees off as we did not even eat them.<br><br>We will make sure to inform everyone to stay clear of this establishment as they obviously do not care about presentation of food. As a manager, they should have never let something like that even land on a table. As a server, if it doesn&#39;t look right to me, I refuse to take it to a guest until it is right. Makes you wonder how many violations are going on back there in the kitchen. Thank you for nothing.

I come here often and usually have great service. NOT today. The restaurant didn&#39;t appear as clean (dirty folk on the floor near table, sticky something on the table, and sticky crumbs on several menu pages). Server could not multi-task. Once a few of his other tables were sat, I was forgotten. Once he did come back, I immediately requested a box to just take my food home to enjoy. Disappointed because I enjoy coming here.

I&#39;m not a wait-for-2-hours-to-eat-here fanatic, but I do think they have several good options.  The guacamole is surprisingly good, and you can customize how spicy you want it.  The skinnylicious factory chopped salad (apples, bacon, grilled chicken) is good and won&#39;t doom you to days at the gym if you eat it.  At my last visit, I requested a margarita in a rocks glass instead of the tall, curvy one it usually comes in, and the server and bartender were happy to accommodate me.<br><br>Tip:  if you don&#39;t mind eating dinner early, you can get a seat in the bar at 5pm on a Friday and beat the rush, then hit the mall for shopping to walk off your meal.

There are so many delicious things to order here! The menu is so expansive! Tried the egg roll sampler which was tasty! Definitely recommend. Steak Diane was excellent, pastas are delicious, salads and sandwiches great too! We&#39;ve been here a couple times in the last few weeks for peppermint bark cheesecake (yum!) and the servers are very friendly and helpful but the attentiveness is not always there - last night we waited a long time for the server to even come to our table after we were seated and get drinks. Asked for ranch or another item and it too forever to receive. Blue cheese brought instead of ranch, sauce on the side instead of the sandwhich which was not by request, shredded cabbage to put on a sandwhich instead of shredded lettuce, etc. odd little details not quite right. Still overall great experience but leaves you wondering hmm....

Quickie Review: If you want to go for the horrible experience, that&#39;s one thing, but there are cheaper, and better, options elsewhere.<br><br>I recently made a reluctant return visit to the Cheesecake Factory as that&#39;s where my girlfriend wanted to go for her birthday dinner. Due to past experiences I knew it was going to be a 50/50 chance of it being good or bad. Well, this was easily the worst experience I have ever had.<br><br>So besides waiting over an hour to be seated, which I understand because of how busy they were but yet don&#39;t understand how everyone that was waiting could afford their prices, we also had to wait for our waiter for about 10-15 min. before he brought us our water. Normally I&#39;m a little bit more understanding, but I had to point that out because he only returned to fill our waters once out of the almost two hours we were there.<br><br>Then, in terms of the food, of course one of our meals was cooked wrong. The cheese burger we received was under cooked and instead of waiting an outrageous amount of time for another one was just taken home for the dog. I was hoping the cheesecake would be the saving grace, but that was just getting my hopes up. For a place that&#39;s supposed to be known for having the best it was certainty the worst I ever had.<br><br>I&#39;ll be the first one to admit that I&#39;ve had some good experiences here in the past, but the past is the past and I for one will not be giving them another chance. If there is a positive it would be that I have been able to discover other venues through the years that taste better and are cheaper. For instance, got a craving for cheesecake but don&#39;t want to wait or spend an outrageous amount? Head on over to McAlister&#39;s across the street. Their cheesecake is only $4.50, twice the size and tastes much better as it isn&#39;t half whip cream.<br><br>So, the moral of the story is that if you don&#39;t like long wait times, don&#39;t like spotty service and want to pay a reasonable price for your food then I&#39;d suggest going elsewhere. If you want the busy cheesecake factory experience, though, then HEY! more power to ya.

Okay, I know the Cheesecake Factory is a chain, but I have to admit, I&#39;m a sucker for it. I mean, a menu that is LITERALLY a spiral bound notebook and a glass case full of cheesecake, what is not to love?<br><br>I go about once a year, and that is enough, but there&#39;s something fun about this place around the holidays when the mall is already bustling with shoppers. <br><br>Everything from the bread to the mugs of water to the Skinnylicious menu is something I can get behind. I appreciate their attempts to be healthy, but usually I just say &#34;screw it&#34; and order something off the regular menu.<br><br>A favorite salad of mine is the California Guacamole salad. The avocado flavor is amazing, and combined with the feta cheese, radishes, corn, and black beans, it&#39;s a party in your mouth.<br><br>Other favorites: <br>Avocado egg rolls <br>spicy buffalo chicken meatballs <br>flatbreads <br><br>For dessert, my personal favorite cheesecake is the tiramisu. You&#39;d think it would be really rich - it&#39;s actually not. My mom and I asked to split a piece on our most recent visit, and this was the first time that our server actually brought out a piece split in half on plates for both of us. In the past, we&#39;ve had to do the splitting ourselves. I thought that was a nice touch. <br><br>I&#39;ve found there is usually always a wait no matter if you come during peak hours or not. Wait times are never too bad, and you can always spend time waiting browsing at stores close by - Saks, Crate and Barrel, etc. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is definitely not a place I need to go to often, but it&#39;s a fun splurge every now and then. I don&#39;t claim that it&#39;s healthy for you, but I do claim that the majority of their food is pretty good.

This restraunt is very organized and a yummy place to eat at. All the waiters and waitresses are super nice and helpful. The chiefs there do such a good job at preparing delicious food for the customers. Keep up the good work. Whenever I go there, I have the pasta da Vinci. It is very moist and fresh. I highly recommend this delicious dish to everyone. And I love the cheesecake flavors as well. The last one tried was the chocolate fudge cheesecake, and it was delicious and moist. Basically all the cheesecakes there are very good.

We waited an hour and a half for our food. The people behind us were seated forty minutes after us and got their food before us. The waiters and waitresses were nice and came to check on us and checked on our food but kept forgetting to bring our bread and drinks. One waiter brought me a drink when I specifically said I didn&#39;t want one. The plus side was that the cheesecake was amazing as usual but I could get a better burger at Steak and Shake. They didn&#39;t even give us a discount on our food for waiting so long. They also gave us a new server four times. The place wasn&#39;t busy either. We went at about 4 pm and it was pretty empty.

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s at the mall, there are no reservations in advance. There&#39;s a bar. Not tons of seating for waiting. I like that they  now have a Skinnylicious menu. I am guessing this goes for all Cheesecake Factories. The servers are good. Looks like they are now selling dressings. How &#39;bout them apples.

For an appetizer we ordered the buffalo chicken. OMG!!! It was good. The next time i will order that for the meal so I don&#39;t have to share.  The service was good. That always make eating out more enjoyable. The chicken salad sandwich was, as usual, excellent. Thanks for a great lunch.

You can count on TCF being consistent, which is so nice. I love the huge selection of food. Ambience is loud and lively. Servers are good natured and friendly every time. The huge selection of cheesecake is amazing - be prepared to share. I actually prefer other desserts. Portion size is out of control - good thing they offer smaller portions now. I&#39;m partial to their chicken Alfredo. I love that I can walk around the mall to digest after a satisfying meal! The wait can be long, but if you&#39;re savvy, you can grab a seat on the high tops behind the bar - I don&#39;t think age matters. I usually just ask people at a table  who look like they&#39;ll finish up soon if I can have their table when they leave - no rush. I have been coming here for years and still enjoy the firecracker salmon rolls, sliders, mini crab cakes, and so much more!

One of my favorite place to eat because the food is consistently well-made. The ambiance is great and the service is superb.  <br><br>I ordered a shrimp and sausage pasta and my friend ordered a miso salmon over white rice.  They were both fantastic! The shrimp and sausage pasta has a perfect sauce, it was missing a bit of shrimp though. Otherwise, everything was perfect

Been here three times. Hate cheesecake, but the Shepard&#39;s Pie keeps me coming back. Everything looks good, but this (I&#39;ve been told by a true Scot) is the closest ever to a true English Shepard&#39;s Pie.  Service is always good, polite but  not overly attentive. Really would like to try something else, but not while this is here.

Very very loud atmosphere and super dark/gloomy. My fiancé didn&#39;t get what she ordered. Minimum wait is usually an hour or more, which is not worth it in my opinion. That&#39;s after you fight the crowd to get up to the hostess booth. Just not sure what the big hype is about...

Located at Keystone at the Crossing, a wait is absolutely expected; however waiting 1 1/2 hours for the food AFTER being seated was ridiculously frustrating.<br><br>Before the 1.5hrs had elapsed, I&#39;d spoken to the manager and expressed my dissatisfaction and albeit cordial he chalked it up to &#34;each dish being a special order&#34; - which defies logic because who cooks gumbo and white chicken chili in individual portions. NO ONE unless they don&#39;t know what they are doing. So I reserved further comment because our food was arriving at this point.<br>Low and freakin behold, the beans in the white chicken chili were hard as rocks. Like, wtf .<br><br>No one expects fine dining from Cheesecake Factory, but for a 2 hour wait I expect more than that. Too many food options in this city for food that doesn&#39;t taste any better than what I can get for under $10.
The Louisiana chicken pasta is delicious!! And definitely worth the wait, as this place is always busy! So many flavors with the perfect kick, I get this dish every time I come here!

I don&#39;t understand why people go to The Cheesecake Factory JUST for cheesecake. Have you tried their food? It is mouth-watering good! My friends and I got the lettuce wraps for an appetizer and it filled me up before my meal even came. While I didn&#39;t get cheesecake (lactose-intolerant problems) the carrot cake was one of the best I had ever tasted! Portion sizes are amazing. However, I will say the menu overwhelmed me a bit. It is a mini booklet. For someone who is not good at making decisions like me, it may be best to just ask what others recommend or what their specialties and fan-favorites are! I can&#39;t wait to return!

Not worth the trouble. I gave up a long time ago of dining in because they have a bunch of kids running the hostess stand, there&#39;s always 100 pp waiting, regardless of time of day. Ordered shrimp scampi curbside, took me longer to get them to answer the phone than waiting on this horrible food to be cooked. Nothing easy or special about the cheesecake experience. Now the food is crap-no thanks.

Let me start by saying there are way too many good restaurants in this area of Indy for this restaurant to make such a stupid mistake.  In my opinion this place deserves to fail.<br><br>I sat down at the bar at about 9:20pm on a Tue night and I ordered a Salmon entree and specifically asked them to cook my fish medium rare.  Why?  Because I can&#39;t stand over cooked fish and so many restaurants over cook it because they&#39;re worried about liability.  I was told the chef wouldn&#39;t cook it medium rare and that they typically cook salmon medium well?  Really?  That&#39;s dry and gross.  The bartender was cool and said he&#39;ll cook it medium and im ok with that as long as it&#39;s not overlooked.<br><br>The food came and it was medium well, seriously I wanted to strangle someone, I was so hungry and it was now after 10:00.  Thankfully they remade my dinner and it only took another long 20 minutes!<br><br>Seriously this is unacceptable when the restaurant is not busy.  And nobody likes dry fish, are you people really that stupid that you&#39;d rather cover your butt with legal worries vs honoring requests from your customers?<br><br>Your priorities are mixed up and your chef needs a lesson on cooking food the appropriate way.<br><br>I will NEVER be back and I hope you fail.

Awful. The place had barely any customers being closer to opening hours but it took FOREVER to get our food. Manager stopped by and apologized so that was nice. Once served the entire plate was dried out like it had been sitting in the back all morning. I probably ate 10% of it before deciding it wasn&#39;t worth my Sunday.  The coffee was fine and the server said &#34;sorry&#34; so that was a nice thought I guess... $43 later and I still had to walk over to Starbucks to grab something. I&#39;m not a big chain person but I&#39;ve never really had a bad experience here so it must just be an off day? Going forward I&#39;ll stick with the cheesecake...

Louisiana Chicken Pasta was very flavorful &amp; delicious! My husband had Carbonara Pasta. He enjoyed Carbonara Pasta, but he liked Louisiana Chicken Pasta more. Our dessert Lemoncello Cream Tart was amazing!! Must try!!<br>Great atmosphere, and we had no waiting on Monday around 12:30pm.

We were celebrating a birthday and stopped by to pick up two slices of Linda&#39;s fudge cake on Saturday around 7:00 in the evening. I realize it was a Saturday evening and the dining room was very busy with a long wait for a table, but what I witnessed was complete disorganization. We got in the carry out line. While waiting in that line for 15 minutes, we saw several people that had ordered online only to come in and wait 30 more minutes because their order had been lost. When we finally got to the register to order, we were told that it would be over 30 more minutes before we could get our carry out slices of cake. They have a great product, but need a better way to serve customers. Needless to say, we decided to save the calories and not wait.

I am trying to expand my eating out habits by visiting less chains and eating at more local restaurants but often I am still dragged to chains when friends want to eat at them. This happened to me with Cheesecake Factory about 3 times between friends and work lunches in a period of about a month. I hadn&#39;t been in a couple of years otherwise!<br><br>So here is a little about my visits, this particular location is large and always has a nice, fast hostess [I have gone during not-so-busy times so that helps as this place can get packed]. Service has always been at least average, with a few above average, as you would expect. On to the important part...the food!<br><br>The menu is huge, so I would recommend looking at it beforehand so you have an idea. They have a &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu of healthier options and this is not just 3-4 options but a bunch, consider me impressed, highly recommend taking a look if you are looking to eat lighter or save room for cheesecake. I have had the turkey &amp; avocado sandwich from this menu twice because I liked it so much the first time. It wasn&#39;t made quite as well the second time, but I still enjoyed it, it comes with a salad that is already tossed in dressing and once again, was much better the first time. <br><br>The other recent visit I had I got the grilled chicken &amp; avocado sandwich from the regular menu [Yes, I really like sandwiches..and avocado] and this sandwich was a DISASTER. I have never ever had so much trouble eating a sandwich before. Everything fell of immediately and turned a mess on my plate, I had to eat with a fork and knife and it wasn&#39;t even that good. It definitely got a few good laughs but I would not recommend this sandwich.<br><br>I only had cheesecake on one visit but lemme just tell you that the smores cheesecake is outstanding!! I managed to stretch it between two nights and it was soo sooo good. Highly recommend if you like smores. <br><br>So, who knows how long it will be before I return but I like the diversity of food options at this place and may have to splurge on another cheesecake slice soon!

This restaurant is mediocre at best. The last time we went was terrible. The food already took about 45 minutes to get to our table, but only 2 of the 4 entrees had come. One of which was mine. It was okay. It took about another 20 minutes before the last 2 arrived and my dad and I were already done. My mom had asked for a burger, and apparently if you don&#39;t tell them otherwise they will cook it medium rare. So, as any normal person would, she sent it back. We never got another burger. The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because our server was good, and the complementary cheesecake was good.

CurbSidePickUp. This review is exclusively for the curbside pickup. Most people are aware of the food here and if you&#39;re not, long story short- the place has earned its name!  Eat the cheesecake first. <br>Ok. Now for the real review. <br>The curbside pickup.  I&#39;m not sure how long this has been an option, but at the north-side Indy location, they need to work out several issues. If someone from CCF is reading this, create a staff position titled &#34;CurbSide Delivery.&#34;  Hire 2 people for your busiest times.<br>Pros: Cheesecake<br>Cons: 1) No one answered the phone- for 15 minutes. I called the number indicated for the Curbside pickup,  and after 4 rings, it went to a busy signal. Every time. For 15 minutes. Glad I wore shoes.  At the last second I thought &#34;what if?&#34; and ran to grab my boots. <br>2) there is no staff to serve only those who ordered CurbSide or Carry Out.<br>3) No place or signs to tell customers where to pick up food in the restaurant.<br>3) no signage to tell customers where to park for pickups <br>4) stop advertising curbside pickup if they aren&#39;t going to have it <br><br>Now I Know<br>1) Wear shoes<br>2) When paying ahead of time, don&#39;t add tip and only tip cash upon arrival (I wish I didn&#39;t tip because someone who probably didn&#39;t even help me got that tip.)<br>3)always wear shoes to pick up, even if I expect to have the food brought to me. <br>4)don&#39;t call for 15 minutes, just go in!<br><br>Hoping this is so new and they are just practicing (and reading this!) and will improve soon.

Great service, bread was good and lemons were fresh. The pricing however, was a little bit on the high side. We spent $45 dollars but the portions were not enough to feed our family of 4. The Mac and cheese burger was rather disappointing, as we could not find the Mac and cheese despite the lack of everything else on the small patty. The spicy Chipotle chicken pasta was okay.

This Cheesecake Factory restaurant was quite impressive to me. My experience was better than I thought for the first time. I don&#39;t like cheesecake but the other items on the menu helped enhance my experience.<br> <br>The design and layout of the restaurant was remarkably classy. Outside the restaurant during the day was very pretty. The top of the building to the side reminded me of a historical marking such as a hidden temple of some kind. As well as the inside being pretty, at night the outside of the building is lit up and stands out. All the designs inside and outside of the building went well together and it was a warm, smooth, environment. I really liked how all the colors went smoothly well together on the inside and outside of the building. It&#39;s a classy and fancier restaurant. Other times I tried to go with family and friends, there was a very long wait. I&#39;ve only been one other time; which was my first time. The Cheesecake Factory always seems like a well fit popular environment that keeps business alive.<br><br> As service goes, right when I walked through the door we were greeted with a few of the workers saying a few words and smiling. The group I was with, we were all properly greeted before we were to order our food/drinks. The restaurant was a little louder than I was expecting for as fancy and classy as the restaurant was. The food was delivered on a timely manner and everything came out correctly as ordered. At times, we had to wait a few to get refills on our drinks; but they were busy at the time. We didn&#39;t have any other problems other than the slow times for refills on our drinks. Our waitress treated us phenomenally well for as busy as they were.<br><br> For it being my first time some of the food was phenomenal and some of it wasn&#39;t the best. I ordered the kid&#39;s pasta with alfredo and I didn&#39;t think it was too great. There wasn&#39;t presentation to this dish. The alfredo wasn&#39;t very smooth and it felt dry to me. The noodles were fine, I believe it was the alfredo that threw the entire dish off. Another dish I tried were the fried mac n cheese balls. The fried mac n cheese balls had a clean presentation to the dish when it came out to the table. They were served over a nice creamy marinara sauce and crispy crumb mac n cheese balls. On the top was some little green leaves and a few pieces of shredded cheese. The inside of the friend mac n cheese balls was very hot; which made them taste even better. Me personally, I like crispy foods so the crispy outside was the perfect fit for me.<br><br> Overall, the experience was one to remember. I&#39;d recommend The Cheesecake Factory to anyone to go out and try! It&#39;s a clean, classy, warm feeling environment. I hope I can make another trip to a different Cheesecake Factory restaurant and see if it lives up to the expectations of the one at Keystone Crossing!

This is your typical Cheesecake Factory food chain restaurant and it is located inside a mall plaza. I think the location is very convenient too.<br><br>I really like Cheesecake Factory because the menu selection is huge and there are so many options. Plus I have a sweet tooth for cheesecake like fresh strawberry, red velvet and anything chocolate or white chocolate. The service was good.

The other night I tried the Shepherd&#39;s Pie.  It sounded good.  I was expecting a crispy crust like a pot pie.  I did not care for peas so I knew I would be picking those out but maybe I could have asked for them to hold them.  <br><br>It was nice of the restaurant to give a scoop of ice cream as a birthday dessert but a cheesecake would have been nicer and really bring out would they are known for.<br><br>The chicken for the Thai lettuce wrap was good.  And the key lime cheesecake tasted fine.

Where do I start? Our server, Matt, was amazing and the only satisfactory part of our experience here. My food came out 10 minutes before my boyfriends, and when it did come out, it was cold. The server asked if he could get a manager for us, and we said sure. The first manager was ALMOST decent, but all he originally offered was to microwave his food. It came back (obviously) tasting like hard, microwaved chicken. When we expressed this, he said all he could do was offer a free piece of cheesecake. We were kind of expecting his meal to be comped, since it was disgusting, so we asked to speak to a different manager. Then we met manager Heidi. She told us a free piece of cheesecake was the best she could do, and the only way his meal could be comped is if they immediately took it back before it was eaten at all. My boyfriend said okay, and she took it and walked away. My boyfriend then chuckled to himself (because we were both so shocked at the terrible customer service) and she turned around from 10 feet away and came back with an attitude and asked sarcastically, &#34;what else needs to be done because I heard you laughing to yourself&#34;. We were shocked at her lack of professionalism and told her we were fine, and continued laughing at the situation after she left, she then turned around AGAIN to confront us, and we said, again, that we&#39;re fine. Manager Heidi was literally looking for a fight, with paying customers nonetheless. I am shocked and horrified at her lack of professionalism, attitude, and EXTREME AGGRESSION. It&#39;s a shame because I love the Cheesecake Factory, but I will not be back until this vile manager Heidi is gone.

I can&#39;t help it.  I&#39;m a fan.  On occasion, I buy into the whole Cheesecake Factory hype.  I think it&#39;s a beautiful decor/atmosphere.  I do like the cheesecake.  I like the incredibly huge menu selection.  There are some specific dishes I like to repeat such as the chicken Marsala, the tamale corn cakes, and oh Godfrey help me, I love that dark brown bread slathered in butter!  That being said, it&#39;s only a 3 star because they are inconsistent.  Sometimes the servers are nice, and on more than one occasion, I have had some truly rude servers.  The drinks sound so good, and they taste good in a fruity kind of way.  They just lack any kind of kick.  At the price, I thought I was paying for alcohol, but there doesn&#39;t ever seem to be any in my drinks! Being at Keystone Fashion Mall, they seem to always be busy, therefore always seeming to be a wait.  I&#39;m not going to pretend I&#39;m not going back because at some point, I will.

The Cheesecake Factory does a great job of sustaining a high quality menu with pretty good results. You can count on enjoying a nice meal each time you visit. With all of the menu options I&#39;m shocked they are able to offer such consistent quality. That being said, I&#39;m going to try to remember never to order the nachos again.I was disappointed tonight. The chips were a little too overdone IMHO. I asked if that were normally that dark and they said yes. I get that that be a bit by design, but I didn&#39;t care for them nonetheless. I also only got like 3 bites of chicken.The toppings were a bit thin for the price.<br><br>However, these guys are a solid 4 stars, verging on 5. For now, I guess I just have to resolve that nachos are for Taco Bell.

The food was excellent but our waiter was not thrilled to wait on us. His attitude only changed when it was time for the bill. It took 25 minutes to just get our drinks and bread to the table. He did not wear a name tag that we could see.

We hesitate to go out to the Cheesecake Factory because the wait is always so long and with kids, we just can&#39;t wait 45 minutes to an hour. We decided to wait it out this past Sunday - we were quoted about 50 minutes for a table for 6 and that timing was about accurate. I do have to say that the wait was worth it though!  Our waiter, a gentleman with black hair and glasses (sorry I don&#39;t recall his name) was AMAZING!  He ensured we always had everything we needed and he recommended the most amazing dish I have had in a very long time - the Chicken Bellagio!  Lightly breaded chicken with a side of pasta, it was so amazing!!  And I had lunch the next day with my leftovers!!  I would definitely say it&#39;s worth the wait if you can spare the time!

I&#39;ve been coming here for years. I slip in and order a piece of cheesecake to go and slip out. Well not today. I decided to put my name on the waiting list and order a meal. I have to say, from the strange options on the menu, they are trying to please a little bit of everyone in the crowd. From Enchiladas to pizza and burgers I ordered a Chicken Madeira.  Sautéed chicken breasts with a light sauce and some fresh mushrooms and mozzarella cheese. Comes with asparagus and potatoes, but I got steamed broccoli instead of the potatoes. I didn&#39;t finish it off with a piece of banana cheesecake, it had fresh sliced banana on top and fresh whipped cream. very good.

Get ready to read a book, the menu has a lot of pages! We decided to order off the appetizer menu for our lunch. Fried zucchini, chicken lettuce wraps and the sausage flat bread. The fried zucchini was really good, the dipping sauce had a kick. Lettuce wraps are not traditional, the chicken is in large pieces. Bean sprouts, carrots, cucumbers, and some type of noodles are on the plate, along with three sauces. It was a very large serving, we ordered too much food! The flatbread pizza was smaller, but very tasty.  I took a star off because the service was very slow. We waited ten minutes before a waiter took our drink orders. We sat in the bar and it was half empty. If I&#39;m at the fashion mall this is in my top two for lunch.

If you&#39;re allergic to shrimp, go for the cheesecake and forget about eating anything else. They&#39;re really nice about it, but as the manager told me, &#34;90% of my stations back there have shrimp on them.&#34;<br><br>Wow. I&#39;m not asking for special privileges, I just don&#39;t wanna die. Or swell up like something three days dead. You&#39;d think they&#39;d have some sort of plan, with a restaurant this big and expensive. Though I guess you can get the meatballs. <br><br>The cheesecake is awesome, but not good enough to die for. Thanks.

As always this place is abundant in style and class. The waitresses are friendly and curteous. The food is rediculously amazing. It&#39;s has beautiful presentation and the taste to match! Always an adventure for the taste buds. By far one of my all time favorite spots.

Every time my wife and I go to Indy we have to make a stop at the Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s a bit pricey but I&#39;ve never had a bad meal. The last time we were there we got the lunch portions of the grilled salmon and it was incredible. The cheesecake is amazing and it&#39;s best to split a slice with your significant other. (the Oreo Dream Extreme is yummy!) We&#39;ve been lucky in not having a very long wait time when we have gone. The service has always been very good.

I recently had lunch at the Cheesecake Factory on a Saturday around noon with some friends from out of town. One of my companions had never been there before so we decided to check it out (this was my 3rd time). The place was pretty busy with a 15 minute wait inside or immediate seating outside. Since it was nice out and not too breezy, we opted for the outdoor dining option. They have heaters set up around the tables so with it being in the low 60s, they kept any chill from what wind there was away.<br><br>I had the lunch portion of the fish and chips; it came with fries and a large helping of cole slaw. My friends had the lunch portion of the fettuccine and a chicken salad. I by far had the most food on my plate. While there were only 3 pieces of fish, there were a lot of fries and coleslaw. It all tasted very good and my friends would agree. Prior to this meal, I had had the meatloaf and the Moroccan Chicken on previous visits (I didn&#39;t see the Moroccan Chicken on the menu this time however) and it all tasted wonderful. <br><br>The service was great as our waiter was attentive and kept our drinks filled. He helped my friends pick out their respective pieces of cheesecake (I was too full from the meal, but I have had it before). You really can&#39;t go wrong with any of the numerous flavors of cheesecake to choose from. They are called the Cheesecake Factory for a reason. <br><br>The prices are a bit higher than your typical chain restaurant as is to be expected based on its location in the fashion mall. The lunch sized portions ran for about $12.50. I felt the prices for cheesecake were reasonable based on the size portion you receive. I&#39;ve been to many other restaurants where desert was the same price but you received a third of what you get here.<br><br>All in all, while more of a special occasion restaurant choice for me, I would definitely recommend it and will be returning.

Long story short: The food is good, but be prepared for a long wait, noisy dining area, slow kitchen, and for pick-up orders, missing items and mistakes.<br><br>Over the past three months, we&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory location about half a dozen times, and they&#39;ve somehow managed to screw up every single time. At this point, we give up and are not coming back. Nearly every time we&#39;ve dined in, there&#39;s been a long wait to be seated (which, okay, it&#39;s busy--not a reason I took off stars), but then after being seated, it was an extremely long time before our food would arrive. To their credit, our servers have always been friendly and skilled--they can&#39;t help a slow kitchen--but if the restaurant is routinely busy at certain times, hire the staff needed to get your guests *something* to eat within 40 minutes. I mean, appetizers should *not* take that long. Specifically, we&#39;d gone three times during Sunday brunch hours and a couple of weeknights for dinner (Thursday or Friday).<br><br>FWIW, the Cuban rolls appetizer, Chicken Madeira, Chicken di Pana, and their cheesecakes are excellent. I have loved the Lemoncello Torte, original cheesecake, and Dulce de Leche cheesecake. The yummy food is just not worth all the screw ups to me.<br><br>We thought we&#39;d had a bright idea ordering food for pick-up instead--ha, not. Our first takeout order was missing--get this--the two pieces of cheesecake we ordered! It didn&#39;t even occur to us that this would happen from The Cheesecake Factory, but when we got home, we had to call them and turn right around. Really, in half a dozen experiences, we haven&#39;t had even one go smoothly. We&#39;ve since gone to the Maggiano&#39;s nearby, which has shorter wait times, equally good service, and doesn&#39;t take 40 minutes to an hour for appetizers or fail to give us what we ordered.
Food is generally good but always 40% overpriced.  Pasta dishes are ... meh ok.  Best suggestion is eat at any of the other much better restaurants, and stop by here to get dessert to go.

We ate here as a party of six from GenCon 2017.  We wanted to go someplace good, and I had not eaten at one ever nor had another member of the party.  It was Saturday night and they were busy, but we were told it would be 70 minutes.  At 80 minutes we were antsy and asked how long.  They looked surprised and talked among themselves.  We were finally seated 90 minutes after we arrived.  And Split up.  We waited 90 minutes to sit in two groups.  If we had stayed together, we would still be waiting (its the Sunday after).  We waited so long, we just committed and stayed, we should have left. <br><br>The manager came to both tables (around the corner from each other, we couldn&#39;t even talk to the other half of the group) and said because we had waited 15 minutes extra we could have an apptzr at each table.  Great (first of all she didn&#39;t have her facts straight).  You could tell the waiter knew he had been stuck with two tables that were already upset.  he did a great job, skinny red headed kid I wish I had caught his name.  He did a great job.  Until the expediters brought our food.  I asked for ranch dressing for my fries.  The tall blond expediter told me, gosh can you just ask your server I am sure you understand.  (while she was walking away).  Our waiter who had paid such good attention to us, came back when we were finished.<br><br>I will never go back to ANY cheesecake factory.  EVER

I am so contradictory whether I should give this store a five stars. I will say that the cheesecake here is not only tasty but also amazing !!! ~~ It is not so sweet !~ Nice !~<br><br>However, the waiter did a faulty job. I didn&#39;t mean every waiter, but the waiter who takes care of us is really hurry ... The attitude he showed to us really like hasten the customer to check   .. Actually, in that time we want to order more..   but he took our bill away and only left  a hurry back.. We wonder why he didn&#39;t ask us whether need more dishes ...

I hadn&#39;t been here in years and was actually a little bit excited to go. They definitely fill up quickly and you can expect to wait for a table. The quality of food was not bad. A little bland, but decent. I had the honey truffle chicken and it was fine but extremely bland. It definitely tasted like it wasn&#39;t seasoned. Service, however, is extremely slow. You will wait for a table, wait for a server, you will wait for your drinks, and you&#39;ll wait 40-50 minutes for your food. Also, the attention to detail when it comes to cleanliness is lackluster. I waited 45 minutes for a table so I think that it should be properly sanitized with no food from their previous patrons stuck to the table. I also think that it would be a nice touch if your silverware were clean and polished before they are rolled in linens. I&#39;d go again if it is suggested, but it probably wouldn&#39;t be my first or second choice.

I had been asking to come here for a while, I remembered the last experience I had as being really good so I was eager to go back. Arrived 9:20pm on a Monday evening, waited a few moments to be sat because the hostess wasn&#39;t at the station. Upon seating, the server came over quickly and explained specials and took drink orders. We did not get appetizers, surpassing those for entrees only. My date ordered fettuccine alfredo with chicken, I ordered the Parmesan crusted chicken with mashed potatoes and green beans. My date asked for bread with the pasta but the server brought it out about a minute after taking our order. No problem, except the bread was hard as a rock. Chewing through it actually made the muscles of my jaw hurt. How is it possible for no one to notice the bread is like concrete? Ok. Wait about 25 minutes for food, it finally arrives and my entire plate is sitting in roughly a quarter inch of water. I don&#39;t know if this is water from the green beans or grease from the chicken but wow, no one in the kitchen thought to pour off all that water my potatoes and chicken were swimming in? Ugh. I had to sop the majority up with napkins. The chicken was EXTREMELY soggy (probably the water) and the &#34;Parmesan crust&#34; was a nasty lump of brownish cheese and bread crumbs that didn&#39;t have even the slightest &#39;crust&#39; to it. Potatoes were ok, but damn thin by the time the water absorbed into them. The green beans were those very hard snap beans, I do not care for super crunchy green beans so that was a hard pass. My date complained of the alfredo being &#34;flavorless&#34;, i tried it for myself and found the noodles and sauce ok but the chicken was not good. The entire alfredo dish was borderline cold by the time it got to the table, he peppered the heck out of it just to make it halfway edible. Food was such a disappointment. You know when half of the food is left on the plate, something wasnt right. Ordered the Hershey cheesecake and my date got the original, meh the Hershey was good but it has no crust at all. It is a piece of devils food cake with some chocolate cheesecake filling layered in the middle. Date said the original was ok, but said it was no better than the cheap no bake kinds at the grocery. Server was attentive but kind of strange, no reason to fault her though. We were all in all disappointed and left wishing we had spent the money at any one of the other restaurants nearby that probably had better food. Ironically, we both were sick the next day and had bubble guts all day long. I&#39;m not blaming CF but i really do regret having come here based on the entire experience. I couldn&#39;t believe the price we paid for two entrees that both were borderline disgusting and two slices of mediocre cheesecake. Never again. Please spend your money at Sullivan&#39;s just nearby or any of the 400 other quality restaurants on the north side. CF has gone downhill in a major way.

Excellent selection for both the meal and dessert, it was great that I had the option of small plates style dining and my date was able to get a full portion meal. As always the cheesecake was delicious. The service was great and the atmosphere was pleasant.

Love, love, love this place. My friend came into town last Friday and we ate on the patio. Always great customer service. The PUMPKIN CHEESECAKE is back and I will definitely get it soon. They bring the pumpkin cheesecake back every year. Enjoy the Hibachi Steak, best steak in town, hands down. I have never been disappointed. This place is definetly a keeper If you are extreme budgeting, the best thing to order here when you meet friends out, is...... a house salad, and an appetizer, and you will still be able to leave a tip. I do it whenever I&#39;m extreme budgeting.

A favorite stop when at  the Fashion Mall. I had the new chicken coconut curry &amp; it was excellent. Very flavorful &amp; spicy. The hubs had chicken Alfredo which was also very good. The service was slow at this location.

I do not recommend this place for a dinning, only the cheesecake. The wait was 30 minutes and they didn&#39;t take reservations. After calling us to be seated, we waited another 8 minutes to be seated.  <br><br>Their the fried macaroni is their best appetizer. <br><br>Their main courses are way over priced. <br><br>They were also out of cups, so they gave us plastic to-go cups all meal. <br><br>You can get much better quality for less at many other establishments.

I live near the Cheesecake Factory and have gotten a cheesecake to go before (which is 100% always delicious) but have never dined in until this weekend. For pros - the food was delicious and they have a large variety of foods to choose from making it a good quality meal key for people or families with picky eaters. The service was great- very accommodating and friendly. The cheesecake is hands down amazing. However, while I get the high prices for the cheesecake due to the quality and cost of making so many daily, I found the food itself to be overpriced for the atmosphere. It is loud,with many kids, and while the quality of food was good it was not as good as the price assigned. However, due to the meal having nothing wrong with it and the service being exceptional I did bump it up a star. Definitely would choose to spend $20 more and go to a quiet fancier atmosphere dinner but it was a good dinner and for families with children I can see why it would be perfect.

My bf and I frequently dine at the cheesecake factory in stl a few times a month and it is nothing compare to the one at the fashion mall in Indianapolis!2, we ordered our usual dishes and the taste was not great at all. My salad was welted and the tomatoes were old. Our herb crusted salmon also tasted old. Service was average. Atmosphere was ok. It was humid and smelly during lunch. besides the old tasting food being bad...the hostess was very rude. The girl with the straight across bangs. She was not only rude to me, but also others. She didn&#39;t smile or say hi or anything. I found that the other hostesses (the ones seating customers) were by far the friendliest. That other girl with dark hair, straight across bangs need to go!

It saddens me that one of my favorite restaurants has been made into such a horrible experience. My husband and I sat for 25 minutes before he had to go find a waitress to even get waters ordered. Finally, the manager came out to take our order and apologized for his staff. Shortly after, a waitress who had been beside and near us throughout that 25 minutes at other tables came over and asked what we wanted- simple, lettuce wraps and pot stickers. We finally got our food after a much waited wait by a food runner, to which our waitress never came back to check on us, or bring us any plates. We each kept trading dishes trying to eat.  No napkins. No plates. No service. This has without a doubt been the worst service I&#39;ve ever received at any restaurant, let alone the Cheesecake Factory. It seems the commercial chain is becoming more and more apparent that the staff professionalism is decreasing.

I&#39;m done with Cheesecake Factory.  I used to dine here weekly with friends through the years.   But this location has gone down hill fast recently.  (Lately, I&#39;ve been dining late and on my own-after I am done with work, as I need dinner and don&#39;t want to go to a &#34;bar&#34;.  Just want to chill, eat, drink)<br><br>So let me give you a recent run down of issues:<br>-Sitting in the bar area, the bartender seemed more interested in doing tear down and clean up than to get my order, check if I needed anything, etc.  (happened twice)<br>-One of those times, as bartender was cleaning, she called over a manager to show him that the drink rail drain was clogged with dead fruit flies-pulled out iPhone flashlight so he could see better.   (Hello!  I can hear you-and see you, I&#39;m 6 feet away!)<br>-Served old fries  had to wait for bartender to notice me, and for fries to be made.   I got fresh fries, thanks.<br>-Complained about noise in bar area as bussing area is behind the bar, so much noise it was disruptive.    Shared other issues with Tim, a manager, who responded to my frustration with crashing dishes shattering my nerves, he comped my meal.   I go out to eat to have an enjoyable experience, NOT to have it ruined by the sounds of crashing dinnerware  Thanks Tim~only recent redeeming encounter<br>-Sat in bar area again, but at table, so I have server, not the usual inattentive bartender.  Sounds of crashing dinnerware an issue AGAIN so they move me to dining area.   Thanks~much better<br>-Had 2 decent experiences, though if I order a brownie sundae, and it doesn&#39;t have hot fudge and you just put more hershey drizzle on it, and think I won&#39;t notice, that&#39;s a cheat.  I went up to the Cheesecake/Carryout counter since my server was nowhere in sight, and asked for hot fudge.  Waited.   Waited.  Ladies got me hot fudge which was already put away in fridge.   &#34;Sorry it&#39;s not hot&#34;.  Why are you teasing down your station when orders are still being made?<br>-Stopped by Saturday night late for dinner and drink to chill.  Sent back my fries because they were old.   Got &#34;new&#34; fries.   Which were, instead, old fries that had been re-fried.   Nice try.   Brought to my attention and she apologized, but did nothing else.   Overall, she was inattentive anyway.<br><br>This place has gone way down hill.   Lot&#39;s of people clearly just going through the motions, with no real care for quality, or for giving the customer what they they deserve for what they are paying.   Yes, I have high expectations, but if you are spending nearly $30 for a drink, burger &amp; fries, wouldn&#39;t you expect it to be right?  I do.

I&#39;ve always enjoyed this place, but over &amp; over they disappoint me. Over a 4 hour wait for a party of 9 on a Saturday because reservations aren&#39;t allowed. Ridiculous. Then to make matters worse, we waited 45 minutes in the to-go line for 3 pieces of cheesecake! 45 minutes! Insane. I won&#39;t be back.

We stopped by the Cheesecake Factory while visiting the mall. I had never been, and was excited to see what they had to offer. My only complaint about the experience is that we came in around 2:30 p.m. and we&#39;re sat at a table with a chair on one side and a long shared booth for multiple tables on the other side. They put us right next to a large family (in multiple ways) and it was annoying because one of the people spread out nearly into our area. There was a ton of seating open and they were fine with reseating us, it was just kind of awkward considering the family could hear everything we said.<br><br>I ordered the pulled pork sandwich. I wasn&#39;t sure what to expect, but it was great! The pork was tender and tasty, the sauce for it was great, and I got some tasty fries to go with it. I&#39;m always happy to get bread before the meal, so that was a plus, and our drinks were always full.<br><br>We didn&#39;t end up getting cheesecake, but it looked pretty phenomenal.

I usually have a good experience at the Cheesecake Factory... but this visit wasn&#39;t great. We got seated quickly which was nice. Our waiter was pleasant... but after that it went down hill. Everything we wanted, they was out of, and one of our dishes didn&#39;t taste great at all. Overall not a great experience.

Party of 6 at 5pm on a Saturday - we waited about 30 minutes but it was well worth the wait. Our waitress was very personable and friendly, and connected with us right away. Food was amazing - the Chicken bellagio is to die for!  I won&#39;t ever get anything else!  And the cheesecake, no wonder they are named for them!  We got the vanilla bean and the macadamia nut, both fantastic. Only drawback was that they put the calories on the menu so you basically eat a full days worth of calories in on piece. But so worth it!  Will be back!

Worst dining experience of my life last night.  The service was worse than bad...the staff worked all around me cleaning 2 hours before closing while I waited to get a menu.  Once I got a menu, it was 20 minutes before I ordered.  Food was average, and this is one of my family&#39;s favorite places to eat...but this location is an embarrassment to the franchise.

This is not my first time coming here.  I&#39;ve had different experiences from not good to good.  I feel like my experience today was average.  One thing that I would recommend, is to wait for either a table or booth, don&#39;t sit were you are sitting right next to another party.  I felt like the whole time I had someone listening in during my convo.  <br><br>I got the Parmesan Chicken sandwich with french fries, and it was really good.  If I get invited to go here, fine, I will, but this isn&#39;t a place I would suggest.

A great hostess makes the biggest impression on customers. I certainly understand that it must be annoying to have customers checking in to ask how much longer the wait will be after they leave to visit another store in the mall. So, it is much appreciated when you snidely reply, you have about 13 minutes left in your quoted wait time. If it weren&#39;t my daughter&#39;s choice to celebrate her birthday tonight, I would have left. Can&#39;t wait to share this with my friends too. There are plenty of other options in town. Perhaps we can all give The Factory a break.

So I haven&#39;t been here in a couple years and was excited to return. My friend and I wanted to meet up for a couple apps and a drink and both of us left pretty disappointed. The prices for the appetizers were the most disappointing part. We ordered the warm crab artichoke dip and it wasn&#39;t even warm. The bread that came with it was so hard that it cut my friend&#39;s lip- it was incredibly uncomfortable to eat. I&#39;d gotten the Thai lettuce wraps before when I was younger without realizing it&#39;s just a bunch of stuff on a plate- it makes you think you&#39;re getting your money&#39;s worth but if you&#39;re splitting them with someone, it&#39;s silly- it only comes with 5-6 pieces of grilled chicken. We asked for more since there was plenty of lettuce and toppings left but our server was incredibly unfriendly and unaccommodating to our request. We didn&#39;t bother getting anymore food since we were both disappointed with the overall experience and quality of our food. Out of all the other places to get yummy apps and cheap drinks, I won&#39;t be coming back here.

If you have a large group avoid the Cheesecake Factory.  They will not go out their way to accommodate even for a very special event.  Even if its before 5:00.<br>Good food, but large parties need to stay away.
We are from out of town and we&#39;re blown away by the deliciousness and commercial classiness of this place.

I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory since moving to Indiana over 9 years ago and I am still very much impressed!  The menu is a bit shorter which is helpful.   The portion sizes are still ginormous and now they even have a lighter fare menu!  It is just as delicious as I remember it and many of the usual favorites are still being served regularly. I was incredibly impressed with the service and love that there is access to the restaurant in and outside the mall.

Food is always delicious but there was a major waiter/waitress disruption. Myself and friends were there celebrating a birthday we started with a waitress who was pretty rude from the start, she eventually stated that she was uncomfortable serving our table the supervisor came over to apologize and assign a different waiter. The new waiter seemed to be more enthusiastic and finished the visit with us only to make an extremely rude and insensitive comment to one of my friends. I immediately spoke to his supervisor who was less than shocked of his comment. I will not be returning to spend my hard earned money in this location ever again.

Listen. The cheesecake is good (try the Nutella one). But I just can&#39;t get excited by the food. The &#34;healthy&#34; options are just ok and there normal fair just seems like it should taste a whole lot better for the indulgence. Gluttony should be truly delicious not bland or oversalted. Service is mostly hit or miss with probably more hits.

True to its name, this particular factory outputs an impressive number of stumbling, stomach-cradling patrons each and every day. Excellent, quality dishes from a bafflingly massive menu paired with sufficient, often great service has made us highly-satisfied regulars. If the line out the door didn&#39;t clue you in, this place is worth the wait. Order whatever sounds good in the moment; they haven&#39;t let me down yet.

The worst meal I have had, it must have been a different or a new cook.  The bacon burger ordered came out with bacon still have chunks of fat although requested to have it cooked well done.  The salads was old and rotten, sent back for fresh and no dressing.  But it still came out with dressing on top, the foods was awful.  We have eaten this location many times, but the food today was just awful.  The manager came out Apologized, but that was all he said.  They need to get the old cook back.
lousy long waits understaffed  the whole process needs overhauled!!!!!  waited 1 3/4 hours when there were open tables manager was cllueless corporate  needs to clean house

Food was good but it took over an hour.  Ordered and it took the waitress 30 minutes to inform us they were out of veggie burgers.  Was very attentive to the table next to us but could not attend to us.  Waited over 5 minutes for refills and forgot my husband&#39;s drink.  We were going to order dessert since it was my daughter&#39;s birthday but we had to go to a funeral and ran out of time.  Very disappointing.  Will go to another location next time. Manager did comp some of our meal, but it wasn&#39;t about the money. It was the birthday experience that was ruined.

Third time here. Took the salesteam of 18 for winning a company contest. Great food. Excellent service. Everyone was thrilled. Also came in 7cents over budget which says alot about pricing. Not a cheesecake guy but the apple crisp and fish tacos were out of this WORLD!!!
