This was mine and my husband first time eating here for my birthday . We loved our meals so delicious and the cheesecake was great as well.

We come here often and tonight was my daughters 7th birthday celebration (only 3 of us). Emily was the hostess who was amazing and set it all up under my daughters name for it to be all about her. That set an expectation. We were seated and ordered her dinner and a couple of appetizers. They came out pretty quick. Our dinner took over an hour to get and while in process the server told us it was something with the kitchen. Didn&#39;t get into detail when we asked and just said she&#39;d bring more bread - we were over the bread we wanted our dinner. It finally came and was very good. She never once mentioned the birthday and completely bypassed it. We had to ask for drink refills and it was like pulling teeth to get them. I had the manager call me after and I explained and got an apology but it didn&#39;t seem too genuine. We drove pretty far to have this dinner and will not return. Makes me sad because we have always had a great experience until the past 2 visits. We will drive to Greenwood from now on and never return.

The Cheesecake Factory at the Keystone Mall is a very popular. We were seated quickly, but the service to our table was a bit slow. The food was very delicious and the portions are large, which is nice considering the prices are higher - $20-30 per entree. Of course you go here for the cheesecake. It&#39;s creamy and tastes wonderful. Worth it.

My parents came in from out of Town for my graduation. Took them to this location...we had a party of 7 and was given a table transponder and told it would be over an hour wait. At an hour and half, we started asking questions and they responded that the table was not ready and it was actually a 2 hour wait. When we finally got a table 2 hours later, it was a 6 top instead of two 4 tops put together. They continued to seat other parties ahead of us instead of giving us a bigger table. Don&#39;t eat here, management were jerks to us!

The price is too high and the wait time on a carryout order is ridiculously long. The place was packed on Saturday and I ordered two entrees and a piece of cake. They gave one of our plates to someone else on accident. To their credit, they tried to make it right by giving me a free cheesecake. I do understand that things don&#39;t always go right, but I placed my order over an hour ago, and I&#39;m still waiting on it so that I can start my date... I could have eaten here if I wanted to wait this long...

Ordered coffee, 5 minutes later was told there was no coffee. My fiancé ordered the pumpkin cheesecake and it came out partially frozen (he didn&#39;t seem to care but I would not have been ok). I ordered the Dutch apple cheesecake and it was overly cold and consisted of mostly nuts and a few weirdly textured apple chunks and hardly any part cheesecake. One of the worst dessert experiences I have had at a dessert place. My fiancé ended up eating most of my cheesecake since he was hungry.
Love the in house service but the to go service is not so great. We waited 25 minutes for our to go cheesecake.

Very nice food, reasonably priced. Very tasty. You could bring kids. Not very loud. Service is awesome. You will find all sorts of cuisine at Cheesecake Factory, starting from American and Italian to Chinese and Thai. I really like this chain.

The Cheesecake Factory in the Keystone Fashion Mall on Indy&#39;s north side must be doing something right because they are always busy, and I give them credit for having quick service despite the crowds.   Part of their draw may be that they have something for everyone with one of the biggest menus I have ever seen.  They literally have three menu pages devoted solely to appetizers and a page and a half just for their various cheesecake options.  Being the planner that I am, I chose to forgo an appetizer in favor of saving room for their Original Cheesecake with Strawberries for dessert after my pizza.  I was not disappointed in this cheesecake that they claim is their most popular.<br><br>Alas, I am The Pizza Fan and not The Cheesecake Fan - although that gives me a good spin-off idea - and I did not find their pizza to be anything more than average.  The sauce was decent, and they sprinkled some herbs and seasoning on top of the pizza that helped to add some flavor.  Also, the crust had a good consistency, and I enjoyed the edges perhaps due to what tasted like a butter-type glaze that they may have applied.  However, there wasn&#39;t really anything special about the cheese or pepperoni.  Given their huge menu and their fairly mediocre pizza, I will likely try something else the next time I visit The Cheesecake Factory.
This place is really great! The menu has Asian, Italian, Mexican and American foods! I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecake personally but everyone I&#39;m with loves it. I love the vegan Cobb Salad.
Horrible place to eat ., we use to went here so many time .,they changed too much for they food., $22.99 for 3 small steak &amp;3 small Shrimp., have to wait for an houre .,,horrible not coming back.

I went on a date to the cheesecake factory a while back. We were seated right away which we weren&#39;t expecting. Our waiter was friendly and very fast at serving us. Our food was delicious and we&#39;ll portioned. We were so full we had to wait until we got home to dig into our cheesecake!

Disappointed. Came here for the Sunday Brunch for the green chilaquiles with carnitas and eggs. After placing the order the server returned and said they were out of carnitas. I asked why and she said they only had pork and chicken but no carnitas. Carnitas IS pork people.

2 hour wait to even get a table ( told it would be 1 hour 20 min). While waiting no place to sit. For first 45 min no buzzer to alert us that our table was ready. They had us check back 3 different times before giving us one.  Told buzzer only worked inside restaurant so me and 2 granddaughters shopped in mall while my husband waited by himself.  Once buzzer alerted, had to wait an additional 5 min to be seated. Waiter was good but didn&#39;t have eggplant husband ordered so he had to choose alternate item which waiter placed almost immediately with our order. Husband chose a cheeseburger. Other 3 meals came out together but husband&#39;s didn&#39;t arrive the the other 3 of us were finished eating. Had to order cheesecake at time we received our meal because waiter said if he didn&#39;t place dessert order We&#39;d be waiting 40 min for dessert. Frustrated with wait AND not being able to eat together. They took husband&#39;s meal and cheesecake off the bill ($20) but bill without tip was $88. So with tip it cost us over $100 to be miserable for granddaughters birthday. <br>Don&#39;t waste your time. Food wasn&#39;t worth the price and the wait for lack of family time.

Been going to various Cheesecake Factory restaurants for about a decade now. Everything I&#39;ve ever had at any of their locations has been consistently good. Back before I quit chicken, I liked the Pasta Da Vinci. Most recently, I had the &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; [insert trademark symbol here] shrimp with angel hair pasta, which made the &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu for being under 590 calories (which I more than made up for with the complimentary bread and butter, and with the cheesecake I ordered for dessert). Although I don&#39;t recall seeing it on the menu recently, I recall having a pretty good grilled eggplant sandwich there a couple of time. They also used to, and maybe still do, have the &#34;factory chopped salad,&#34; which is the salad for people who aren&#39;t salad people, and is probably no healthier than anything else there. <br><br>Portion sizes are huge. One regret I always have is eating lunch or dinner there, and not saving room for cheesecake. Their food is good, but their cheesecake is way better. Try the Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter or the Chocolate Tuxedo Cream. <br><br>My only complaint about it is that the tables in there are jam-packed pretty much right on top of eachother, especially at the Fashion Mall location, so getting into your seat or leaving the table means having to decide between sticking your butt in the faces of the people at your table or the people at the other table because, one way or the other, it&#39;s going to be in someone&#39;s face because there&#39;s no room to walk other than sideways. Because everyone is packed in like sardines, it makes social interaction very awkward. They can hear your entire conversation, and they can hear yours, someone sitting on the opposite side of the table next to you may as well be sitting directly across from you, etc.This uncomfortable set-up doesn&#39;t seem to have any adverse effect on business, though, because they&#39;re always packed, but it does knock an otherwise five star rating down to four stars.

Horrible setting. They sat us at a little bitty table. Felt like we were sitting on top of the tables on each side of us.  Also felt like the wait staff was unfriendly and impatient. This was my first and only time at a Cheesecake Factory and will be my last.
Good service. Went for Saturday brunch and enjoyed brunch special. Tables are pretty close together.

This Cheesecake Factory, although they all seem the same, stands out from all others. I was in town for a personal trip, and decided on this restaurant, located in Keystone Crossing shopping mall. It was a long day, and we decided on a quick sit-down meal before we went back to the hotel. We were going to celebrate a big achievement, and we were hoping to have a good time. We showed up about 30 minutes before close, and yet staff was still amazing and attentive. They told us to take our time, and that we shouldn&#39;t feel rushed. We sat down, and was greeted by probably the best waitress I had ever had. She was an older lady, yet was very attentive to our table, while doing her clean-up tasks waiters/waitresses do before close.She also complimented me on my &#34;achievement&#34; and had a friendly conversation about that. However, I would say the menu has too many good looking options. I know because Cheesecake Factory has more than one location, so this can&#39;t really be fixed, but I thought I&#39;d throw that out there. I had finally decided on the Shrimp Tacos, and they were absolutely amazing. The seasoning of the shrimp and the blend of condiments on the fancy soft-shell tacos were amazing. Then after we had finished our meals, the waitress asked if we wanted any cheesecake (keep in mind we&#39;re now an hour after close). Of course we said yes, but for to-go. I don&#39;t remember what type I got, but I do remember that my first choice, they ran out of. Not a huge surprise, considering it was after close. I then chose a different cake, and it took the employees forever to get the cheesecake. We ordered, and there was probably a 15 minute gap between the order, and when we got the cheesecake. Not trying to be rude or anything, but how long does it take to slice a piece of cake and put it in a box? Especially when we were the last ones in the restaurant. Other than that though, an amazing experience. As we walked out of the restaurant, we were greeted by all of the staff as they were closing up. We were the last customers to leave the restaurant, and yet we still had one of the best restaurant experiences I had ever had. 5/5 stars

First off we had to wait one hour and a half just to eat cold food. The customer service was terrible they had no information to give us. And worst of all they would not let us make a reservation in advance they made us stand their like wild animals. Do they even get me started on the food it tool 55 min to come out and best yet it was cold. Well at least the chess cakes was okay.

I would suggest not ordering for take out at this location. I have three times and each time a different issue: put on hold for a long period of time when ordering, item ordered was forgotten, called to notify I was here and it wasn&#39;t relayed to the food runner (causing cold food and waiting an extra 30 minutes), long wait times in general, silverware not provided (hotel living requires those!) or this location being out of items. I have always been a happy customer when dining in at this chain (I haven&#39;t at this location) but this locations take out needs some serious help.

I always get the Jamaican Black Pepper and it was hotter than normal today, but it was still really good. The extra kick was good. It seemed like the chopped mangoes had a lot of chopped ginger mixed in. I couldn&#39;t tell the two since they both had the same color and texture. Also, the shrimp is always over cooked. Shrimps doesn&#39;t take long to cook, but I guess they are just trying to be safe.<br><br>The boys and Ate M basically devoured the Chicken Bellagio again. I say this dish is a hit with the kids and will definitely get it again next time.<br><br>The wheat bread is always very good, but today it was very stiff and didn&#39;t enjoy it much. Even Ate M didn&#39;t eat that much of it. She usually gobble it up.<br><br>Good thing this place is pricey; otherwise, we would be here more often.

This was a total disappointment!  After waiting an hour and a half our server was snarky and there was no clear cut plan for a child with food allergies.  Ended up having to order off the adult menu.  We even asked while we were waiting and were told our server will know.  We will likely not be back.  Staff was rude and unhelpful.<br>Wait was way too long for the food.  Bummer!!

What a joke. Yes it&#39;s Valentines Day...understandable that you may wait for cheese cake. But after waiting in line for 71 minutes and not moving, then being told it would take another 25-30 minutes after ordering, mind you I still had 10 people in front of me, to get my 2 pieces of cheese cake I was forced to leave. This place gives zero cares about your order if you aren&#39;t tipping their staff or ordering dinner. Over priced and horribly long waits...guess I&#39;ll have to disappoint my pregnant wife on Valentines Day because I can&#39;t wait for TWO HOURS to get cheese cake.

I&#39;ve been here a couple of times while shopping at Keystone.  Each time, it&#39;s okay - but pricey for what it is, I think... and if you are trying to be calorie conscious, good luck.  I see that they now have a &#39;Skinnylicious&#39; menu, but I don&#39;t recall that on previous visits.  <br><br>The Fried Macaroni and Cheese appetizer is dee-lish.  The BBQ Chicken Pizza was good - not even close to the best I&#39;ve had, though.  <br><br>I will say that their menu is impressively large.  It&#39;s like a book.  Many options.  <br><br>The times I&#39;ve been here, I&#39;ve usually been with cheesecake addicts.  Never being a big fan of cheesecake myself, that wasn&#39;t the draw... but I will say that I have since tried one of their cheesecakes that was AMAZING... the Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake.  WOW.  I&#39;d definitely go in again for just one slice of that and maybe eat a cheaper lunch in the food court or before we head to the mall.

The Cheesecake Factory is the beez kneez. I mean, it&#39;s the cat&#39;s pajamas. If you have never been to The Cheesecake Factory, you have been cheating yourself out of a life-changing experience! If you tell yourself that you don&#39;t like cheesecake, then you&#39;re obvious lying to yourself because you&#39;ve never had Cheesecake Factory cheesecake! All in all, it&#39;s atmosphere is sublime. It&#39;s service is great! If there is a long line, that&#39;s just because the cheesecake demand is so high. They can&#39;t help being the best cheesecake in the world! My personal favorite is their Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake which provides the rich flavors of cream cheese and fruit  along with a lightness resembling angel food cake. If you haven&#39;t been to this top-notch establishment yet, you better get on over ASAP!

The wait was worth it and the price because the food is amazing. I had the chicken piccata and it was amazing. Also, the cheesecake was fantastic. I had the lemon and raspberry kind and I would buy a whole cheesecake of that flavor. The raspberry sauce on it was delectable. I could have a whole gravy boat full of it!

We stopped there on our way through Indy for some cheesecake to go.  Have heard great things about it and wanted to try it out. The place was incredibly busy and just very chaotic at the entrance.  People didn&#39;t seem to know where to go and there was a LOT of people. Trying to figure out  where to place a to go order was a task since there just appeared to be people standing around not moving in the roped off area.  So we asked another customer  where to go and she said she thought  you went in the far end to order. Why  there was nothing as simple as a sign at one end that said &#34;enter here&#34;  a sign that said &#34;place order here&#34; and then another one that said  &#34;pick up here&#34; ,  I have no idea.  So we went down and got in line.  Made our way up and placed our order.  <br>A younger thin blonde girl took our order and handed me the receipt to &#34;total and sign&#34;.  I wrote the total of the order without a tip ($17 is more than enough for 2 pieces of cheesecake and she wasn&#39;t our waitress or anything) and asked her to throw the other copy away.  When she saw the receipt to type in the total I swear she kind of made a sneer or something to the effect she seemed upset. She also just left might happen to see it laying on the counter. We walked down to the area where we now figured out was the waiting area only to stand and wait while the three people who ordered behind us got their order,  even though they all ordered the exact same thing as us, two pieces of cheesecake.  So my wife ask somebody why the people behind us were getting their orders and that girl went and looked and our two pieces were just sitting back on a table in their containers so whomever got them never finished bagging them up and brought them to us. <br>The cheesecake was amazing but definitely not worth the experience or the price.
Great place to eat. The service is always very quick. The food is always great!! And cheesecake is amazing.
Have eaten here twice and gotten take out once. Excellent service each time! I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve had bad service at any CF. Thai lettuce wraps are delicious too!

The food is quality here is slowly declining, as is the service. This location is always busy to the point that they don&#39;t take time for their customers. We most recently ordered dessert through Curbside-to-go. We called when we first parked, waited 15 minutes and nobody came out. Called again and waited another 10 before leaving without our food. We definitely won&#39;t do curbside again. Not sure if we want to wait and deal with the crowds and noise inside either. The food isn&#39;t that great anyway. But If you really want to be ignored, go ahead and try it. L

So many options to choose from for under $10.00. With my appetite, I don&#39;t need a big meal. Loved the serving of both wheat and sourdough  (or italian) bread before the meal. There were three different people who served us; the waitress, someone who served our appetizer and a young lady who placed our bread on the table and said absolutely nothing.  Interior was kind of dark, and can be hazardous if someone isn&#39;t careful of spills on the floor as I noticed during our last visit.  One slice of Strawberry Cheesecake was $8.50. Overall, excellent family restaurant in my opinion.

Why 2 stars? I loved the staff, they are really nice here! Also, cheesecakes are delicious. But few facts just destroyed everything.. Me and my friend got buffalo chicken and different cheesecakes. Meniu says that cheesecake price is between 6,95$ and 8,50$. I don&#39;t know how they decide what is the price - my friend took &#34;CHOCOLATE HAZELNUT CRUNCH CHEESECAKE&#34; and she got a big piece of a really tasty and good looking cake. Meanwhile I ordered a simple one - &#34;FRESH STRAWBERRY&#34; it was also delicious, it was a simple one and my piece was way smaller. I was happy about it because i&#39;ve lost my appetite after buffalo chicken. When we got our check I saw that our cakes are the same price - 7,95$. Thats strange. Oh and also we both got food poisoning from chicken. &#34;Best&#34; way to finish our day.

Penny....Penny....Penny.  If only she was our waitress, all would be forgiven.<br><br>Food was okay and in the usual super-sized quantities.  Service was terrible - forgot the salad dressing, took forever for everything.  No wonder there is an hour wait- they don&#39;t know how to turn tables.  We got our cheesecake to go, so they could seat someone else.  That took 15 minutes.  I could have eaten a whole one it that time.

Worst experience of my life at this restaurant. I don&#39;t know how you can have that horrible of service and still be in business. Terrible. I don&#39;t think we saw our waiter 3 times during the whole meal. Once to bring menus, once to take orders, and once to bring the check. Our glasses were dry.<br><br>And how do you make food taste like NOTHING. Terrible, but also like NOTHING. My friend and I had 2 different meals, and neither of them tasted like anything. It was horrible. At least the cheesecake was good, but it would be unfortunate to have that name if their cheesecake sucked as bad as their food and service. <br><br>Never ever again. I wrote to the company and never heard anything. So obviously they don&#39;t care about their customers. I have told all of my clients that I will never, ever eat there again. Some were glad that I gave them the tip not to go there and the other half said the exact same thing- they tried it once and would never go back because it was awful.

This place never disappoints. I had dinner here last night, with a party of 10, and the staff didn&#39;t miss a beat. We were able to get a private section with a short 10 minute wait. Our server was quick on her feet and made sure all of us were taken care of. Portions are so large, I was only able to eat half of my meal! Oh, and the cheesecake was of course the highlight of the evening.

Bear in mind: majority of these reviews come from old Carmel people who just finished their shopping spree at the upscale Keystone Fashion Mall so please try to take them with a grain of salt. <br>Alright, now that I&#39;ve said that, here&#39;s my review. I&#39;ve been to this place for a lot of things. Birthdays, anniversaries, family gatherings, or just a dinner for my girlfriend and I. I have yet to have a viable reason to complain. Yeah, it&#39;s pricey, but the food quality is higher than your average American restaurant chain and you get a lot of it. Also, it&#39;s pretty difficult to find places in Indiana that will cater to vegetarians as much as this place does, so I always feel good bringing my girlfriend here as she can get something to eat that isn&#39;t just a bunch of sautéed veggies or cheese. As someone who eats meat but can enjoy a vegetarian dish, everything on this menu is no joke. What I mean by that is, everything is full of flavor that works together, whether the dish has meat or not. If you can make a &#34;meat eater&#34; devour a full meal made entirely out of vegetables/grains/fruit/starches, I have to say that you&#39;re doing something right. <br>Also, the staff is always very friendly. I&#39;ve been here at extremely busy hours and at pretty slow hours and I was treated well and timely every time. <br>Final note: I highly recommend the salted caramel cheesecake. Easily the best one on the menu. Unbeatable!

I have gone to the Cheesecake Factory probably more than I&#39;ve eaten at McDonald&#39;s! It seriously blows my mind when people say that they&#39;ve never been. The food is consistent; I&#39;ve never had to send anything back and I&#39;ve always loved my entree. The portion sizes are rather large considering I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever finished my plate and every time I go I practically get dinner and lunch for the next day. <br><br>     Of course you go for the cheesecake though. I&#39;ve had a number of them; the Tuxedo Cream and 30th Anniversary chocolate cake cheesecakes are my favorite! The cheesecakes are all super rich, so you can&#39;t go wrong. We order whole cheesecakes all the time for birthdays and just family get-togethers, and it is the quickest and easiest process. I can order the night-of, and in line on the busiest night and it takes as much time, or less, than a regular order. <br><br>     Really you can&#39;t blame them for being busy; that just proves how popular they are and how much everyone likes them. Sometimes the wait for a table is bothersome, and once or twice our appetizers took a while, but they were accommodating and the food was great nonetheless.

I wanted to treat my boyfriend for driving me from West Lafayette to here. &#34;Been here, eaten that&#34; restaurant. After a ~30 min wait, we were seated in a little tiny table that can uncomfortably fit two main dishes. The tables were too close to other tables, very little personal space, and noisy. There was no space to put my phone, so I had to keep it on my lab. The server was nice, but he seemed to be overwhelmed and hurried. I got a Factory Combination of Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane. I was not a fan of mushrooms, but they did not have a lot of options for steak so I went with it. Overall, the food was okay, but not memorable. We had two cheesecakes to go, they were really good... but pricey!

My husband and I came in hungry ready to eat. My food was ok. My husband tasted a little bit of his food and hated it. He asked the manager can he get something else, she said &#34;yes you can but you still have to pay for this food&#34; (in a sarcastic way). She couldn&#39;t show us in the policy where it states that. Management was very rude and inconsiderate. My husband had to sit there hungry and upset. My blood is boiling. I will never go back here because of how they treat their customers. That&#39;s what you call money hungry.

Came here with a large work group and had pretty low expectations based on previous experiences in other locations, but ended up being fairly happy overall. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is famous for 3 things: <br>(1) Enormous portions<br>(2) Ridiculously large menu<br>(3) The actual cheesecake<br><br>Unfortunately, I was too full to sample the actual cheesecake, but it certainly delivered on the first two! The nice addition to the already huge menu is a new &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu (dumb name, smart concept) where all entrees are under 590 calories. I got the Mexican Tortilla Salad and it was certainly enormous (finished about 2/3), but tasted fresh and had good flavor. The table shared a bunch of appetizers, but the bites I had were fairly mediocre (nachos, calamari). <br><br>They did handle our large group with professional aplomb and as a bonus, had a few local beers on tap (2 Floyds, Bells). It&#39;s obviously not going to be the most refined culinary experience, but if you&#39;re really hungry, everyone in your group wants something different and/or you&#39;re dining with a large party, it&#39;s a pretty good option for the area.

Corporate Chain...<br><br>I don&#39;t frequent them, but when I&#39;m eating with my picky daughter we have to go somewhere that appeals to the masses. I will have to say, I&#39;m done with The Cheesecake Factory though. <br><br>We waited about 15 minutes for a table, which wasn&#39;t too bad considering it was 1pm on a Saturday. They offered us a menu while waiting...no doubt a ploy to hurry up the process once you are seated. Believe me...turn and burn is the name of the game here. OH MY GOODNESS...our server moved and spoke so quickly I had to have her repeat things. <br><br>My daughter ordered off of the appetizer menu (sliders) along with a salad and a coke. I went with the veggie burger, sweet potato fries and tea. Both meals were okay...nothing special. We also ordered a piece of cheesecake to share. Bill total was $51 with tip. Ridiculous.<br><br>We felt rushed and very &#34;not special&#34;. I just can&#39;t stand the pretention and lack of attention to customer service. No thanks.
Hubby and I had orange chicken and gumbo. Large portion sizes. Food was excellent as was the service! Fabulous raspberry cheesecake! Reese&#39;s cheesecake was excellent too. Always a favorite!

Always go here when I visit Indy. Hate the wait but it is always worth it! The staff is always professional and know the menu well and when i ask for their honest opinion about something they give it to me. I love the cheesecake. We all get different ones every time we go, I&#39;ve yet to eat on that wasn&#39;t packed with flavor.

Garbage. Very small pour of gin into an oversized glass with what seemed like a gallon of flat tonic water. If they can screw up a gin-and-tonic, I&#39;m not sticking around to see what they can do with dinner.
Can&#39;t believe this branch of The Cheesecake Factory does not take online reservations like the one in Chicago does- very disappointing.
A lot of entrees are just way over priced for what you get. Service has always been just so so to not that great. We mainly go there for the cheesecake.

On Sunday, August 6th, we decided to have dinner at the Keystone at the Crossing location.<br>As usual and expected, there was a 45 minute wait which we were prepared to wait longer because of the popularity and location. When we were called, our party of 6 was seated in a booth even though 1 person with us was in a wheelchair.  We asked to be moved and the host graciously moved us to another table. However because that location was near an air vent, the elderly person in our party asked to be moved. The manager was very accommodating and moved us again to another location in the restaurant.<br>So far, the experience was great. Now this is where things turned sour. After being seated, we waited 15 mins for the server to take our drink orders.....all waters,  1 coffee and 1 strawberry lemonade. It took another 10 mins for the drinks to be delivered except the coffee.  When we asked the server about the coffee, she replied she thought you were just asking about coffee, but it was brought immediately. Ok. Moving on. It took a few mins to decide what we wanted to eat. We tell the server we are ready to order,  she replied I&#39;ll be back, I&#39;m going to take the other tables&#39; orders first. The problem with this.....they were still waiting to be seated when we were moved. (They were seated well after us.)<br>After she took their orders, she stands next to the cash register for 5 mins or more, Then comes to take our orders .....soup and salad, pasta Napolitano,  catfish, a burger and another pasta dish. Having to wait for what seems like over an hr, we ask for more bread. She said she was waiting on fresh bread even though we watched several other servers bring bread to everyone around us. We waited 10 mins just for bread, then the food arrives. Food was delicious. We had to ask for water refills. After finishing our meal, it took 25 mins to get our checks which had to be changed because one person was charged for something not ordered.  As we were waiting, 2 in our party decided to order cheesecake to go. One person ordered 3 or 4 pieces and 1 person ordered the low carb with strawberries. The slices were extremely small compared to the ones ordered by others at the same time at other tables. The strawberries for the low carb was about 1 tsp in a little cup. We did ask for the Mgr who graciously adjusted the bill and the cheesecake was sent back except for 1. Because we called for the Mgr, our server comes to apologize.<br>Too late. The service was horrible thus my 2 stars even though the food was good. We were initially seated at about 3pm and didn&#39;t leave until almost 6. Will we go back? Probably not to this location.

I found the quality was lower than my last visit. It is a chain, and packed on the weekend. Our server didn&#39;t clear any plates and forgot our drinks and our food came out separately which is awkward to eat when you have to either wait for everyone or eat while it is hot. <br>The veggie fries were cold. I suspect they were forgotten in the back. The chicken wraps and portions were huge but nothing spectacular taste wise. <br>Cheesecake is delicious. <br>The restaurant is ok if you are hungry at the mall.

I have never had a less than perfect experience at Cheesecake Factory. From the tamale cakes (which are so flavorful) to my main course of the mac and cheese burger everything was perfect. The tamale cakes are large, and can easily be shared or served as a meal. The mac and cheese burger is huge! I could only eat half and took the rest home to have for lunch the next day. And for dessert, cheesecake of course! My favorite is the red velvet, however this time I went with classic vanilla bean. So yummy!

We dined there tonight to celebrate my husbands birthday. We arrived just before 5. We were immediately seated. Our table location couldn&#39;t be more perfect. Our server, let us know, it was shift change. We put in our drink and app order and then ordered our entree. We received our bread. Our drinks and app arrived quickly. Things were going great. App was delicious. Then things feel apart. Our server and manager both apologized for the delay of our entrees. It took about an hour to get our food. My husbands was cold and my pasta was so undercooked it was hard to chew and it kept sticking to my teeth. I barely ate it. I wish we have been able to keep our original server. We waited a while before the server came back. We asked for the check and We ordered a piece of cheese cake to go. I looked at the cheese cake when we got out to the car. It&#39;s so small. how disappointing! We should have spoke up...

We eat here all of the time and no matter how often we talk about trying something else this is what we end up choosing over and over again. My husband start buy putting an order in for french fries and requesting ranch with our bread. You cannot go wrong with bread, fries, and ranch. This should make the meal but we do not stop there. Typically we pick out 3-5 different small plates and apps before sharing an entree and after packing up what seems like a week&#39;s worth of food we add cheesecake for later in bed! Perfect date night adventure, we love going on Friday and Saturday nights when it is really busy. We have waited 2 or more hours in the past and used that time to catch a movie. We like sitting in the single tables with the long booth on one side and individual chairs on the other because we typically make friends with surrounding couples who are also enjoying their date night. It is a lot of fun people watching and socializing.
Lemoncello Cream Torte™ is to die for! <br>&#34;Layers of Vanilla Cake and Lemon Mascarpone Cream Topped with Streusel and Served with Strawberries and Whipped Cream.&#34;

The lunch size Orange Chicken was still huge! (And very tasty!) Service was slower than normal. : (  We opted to get their carrot cake instead of a cheesecake... It was too dry. The carrot cake at Ponderosa Steakhouse is better!!!

This was by far the WORST experience of my Cheesecake Factory visits. We came in for dinner around 6 and were immediately seated..a plus! However, things went downhill from there. The table was dirty and I had to tell the server where to clean. Had all of the silverware removed because it had been sitting on a dirty table. Apparently, the guests who were sitting next to us also asked to have the same table cleaned and it was never cleaned. Then the bread that has typically come out with every meal I have had with his establishment never came out until I asked. Apparently, you have to ask now. I just ate at a Cheesecake Factory a month ago in California and the bread came out automatically. No questions asked. Lastly, there was a nut on my cheesecake and I ordered one that had NO NUTS. I am severely allergic. Then when I looked at my gf&#39;s cheesecake, the individual who cut mine had used THE SAME KNIFE to cut hers!!! Overall, the service was terrible and I was extremely disappointed. We will not be returning.

As one of the more well known restaurants in the area the Cheesecake Factory is always a top pick for events. The food comes out fresh and tastes nice, the service is typically prompt, and the atmosphere is alright. The menu has a large variety of options which allows large groups to all find something they like and at a reasonable price. Good restaurant to go on a special occasion with groups.

BEST place on the north side of Indianapolis to eat! Let me tell you why! First off the decor is so cool inside and out. The staff from the host to the servers to the managers have always been super nice to my wife and I. The food has always been perfect when it comes to taste and way to much when it comes to size. My wife and I go and get an app, split and entree and sometimes get dessert and leave with a $35 bill. We always leave stuffed and super satisfied. Some of our favorite things are the shrimp bistro pasta, lemon salmon that&#39;s a special, Shepard&#39;s pie, crab cakes, avocado egg rolls, flatbreads, I mean everything is amazing I could keep going on!!

So I&#39;m here again for the national cheesecake day or something like that. I arrived at 5 and sat at the bar... HAPPY HOUR, which features select items for 5.50 from 4 to 6... I&#39;ve had the happy hour burger before and the parmesan bread... So delicious... If you are really into cheese and garlic, you will not find ANYTHING better...I promise you that! On this day, it was national Cheesecake day or their anniversary, either way the had half off cheesecake. I&#39;ve had just about every flavor of Cheesecake they have on their menu. I messed around this time and ordered something I never had before and it wasn&#39;t as pleasing but it was still pretty good. It was extremely rich and chocolaty...(I&#39;m not really a huge fan of chocolate...that is why it wasn&#39;t as pleasing) but if you love chocolate and coconut together then you would love that specific cheesecake. It also had chocolate chips in it and chocolate mousse, chocolate frosting...it was a  lot of chocolate. I only tried it because I wanted something different. Because it was so much for me, it took me quite a while to eat it. It was more than I could handle, but it was good. My bartender was the absolute best. She made sure my drinks were full, checked on me and attended to my needs when I needed her. She was amazing. One thing I will say is that I commend the cheesecake factory on changing their policy for their employees. There was a customer who came and sat at the bar. Ordered food and walked out without paying. I felt horrible for the bartender...I wanted to pay for this man&#39;s food because I felt bad for the server, so I made sure I tipped extra and informed my bartender to split the tip with the other bartender. I apologized to him about the situation, you could tell he was bummed about it. There wasn&#39;t much I could do but apologize and try to brighten up the servers day. Nevertheless, the food is ALWAYS great, the service is ALWAYS great, and the music is ALWAYS great. Cheesecake Factory is a staple in my book...You can NEVER go wrong with eating here. Just make sure that you get there early because it is very popular and sometimes the wait can be anywhere from 30 minutes to 2 hours...however...it is worth it (quality of the food, quality of the service, portion size, and prices) you can&#39;t beat it...not on their level of dining.

I&#39;d give zero stars if I could. Just came to get take out cheesecake.   On a Saturday. It was busy as expected.  It was beyond ridiculous and frustrating.   There were many waiting for a table, people waiting in line to order, then waiting to actually get their cheesecake to go.  ALL IN tHE SAME AREA.  Also, to add to the madness there were wait staff in and out of the area getting cheesecake.  It clearly doesn&#39;t work.    There were seven people behind the counter.  Two were working very hard. Something needs to be done.   We are now 35 min in and still waiting for our cake.   I&#39;d leave but I can&#39;t in good conscience give you my money.   Never again.   Just got my cake at 45 MINUTES FOR THREE PIECES OF CAKE.

I have a theory that places with menus this huge tend to have mediocre food because you can&#39;t be amazing at making hundreds of things. Whoever created it must be a jack-of-all-trades kind of person who couldn&#39;t narrow things down. The Cheesecake Factory has one of the biggest menus I&#39;ve ever seen, mostly NOT cheesecake, strangely. There are a few good things here and there, but I&#39;ve been there three times now, and the only things I&#39;ve liked were the Avocado Eggroll appetizer and ALL the cheesecake. I would actually go back and eat just those things as a meal. Or just eat a couple slices of cheesecake as a meal. It&#39;s hard to choose from the bajillion kinds of cheesecake, so if you&#39;re with a group, it works well if everyone picks one and shares, so you don&#39;t have to worry so much about regretting your decision.<br><br>It would be a good date place; I actually recommend going somewhere else for dinner and then doing the cheesecake for dessert. It&#39;s got a dark, romantic vibe in the evening (even with all the families and small children around) with middle eastern decor (this is kind of random to me) and a patio that&#39;s nice to sit out on if the weather is good.<br><br>My mom and I were trying to figure out why almost all the servers seem to be male, since this is kind of unusual. We decided it must be because their uniform includes a necktie. Very logical.

Really busy and popular place and be prepared to wait an hour on a Friday or Saturday night. I&#39;ve enjoyed every meal I&#39;ve had here and this last time had the eggplant Parmesan. I&#39;ve also had the mac and cheese burger and it&#39;s a must try. The cheesecake is obviously a must and it&#39;s so hard to decide which kind to get. I have to say my favorite had been the basic cheesecake with fresh strawberries.
My sever was great. The food came out so fresh. You could definitely tell the freshness from the taste of the food. To top of you have to get the Oreo cheesecake.
Slowest curbside to go service in the city! If you call in an order be sure you have at least an hour of your life to waste!

The cheesecake is great!  I always order the red velvet or Adam&#39;s peanut butter.  One time I was eating there and found a hair in my cheesecake.  Instead of being apologetic, they informed me it wasn&#39;t possible.  Last night I got cheesecake to go, and there was another hair sitting in it.  This time I just threw the whole thing away because I don&#39;t want to be accused of planting one there!  I might have to find a new restaurant at this rate!

I always look forward to eating at the Cheesecake Factory restaurants because we seldom do. Today&#39;s food was awful! I ordered the Carolina BBQ sandwich with fries. The fries were stale and tasted like they&#39;ve been sitting for hours, and just warmed to serve. Then there was the sandwich.... Barely any pork on it, and the pork that was was 90% fat! Legit FAT! I&#39;m sorry, but if you can&#39;t give me pork on my pork sandwich and charge me $13 for it, DON&#39;T serve this sandwich on your menu!!! You&#39;ve got 1,000 other things on the menu! Do without.

I brought my two daughters out for a special meal.  They were so excited and we got seated after just a short wait.  Our waitress however was much more interested in the other tables with bigger parties and alcohol sales.  Before the food arrived she came to ask us how we were enjoying our food.. However we hadn&#39;t received our food yet.  After our food came our drinks were left empty and she didn&#39;t refill until the end of the meal.  We asked for boxes which she offered to take care of for us but she left our food sitting in front of us while she took pictures for another table and when she finally brought our bill she charged us 3.00 a piece for kids drunks which were supposed to be included.   Food was very good.  I will probably try it again and hope for another server.  What a disappointment for what should have been a lovely meal!!

Great place, as always. Great food. But if you want to sit at the bar here, you may not get the sports you want. No Big 10 Netwirk access as of Dec 2014. They should up the viewing options in the bar so the beaten down man at the mall can escape from the elements for 15 mins and reclaim his identity in a pint and a game.

great experience. I have been here several times with okay experience and today during lunch with my mom- we had josh as our waiter and he was just awesome. super nice and very attentive.. never let our drinks get low and updated us on our food. had a yummy cheeseburger and the fries with ranch are to die for
The fried macaroni and cheese balls keep calling my name. They are oh-so-wrong but taste oh-so-right!
Always have desert first. ALWAYS when you come here.
Good soups, salads, but who has room for cheesecake? The portions of food are generous!

Food are great love the place but after I eat I went to the bathroom to wash my hands I saw one of the worker went to the bathroom walk out without washings their hand it just nasty!!!!!! :( so dirty and unsanitary! !!!

Really nice food. We were treated royally and the server was real nice. She helped us walk through the menu and order what we needed the most. The spinach artichoke dip was ok, it wasnt creamy but the burger was good and the onion rings and fried that came with it were amazing. The lemonade was great too. Overall a very positive experience and I will definitely go again in the future. A bit pricy but usually you should be able to split the entree and a dessert at the end and end up paying less.

Great cheesecakes and food is in large portions. The menu has so much variety you really cannot go wrong there is something for everyone. My niece and nephews will jump at the opportunity to go. I usually order the same item the cajun chicken littles. They are so good. The order is big enough to share. The caprese salad is also very good. One thing that is important to me is that a restaurant is always consistent and Cheesecake Factory is. Great restaurant.

This is a special occasion restaurant and dessert is a must. Everything is yummy and all of the portions are super sized. The menu is endless, something for everyone including lite items &amp; small plates. I like to order appetizers to share and then order cheesecake. You must order the cheesecake! The service is pretty average. The downside to the restaurant - you will more than likely wait for a table (no reservations) and you will definitely wait for your food, even if it&#39;s not busy. Expect to have a long, relaxing meal. Don&#39;t go if you&#39;re in a hurry.

This was my wife and I&#39;s first trip there and it wasn&#39;t too crowded. I think that we missed the after church lunch rush. <br><br>We had a Georgia peach cocktails which were excellent. We ate the chicken romano and it was good. The portions were generous and we found ourselves getting a doggie bag. Definitely would like to try more menu items before I consider it a &#34;favorite.&#34;

Pass on this place.<br>We&#39;ll start from the beginning. Parking and traffic are a nightmare. Not really the establishment&#39;s fault, but it comes with the experience so it counts.<br>The food is ridiculously overpriced. I got the seared tuna tataki salad. $18. 4 tiny slices of seared tuna, still partially frozen. A small bed of greens drowned in dressing. The greens were fresh, and the dressing was tasty though. 2 slices of hot house tomato on the side. Half an avocado on the side. Build your own salad? Barely larger than a side salad.<br>The other person got a cuban sandwich. I had half. Gave both of us some, shall we say, stomach unpleasantness the next day.<br>Staff was friendly, wait was acceptable. <br><br>All in all, this place just isn&#39;t very good, for any price, let alone the nonsense they charge.

So far I&#39;d give less if I could.  I am very familiar with how host stands work as a restaurant owner.  However, the wait currently is long the host is not friendly and quite rude.  We were given 1 1/2 hr wait.  1 hour 20 min later our buzzer buzzes and we go to the stand and she says no you aren&#39;t next your another 30 min.  She wouldn&#39;t answer how much longer until I was persistent (hence the added wait time I&#39;m guessing). She is not cut out for the host stand of a busy restaurant. I will not be back.

I got their vegetarian burger and it was very bland and seemed to be charred on the outside which lent itself to a very bitter flavor. The fries also seemed a bit dry like maybe they&#39;d been sitting under the warmer a bit too long. The caramel pecan turtle cheesecake was exquisite though. Our waitress was very friendly, and personable, but didn&#39;t seem to have a very good over-all knowledge of food. And PLEASE for the love of god stop making them wear those ugly ties!! Over all the food was ok, the service was decent, nothing to write home about.

Went for a birthday dinner with family.  The cheesecake is fabulous, but the rest of the menu is nothing special.  This is our second time trying this restaurant and we&#39;ve decided that outside of the desserts, the food isn&#39;t really worth returning for.  I had a dish that came with rice that was dry and parts were crunchy.  Either it had been sitting under heat lamps long enough to dehydrate the rice to a crunch or part of it was not cooked at all.  The veggies that came with my meal had been cooked on something that had had burned food on it.  The veggies themselves were not burned, but had a burned flavor to them.  My son order pizza from the kids&#39; menu and after a couple bites, started pulling he cheese off of it and then after two pieces, said he just didn&#39;t like it and moved on to dessert.  We took the leftovers home and I later tasted the pizza.  It was made with parmesan cheese instead of mozzarella.  It was tough to chew as the parmesan made a crust rather than a soft cheese topping.  Kids don&#39;t generally like a sharp cheese flavor, especially when expecting mild mozzarella.  Don&#39;t know if that was a mistake made in the kitchen or if their pizza is made with parmesan.  For the prices charged, I expected better food.

My friend and I had lunch there today and it was wonderful!! I had the beet salad and she had the Cobb, I&#39;ve never had a bad meal there. The people are nice, and the drinks are great!! Met the manager Todd Supernice guy!

This is the type of place where you go to on your first date since they pretty much have everything. Even the pickiest of them all will have something to choose since they have gazillion options. I had their famous chicken Marsala and it was delish! My hubby had the Cajun pasta and he loved it. We both shared the chocolate shake and we weren&#39;t disappointed. Even the free bread was delicious. Of course... How can you skip on the desserts?! Yum!

This place is always crowded at all times of day. The food is pretty good, but it&#39;s expensive. The menu has many options, especially with the varieties of cheesecake. You will leave with a full stomach. In addition to the free bread before the meal, the meal portions are large. The service is great.

On a good day this is place is very good, on a bad day not so much.  Typically the food is always good, a few minor issues but maybe a fluke on the few times it hasnt been up to par.  Of course most of the cheesecakes are amazing.  A little expensive for a family to go to, but not bad for a date night.  Wait times are ridiculous!  2 1/2 hours is not acceptable.  Hostesses are very rude (and that is being generous)!  No call ahead seating or reservations.  Pagers only work in the restaurant, but it&#39;s so packed you can&#39;t stand inside.  They need to upgrade their paging system and perhaps have the auto-text phone option.  Service is hit and miss.  Ambiance is nice and restaurant is fairly well cleaned.  Would be nice to see a few new items on the menu (its pretty much unchanged since it opened). Speaking of menu-it&#39;s a little overwhelming for a first timer.  Worth a visit and definitely try a cheesecake.

Poor carryout service.  Called as soon as they opened today for a lunch meeting order.  They told me to pick it up in 30 mintes. I got here in 30 minutes, been waiting 25 minutes and still don&#39;t have my food.  I will now miss the whole meeting.  Won&#39;t order from them again.
Typical Cheescake factory...good service, food.
The service was great.  Quick to take care of us.  We were out of town and they rocked!

This place is awesome, it&#39;s always busy but wait usually no longer than 20min. We&#39;re gluten free and they&#39;ve got a few options that work for us. Blueberry white choclate cheesecake is amazing.

This is not a conventional review for me because the Cheesecake Factory is not a conventional spot to really find me in, because it&#39;s corporate, it&#39;s pricy (for what it is), and I don&#39;t even like cheesecake, but this review is really specifically about their happy hour bar menu.<br><br>I just started to work near here and I usually take my break between the happy hour time frame (4-6 on weekdays) so I gave it a chance.  This was unlike any of my prior C-cake Factory experiences which all included being dragged their by my mom after she drove me two hours just to go to Abercrombie and Fitch in junior high, so I was unsure what to expect.   However, I was impressed.<br><br>The service was super prompt and efficient and friendly.  I didn&#39;t have a super high bar set because I know how surly I would be if I had to wear those horrible white outfits, but my expectations were exceeded.   <br><br>The food was tasty, fast, and cheap.  The list of items included in the promotion ($5 appetizers) are huge.  I got two things assuming that the portions would be smaller (they&#39;re not - actually they are quite large, because it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory) and also because I wanted both the avocado egg rolls and the taquitos (sue me, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory) and couldn&#39;t decide.   Whatevs, it was only $10, I probably would have spent that at Subway, and these are pretty much your only two options inside the Fashion Mall at the moment.<br><br>I will be doing this again.  Probably a lot.   Oh my god, I am gonna be one of those people who get recognized by the staff at Cheesecake Factory.

We have visited several Cheesecake Factory Locations including,  Chicago, Orlando and Birmingham. To much dismay this was by far the worst. First of all, we are an ethnic family and did not feel &#34;welcomed&#34; to say the least. We were a party of five that was put at a table for four with a chair added to the end. I noticed that while walking to our table in the far back corner, there were several tables (over 10) that were larger and empty, but were not cleaned off. The waitress Breanna seemed less than interested in our business, but after 30 mins of blah service I mentioned that I was posting a review to Yelp, and she instantly straightened her act. From that point on, our glasses were full, she smiled, and she constantly checked on us. When the food came out, it was by far the smallest portions that we have ever received at any of the locations. The food was also sub-par. My son didn&#39;t touch his pizza ( which is a meal that he eats almost daily), my husbands Jamaican black pepper plate was good, but small. My daughters had the chicken pasta, there was lots of pasta...but barely any sauce or chicken. My dish was the salmon and chicken combo with asparagus. The asparagus was rock hard and not seasoned. The salmon had a yucky anise flavor, but the chicken was very good. Once again the portions are NOTHING like other locations! The cheesecake was very good, but for $8 a slice it should be. What really mad me angry was the fact that right next door at Barnes and Noble..the same cake by this same company that is also the same size is only $4.25.. What a crock. So after spending $121.48 for five people to eat including a $5.99 kids meal...we will never return. I would rather spend my money where I am wanted and appreciated. BTW, we did tip the waitress $25 because I could tell that she has potential...she just seems depressed by her surroundings.

Knowing that this location was going to be busy, we called ahead for reservations for four.  Although Yelp says otherwise, our reservations were REFUSED.<br><br>When we arrived, we were told the wait was 60 - 90 minutes. Since our visit was an adult b-day and college graduation celebration, we [in hindsight, stupidly] waited. While tables of two&#39;s streamed ahead of us, and at least two groups of eight or more claimed to have reservations an were seated quickly, WE continued our stubborn wait.  After 90 minutes, we asked when our table would be ready, and were told &#34;10 to 15 minutes&#34;.  After the wait, we asked again, and were told&#34;10 to 15 minutes&#34;.  This happened twice more.  We were finally seated after MORE  THAN TWO AND A HALF HOURS!!!  Frankly, our fault for being so stupid!<br><br>Our wait and stupidity were not rewarded.  While the food was of good quality served be competent wai staff, the food was not as good as expected. My wife makes better Steak Diane and Chicken Marsala, and my D.I.L.&#39; s hamburger was WAY over priced. Shrimp Scampi is NOT  true Shrimp Scampt, lacking the butter. Ggarlic, and bread crumbs of the real thing. A major flavor let-down n my book.<br><br>I will have to comment that the Kale and Quinoa Salad was delicious, and plenty for all four us us, and of course the Cheesecakes were divine.<br><br>But don&#39;t trust the Yelp listings. This location DOES NOT have private Parking -- it is at one end of a busy shopping mall, and shares parking with mall Shoppers and at least two other restaurants, including Starbucks and PF Chang,s.<br><br>While handicapped accessible by law, you can forget any practicle use of the words. The entrance is narrow, and packed  with thoughtless, often tipsy visitors.  For get wheel chair or cart access during peak hours. The seating in the dining area is so close that wheel chair or cart would block access of other patrons. With the <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fvery.limited&amp;s=77e35f23bc69e7260a4d8bfa56a5cca7bd64632c4c47a8ccda0955b41e217a34" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">very.limited</a> seating in the waiting area, even those of use with canes or that are unable to stand for long periods will have great difficulty.<br><br>All in all, a less than dazzling experience thst WON&#39;T BE REPEATED.
Food was good, but our server had a very bad day before showing up to work. Recommend the food, but the server will get 10% tonight; which makes me sad since I have been a server.

Was here on a Thursday night around 9pm. It seemed moderately busy, but my party of 3 didn&#39;t need to wait for a table. We were there to order just cheesecake and coffee, and apparently that is sacrilege to a restaurant that has &#39;cheesecake&#39; in its name. All 3 of us had our menus open to the cheesecake section, but our blase waitress still seemed put off by us just wanting to order cheesecake.. again might I mention it was 9pm, possibly even later. Our drinks came out in a timely manner. We placed our orders and waited for about 20 min or so for the cheesecakes, which is ridiculous for a restaurant that only had about 75% of its tables filled. It literally takes 2 min to place a slice of cheesecake on a plate with some whipped cream. After that, we never saw the waitress again until it was time to pay. Never got refills on our water or coffees. I&#39;m very unimpressed with the service and the fact that our waitress was bothered by us wanting dessert instead of a meal.

TERRIBLE RESTAURANT! Why is it called the Cheesecake Factory when it should be called the Crapcake Factory? The waitress was terrible, and I&#39;m looking around at everyone else and the waitresses are bringing them bread and our waitress NEVER BROUGHT US GODDAMN BREAD! I did the ULTIMATE test to see if the waitress would get my order wrong or right. I SIMPLY ASKED FOR A PLAIN BURGER. My exact words were &#34;May I please have a PLAIN burger with nothing on it, Just buns and a burger&#34; Then these crackheads give me a burger with EVERYTHING ON IT. Very shitty restaurant. The staff was rude and it was an unpleasant experience for my whole group. Then the total for my burger came to $34.50! For a $1.99 McDonald&#39;s® burger! I was so mad I didn&#39;t even order any cheesecake. WHICH WAS PROBABLY A BLOCK OF CHEESE WITH FROSTING ON IT. It was also about $10 dollars for a single slice of cheesecake. So I will Never go to this overpriced snobby restaurant ever again.

We sat outside to avoid waiting for a table inside on a busy Sunday afternoon. This was my first time eating at any Cheesecake Factory, because I&#39;m usually counting calories. We waited for bread, we waited for our order to be taken, we waited for our food. Waiting must be normal here; no one was in a rush. On the bright side, the chicken chili was delish &amp; the pumpkin cheesecake was worth the wait.

Wow, absolutely blown away by the customer service. I hold one of the store managers Todd and the Bar man Kevin with very high regards. Very helpful and detail oriented. Had a small issue and they took care of it. Excellent customer service.

This is a reliable place to get a good plate of food. You may feel really gross afterwards, but oh man its usually sooo good. I used to get the romano crusted chicken, which so yummy.<br><br> Recently though, they have a &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu which is really nice. I like to be able to know that food put in front of me won&#39;t be a full day&#39;s worth of calories. I would high recommend both their grilled chicken and their shrimp tacos from this menu. <br><br>I got the grilled chicken breasts, and even though it was under 550 calories or something like that, there was a TON of food. Enough for both my dinner and lunch the next day. It came with a nice bruschetta and steamed brown rice. My favorite part was the arugula it was topped with. I really love me some rockets. <br><br>The shrimp tacos are also really delicious. Wrapped in warm corn tortillas and served with mexican rice, they are really filling as well. <br><br>Of course, now I get to talk about the libations. Their wine menu is decent and includes my favorite wine of the moment: Kim Crawford Sauvignon Blanc (YUM). I also really like their skinny mojitos. They taste too good to be true. <br><br>Lastly, I love cheesecake, and obviously, this is the place to have it. You really cannot go wrong here, but two of my favorites are the red velvet (do NOT look at the nutrition info on this one) and the wild blueberry cheesecake.<br><br>All in all, you know when you go here you will have decent service, a good drink, and a good to great plate of food.

Usually good food over a really wide food choices - but today both the oriental chicken salad and the cashew chicken had loads of salt. There was so much sodium chloride added that we had to ask for a replacement dish - nothing turned up. Hmmm - not sure but this is hopefully a one-off experience
I purchased a gift card for a special couple to use.  They were disappointed in wait time, drinks, etc.  Thought I could count on this chain!

White people c&#39;mon down and have a typical corporate chain restaurant experience.  If, however, you&#39;re a person of color and/or have an accent, I would recommend avoiding this place at all costs!  My family, on holiday visiting from South America and after my Wife had taken them to a Chicago location for a Birthday celebration, had the misfortune of trying to mirror their previous stellar experience only to be ignored and treated rudely by a seemingly attentive wait staff to the rest of the establishment.<br><br>After writing a detailed letter via their corporate website, I received a form letter from this location&#39;s manager saying he addressed the entire wait staff regarding timely bread service.  Timely bread service?  Give me a break, he completely ignoring the racial overtones and other issues that were expressed to the lackadaisical waitperson at the time of the visit and in my corporate missive.  We were very disappointed, we took the time to help them and correct a wrong, they send a form letter - Great Corporate Communications!<br><br>Hard to believe in this time of hopeful unity and great promise that this sort of thing still exists, let alone in what is supposed to be a major metropolitan area.  <br><br>Shame on all of you!!!!!!!!!

The food is just your basic chain restaurant food, but the temperature of the restaurant is sub-zero.  This has happened twice.  I was in a sweatshirt, and it was 80 degrees outside, and it was so uncomfortably cold that I had to repeatedly step outside.

Very good service. Quick food for a table of six. Ordered the jambalaya shrimp and chicken. It was fabulous. Just the right amount of heat. Wonderful spicing, great sautéed peppers and onions and large chunks of chicken and shrimp.

Desert was good but the manager kept telling us we would be seated in 10 minutes but over 45 minutes later we were seated.  Food was good but table management was poor.  Next I will visit with a smaller party.  Good thing the mall and starbucks were right there.

Yes I came in Sunday night with the intention of staying. Since I heard so many good things about the Cheesecake Factory here at the Keystone Mall. Being a Avid Foodie. In a diner. I love trying new restaurants and checking out the service in every regard from the hostess to the checkout. But tonight. I asked a question it would appear to be the cake counter. And the two little snarky employees that were behind the counter. Just so you know it was 4:30 p.m. and Sunday night. We&#39;re so snarky to me and giggly to me I highly suggest that you remove them. Because I would have stayed along with my guests. I had four of them. But they were so snarky. It&#39;s set a bad precedent for me and my dining experience to come. So I decided to go elsewhere actually across the street to PF Changs. When I asked a simple question. They both giggle at each other in the one to return to my question with another question. Very snarky.. It appears one of them might have been a manager position. Because she had street clothes as opposed to the other young lady who had on what looks to be a Cheesecake Factory uniform. I understand your menu is extensive and you&#39;re known for your gigantic portions. But a gigantic great attitude would be an asset Also. I suggest you review customer service policy with some of your staff especially your front of the house staff

Out of all the Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve visited, this is the worst. Every time I have eaten at this location I&#39;ve been disappointed in my food. I&#39;ve tried a new dish every time I have visited, always to be disappointed.<br><br>Not only is the food continually not up to par (especially for the price), but on my most recent visit, my dish came from the kitchen much later than the other 3 dishes at my table. Apologies from the manager were made, but no other compensation was offered.<br><br>I&#39;ll only go back if I&#39;m out-voted by the other diners in my party...

I&#39;m trying hard to not let my bias against chain restaurants get the best of me on this review.  Typically speaking, I don&#39;t tend to review chain restaurants unless they&#39;ve done something exceptionally well or exceptionally bad.  Thought nothing specifically blew my mind, I felt the need to review this place.<br><br>AMBIENCE- nothing too out of the ordinary.  I think Cheesecake factory is one of the nicer (looking) chain restaurants, though does not come anywhere close to being a &#34;fine dining&#34; experience.   Lights are dimly lit, I suppose to give more of an intimate feel to the whole experience.  We were seated pretty quickly, though the place still seemed packed, especially for a Tuesday evening.<br><br>SERVICE- our server was pretty spot on.  She was attentive, friendly, and knowledgable of the WHOLE menu.  I would say the service was exceptional, but she seemed a bit on the fake side.  Don&#39;t get me wrong, I&#39;m not saying she has to be our best friend, but it seemed rather contrived.  <br><br>MENU- if you have never eaten here, the menu is pretty huge.  It&#39;s almost overwhelming if you&#39;re not sure of what you want to eat.  They have tons of appetizers, entrees from around the world (though I would stick with something on the non-ethnic side), and of course cheesecakes.  Tons of cheesecakes.  This could almost be considered a default place to go if you and your group coudln&#39;t decide on a &#34;type&#34; of restaurant to go to.  I wouldn&#39;t suggest coming here on a weekend though.<br><br>FOOD- no matter what you order, you&#39;re bound to get A LOT of food.  My wife ordered some chicken and pasta dish, and I got a seafood sandwich of some sort, and both were pretty good, and in abundance.  Other people at our table ordered salads, and while I generally do not think of salad as an entree, these salads could qualify as one.  Expect to drop $9-$20+ depending on what you order.<br><br>OVERALL- not bad, but not great.  I think I did a pretty decent job of hiding my disdain for chain restaurants.  You could do a lot worse, and at least here you get fed a lot.<br><br>Celebrity Rating- Speidi

You can never really go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. They have so many options that their is literally a book for a menu. There is no reason that you would not be able to find something that you like there. <br><br>I highly recommend the farfalle chicken pasta. It is so flavorful! Not to mention that the portion size is huge so there is plenty to take home for leftovers.<br><br>And of course, it would be a sin to not finish off your meal with some cheesecake. My favorite is the carrot cake cheesecake. It had a perfect blend of both carrot cake and cheesecake- so it never becomes overwhelming or too sweet.

After years of hearing about CF, I finally had the chance to visit for dinner and dessert.  I&#39;m now hoping that I am not given the excuse to go back.<br><br>The food overall was OK, but everything struck me as way too expensive.  You could pay this much to go to a family-grown restaurant somewhere else in Indy and come up with an exceptional meal.  Why go to a chain, which strives to be the same in every location?<br><br>The menu, with no less than 5 million options, was overwhelming and unnecessary.  With a group of four dining together, perusing the menu took a long time and was a conversation killer.  As it turned out, we all just randomly picked something and hoped for the best.<br><br>On a side note to this, I can&#39;t imagine that a chain, with a gazillion options, stocks a lot of fresh ingredients.  I imagine that the pasta sauces are all pre-made and packed in vacuum sealed plastic bags... Loaded with fat, preservatives and sodium.  Yum.<br><br>The cheesecake was really a cheesecake explosion.  There was so much extra on the cake with chocolate, peanut butter, etc, that you couldn&#39;t really taste the cheesecake part.  It made me think that it was a mediocre product masked with a bunch of junk.  Again, overwhelming.<br><br>On a positive note, the wine list was decent.  So I got the opportunity to drown my sorrows over a crappy meal in good wine.  I&#39;ll give you a star for that.

I was out with the fam at the Fashion Mall and we needed to feed the whole crew.  My parents are typical middle-aged Hoosiers who have a very narrow expectation on food.  My brother &amp; sister are a bit more adventurous.  Cheesecake Factory seemed to be our only choice in the area so that&#39;s where we went.  It was a first trip for everyone except for my husband &amp; I.<br><br>Luckily the wait was only 15 minutes (I was told 25-30, so woohoo on that one).  Our waiter was prompt and friendly, though perhaps a bit over the top.  He kept us full of waters &amp; bread and never made me think &#34;where is my waiter?&#34; so I think his craziness wasn&#39;t a distraction.  <br><br>Everyone but my husband enjoyed their food (he&#39;s not a big fan - swears that any place that has such a large menu can&#39;t possibly be any good at anything).  We shared the chicken tacos - not quite as spicy as normal but I thought they were good.  The rest of the table worked on the mahi mahi (enough rice to feed a small country), the BLT salad, chicken quesadillas &amp; a burger.  Plus a slice of the anniversary cake/cheesecake for dessert.  <br><br>Dinner for six before tip was $83 (five entrees, 3 cokes &amp; 1 dessert).  That&#39;s about what you&#39;d pay at any chain restaurant and I think the service tends to be a bit better at Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Would I go out of my way to eat here?  No.  But it&#39;s a solid chain choice when you are hungry.

It kind of is ridiculous how busy this place is alll the time here. I&#39;ve always had to at least wait 30 minutes to get seated for dinner, but hey it&#39;s good food. The menu of course is a friggin book, and is impossible to decide sometimes. I somehow always go back to the pork chops here which isn&#39;t really a normal choice since they are really known for a lot of other things, but man they are delicious and are served with a side of these home made apples and wilted spinach. It just hits the spot for me. <br><br>Of course the cheesecake. Some of my favorites are as follows: White Chocolate and Wild Blueberry, Key Lime Pie Cheesecake, Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake, and of course just Plain with Strawberries. <br><br>Bottom line you&#39;ll be stuffed after Dinner still have room for dessert, and pay more then what you were hoping for, but still be happy and fat.

Large selection. Excellent service. You can&#39;t go wrong here.  We got seared tuna salad, pasta marinara, chicken parm sandwich.   Each tasted excellent.  Our waiter was one of the best.  This is a real treat.  Be prepared to wait awhile to be seated though.

Stopped in to get cheesecake and they had one person working with s long line. The employee spent so much time on the phone taking orders that the customers in line had to wait over 20 min. I asked for a manager and was told twice they would be over and they never came. Horrible service.

WORTH THE WAIT... AND THERE OFTEN IS ONE<br><br>Same restaurants. Same order. <br><br>We&#39;re human, so it&#39;s easy to fall into ruts as far as the places we go and the food we order. Well, you could do a lot worse than falling into a rut of eating at The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>The place has a great feel and look. The servers are the A-Team of Northside restaurants. The menu is endless. The food is great (starting with the breads). <br><br>You&#39;ll have to plan ahead when ordering and eating to save room for their signature desserts -- or take one home. <br><br>The only downside is there is usually a wait, but The Cheesecake Factory is worth it!

Did you know? Cheesecake factory has a 20 page menu.<br><br>Are you serious?  I didn&#39;t even know they could make 30+ flavors of cheesecake, let alone pasta, poultry, steak, etc.  I had ordered a steak diane, which I&#39;ve never had prior to my visit.  They grill steak mediallions to your preferences and add in potatoes and onions.  Omg.... so amazing and so good.  The service is great and impeccable.  The servers are so nice.  I&#39;d def return if I were in Indy again.
Service is always good.But for some reason food is not consistence.I had great meal and some worst meal too.Ambiance and all is nice but really disappointed with my last meal.

I have been here a few times the past few months. My family loves to give me gift cards to this restaurant, which is fine by me! <br><br>They have a huge selection to choose from. I have not been disappointed by one mean that I&#39;ve ordered. There drinks are also very good. My fiancé likes to try out new drinks and they always make really great ones here. Things are a bit pricey here, but well worth it.<br><br>We always order cheesecake... I can&#39;t remember what I usually order. But anything with chocolate is amazing here.<br><br>The staff is always amazing here and are very knowledgable of the menu and great at helping us pick things out to try. We have not had one bad waiter/waitress in all of our visits.<br><br>My only complaint is that this restaurant gets extremely busy and the wait times get crazy long. Sometimes there is no where to sit or stand while waiting and you feel like you are in everyones way. Good thing we live down the road and can come during less busy times.

Let me start by saying this is my first yelp review. Most of my reviews of places that I&#39;ve visited are usually shared amongst me and my friends. But, let me begin anyway... <br><br>I eat out quite often, so I typically order the same foods at the different restaurants I visit. At Cheesecake Factory, my normal order has been the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and the Chicken Sliders. Now this review is not necessarily about the taste of the food but more so regarding the service and the &#34;extras&#34; that now have a charge! This visit was a carry out on a Sunday afternoon. I ordered the above foods mentioned with a side of ranch and blue cheese dressing as I have done time and time again. On this occasion I was told that there would be a charge for one of my dressings. This had never happened before and I was annoyed upon hearing this, as I had never been charged before. I asked the host if this was a new policy and she never answered but only said that &#34;her cook&#34; would not give her the extra dressings unless I was charged. I ended up telling her that I would pay for the dressing (because I need my sauces!) and I would come in to talk to the manager. Upon my arrival they were fairly busy as usually so the 20 mins I was told turned into almost 35 mins for my food. Most places that I order to-go food I always have to check the bag to make sure everything is there that I ordered but with Cheesecake Factory I usually don&#39;t but this time it was needed. That extra dressing I was charged for was not included, nor my bread, nor my side of fries. I couldn&#39;t help but think that if the hostess wasn&#39;t so busy trying to charge me a dollar for a dressing and paid more attention to the packaging of my food then this would have proven to be a better experience for me. Needless to say, I had to ask for my missing items and they were brought to me unapologetically. Overall, I felt like I was at a fast food restaurant and not one where the cost of any plate is typically $15-$20 min. I expect better service from a restaurant like this and was truly let down.
Love their Louisiana chicken pasta! Server was very polite and food excellent. Can&#39;t wait for my next visit. I highly recommend this place.

We ordered takeout for Valentine&#39;s Day.  What an absolute disaster. First my husband called while I was at the mall.
