It took over 15 min before anyone answered.  He then ordered and was told he had the option of curbside pickup.  He told the woman I was in the mall.  He also knows I have terrible arthritis in my back and cannot stand for any length of time.  She said no problem she just needs to come right up to the counter and pick it up.  Yeah right.  So I go in and there is a huge line.  I ask the hostess how to pick up a called in order.  She tells me to go to the back of the Huge line.  Omg.  I get to the front and see a different small line.  I ask the woman at the register what that line is for.  Oh that line is for people who have already called their orders in.  Are you kidding me.  So Ive waited in line to place my order.  Now I&#39;m really upset. While I&#39;m waiting in line I hear a waitress having an argument with the staff behind the counter at the bakery because they are hassling her about filling her order.  She says you could have given me what I needed while you&#39;ve been arguing with me.  Then she says &#34;nice working environment &#34;.  So while I&#39;m waiting for the woman to check my food order I ask to speak to the manager.  Who is doing nothing but standing around.  So mr Stephen Hackett the general manager walks over.  What a condescending man he is.  I tell him that he really needs to make sure his hostess inform people which line to go to.  He then looks at me. Tells me I in fact needed to go to the line I was in. Unless I had already paid in advance. He then informs me that they do in fact have curbside pick up. Then to add insult to injury he asks me do I want to go out and have them bring it out to me.  Ok yeah I&#39;ve just waited over 30 min and I&#39;m going to go get my car.  Pull it up to curbside and wait some more for your staff to get it to me.  He was simply being a condescending jerk.  If this is the top manager at this restaurant then they really need to evaluate their management hiring.  This was a comedy of errors. The right hand doesn&#39;t know what the left hand is doing.  And when I addressed it with the manager he simply blew me off like he couldn&#39;t be bothered.  Then I got home and not only was all the food cold since it had been over and hour since it had been cooked but the salad they gave me was made with letter that was brown.   Simply not worth the aggravation or the rudeness

Went to The Cheesecake Factory on 1/4/16 for lunch with a friend. It was my first visit. I am a huge fan of cheesecake, but I wasn&#39;t sure what to expect. I was certainly impressed by the upscale feel. The menu was a bit overwhelming with so many selections. I chose the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. I ended up taking half of it home for dinner! I was really torn by several cheesecakes I wanted to try (maybe you could have samples for customers to try). I ended up getting the White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut Cheesecake -- a mouthful to say and to eat. It was scrumptious! Though I traveled across the city to go to The Cheesecake Factory, there is one closer to my home on the southside. I WILL be a returning customer.
I avoid chains, but maybe I am wrong.  My food was really really good.  We sat at the bar and our bartender was very nice.  It was a little expensive, but not too bad.

We two people went to Cheesecake Factory at this location for dinner and ordered two burger entrees, each suppose to come with a salad and fries. After quite some time of waiting, two burgers came but never any sides. The salads or fries never showed up even after our dinner! This service is far below satisfactory!

There isn&#39;t much that I could say about this Cheesecake Factory restaurant that I would say about any other location.  Even the service was as good as I have gotten at my local CF.  The bonus to visiting this location was someone in our group had a coupon for a FREE slice of cheesecake . . . and it wasn&#39;t just one free slice.  Everyone in my group got their own individual free slice.  WooHoo!  It was a nice surprise for all of us! <br><br>All in all, I&#39;d definitely go back if I&#39;m ever in the area again.

What a huge menu this place has!!! Believe it or not, I am not a fan of large menus. I prefer to have a smaller selection to choose from because you know that the product is being turned over regularly. Restaurants with large menus tend to use a lot more frozen food because they don&#39;t turn over product as fast. That being said, I had a good lunch. I ordered the fish tacos which came with five tacos, rice, and black beans. The fish was tempura fried, which was different but not that great. The pico on the tacos greatly added to the flavor and kind of made up for the lack of flavor from the fish. This place was good, not great, and I may return in the future.

I think Cheesecake Factory is SO OVERRATED. I would never bother going here in a million years for the food.<br><br>Pros:<br>- decor of the restaurant is nice<br>- their strawberry lemonade is really good<br>- cheesecake is good (but I&#39;ve had better)<br><br>Cons:<br>- the menu is a friggin chapter book (if a restaurant has THAT many pages, you can&#39;t expect quality in every menu item)<br>- the food is nothing special. I think it&#39;s really bland and boring.

LOVE this place... HATE the wait. But this place has something for everyone. We took our son one time and when being seated the manager offered to bring us a complimentary plate of baby goodies (fruits and little foods) I thought that was awesome, he just wasn&#39;t quite into solid food yet. <br>Service has always been great, and I look at this place lovingly whenever  I pass near. <br><br>Don&#39;t forget some cheesecake to go!

Yes, it&#39;s a chain. But mmmm, is it ever a yummy one. <br><br>Yes, we have things like vegetables in Indiana. Gasp! And we even put them in--shocker--salads! Anyway, most everything at Cheesecake Factory is delicious, including the salads with loads of fresh vegetables. But when I come here, I usually go all out and get the burger with the special sauce. Don&#39;t think about the fat and calories, of which there are doubtless enough to feed a whole classroom of children in a shanty town in Nepal. Just go for it and don&#39;t look back. You won&#39;t be sorry!<br><br>Then, of course, the piece de resistance of the Factory--the cheesecake. It lives up to the hype! I especially like the tuxedo and the Godiva chocolate flavors. <br><br>The biggest downside to the Cheesecake Factory is that it&#39;s constantly jam packed with people. I guess that probably speaks well of its quality, but it&#39;s still annoying. Also, I find the exhaustive menu a bit daunting, but most people are probably happy to have so many choices.

I wondered y ppl avg rating of this location is 3 stars, well I found out tonight! Nicole P. was our server. Can u say RUDE? I&#39;m sure she couldn&#39;t spell the word, especially after her inattentive &amp; inefficient service performance! Not to mention this was the 1st time any server offered an excuse for NOT being capable of packing my plate for me, when every Cheesecake Factory server ALWAYS finishes the dining experience with packing ur leftovers for you! Thank God for Anthony of the management staff! He successfully completed &amp; closed our experience on a HIGH note! I suggest going at the end night, when the dedicated servers who close the restaurant &amp; are dedicated to their jobs are working. Otherwise, you prob end up with mediocre service &amp; leave with a sour taste from the poor service staff of whom really don&#39;t care for their job, much less the guest having an enjoyable, positive experience! IJS...

Let me start of by saying the food was great, my waitress was kind and the overall restaurant atmosphere was as expected. However it&#39;s awful how one person can really leave a sour taste in your mouth about a place. I will never again visit this location due to a horribly rude manager I came across. The circumstance is irrelevant, but when a manager at this restaurant was personally lecturing me during my meal tonight I was left in a horrid mood for the rest of the evening. Managers should be even kinder than waitresses but this was not the case. I would never eat here again due to this awful experience with management.

The food is pretty good here though there are a few dishes that I thought could use some work.  The cheesecakes though are delicious!  I can&#39;t get enough of their white chocolate raspberry cheesecake.  It&#39;s out of this world!<br><br>The atmosphere is fun and light though it&#39;s often very loud there due to the amount of people who frequent there.  Yes, even during off hours it is still rather noisy.  Plus, they often play the music a tad too loud so it makes it rather difficult to hear what people are saying to you.<br><br>The staff (or at least the few I&#39;ve met) all have been very nice, quick with service, and were even willing to take some time to just chat with me.  <br><br>I&#39;ve only been there about three or four times since moving here and each time I&#39;ve enjoyed myself.  The only downside to this place is that they often run out of some of their best cheesecakes and don&#39;t re-stock them until days later.  It&#39;s sad really.   But other than that this place is pretty good.
To better represent the entire community, I would like to see a more diverse staff.  The food was average and my server was pleasant.

My kids like getting the cheesecake. Of course, we must eat something else first. Bad idea. The baguette on my sandwich was so hard it left cuts inside my mouth as I tried to gnaw my way through it. My daughter ordered a simple bowl of bow tie pasta with butter. They charged us $12! For 8 ounces of boiled pasta and a lump of butter? And the kids had raspberry and strawberry lemonades. Both were so strong it left them too sick in their stomach to eat cheesecake... so we didn&#39;t order any. All and all it was a terrible waste of money. And this is the third time we have had a poor experience at this location. The server was nice enough and it isn&#39;t her fault the pasta is over priced. But she brought a large lemonade out to my 11 year old daughter and then charged us $5 for it! Seriously. In the past we&#39;ve been seated in the corner of the restaurant and forgotten about; guess a mom and her two daughters don&#39;t look like big spenders?  Anyway, for all the folks with five star reviews, I&#39;m glad you enjoyed your meal. Have one for us next time because we are finished eating at the Keystone Cheesecake Factory.

I wanted to come and give big 5 stars to the Cheesecake factory at Indy for their awesome customer service! A friend of mine and I drove to Indy for a concert a few weeks ago and when we were dining at Cheesecake factory I realized that I lost my printed out tickets to the concert! And the concert was starting in a few hours and there is no printing store open during weekend. One of the managers at Cheesecake factory learned about it and kindly helped me print out our tickets even though the place was packed and he was super busy. I really appreciate it. And want to say thank you so much!

My absolute favorite place to get dessert.  My favorite dessert item is the Tiramisu Cheesecake.  Heaven on a plate.<br><br>I really wanted to try their food, as I&#39;ve heard great things about &#39;em so I chose to go there for my birthday this past year.  Their dishes can be a bit pricey depending on what you get, but you get very large portions.  My husband and I ordered the Hibachi Steak and the Fire Cracker Salmon Roll appetizer and split &#39;em.   It was so incredibly good.  The Hibachi Steak was the most tender, delicious, decadent steak I&#39;ve ever had.  <br><br>The only downfall is the wait.  It&#39;s located in the Fashion Mall at Keystone so that&#39;s understandable.  So, if you&#39;re willing to wait 30-40 minutes try it out!
A billion great options in a menu the size of an encyclopedia, and that&#39;s before you even get to the cheesecakes. Buffalo Blasts, Louisiana Chicken Pasta, and Adams Penutbutter Cup Cheesecake.
Consistency here is the key ... always good service, good food, and lots of it.  The rare times I&#39;ve had something that wasn&#39;t up to par, they were quick to correct it.

Omg. I waited 2 hours and it was so worth it!!!! I was given a menu while I waited so I knew exactly what I wanted.I hate that you can&#39;t make a reservation but I completely understand. The avocado rolls are life changing! The cheesecake is to die for- of course!  The staff was never rude and always accommodating. My drink was always full and I never waited for anything! If I could afford it then I would eat here everyday!

I tried to make reservations for a 60th birthday party for Saturday, May 18, 2013 with Brad, the manager of The Cheesecake Factory. Party of 10 with two infants...infants who need to be to bed by 8:30 pm, by the way. He said they do not offer reservations on Saturday nights. I am still rocked with shock over this statement. I have a $150 giftcard to this place, too! I even explained they already had MY MONEY, but he didn&#39;t care and he acted as if he didn&#39;t even care about the infants. I will re-gift the gift-cards and cross this place off my list of places to go in Indianapolis!

Although I venturing away from good chains more and more, this place has always been a great place to go with friends for a special occasion or to have do like the Golden Girls and bond over some cheesecake. The menu is extensive. I mean seriously it&#39;s a book, so it can be overwhelming, but thee is something for everyone including those watching calories. They have a great drinks menu as well. Not only are the food and drink good, but their desserts are out of this word. It so fun to look at all the varieties and try to decide which suits your fancy. You might find ones you love and some flavored you detest (I&#39;m talking about you cookie dough cheesecake...ugh!). I was obsessed with the red velvet cheesecake for quite some time. I also recommend the lemon cake. It&#39;s dreamy! My only word of advice: I you go on the weekends be prepared to wait at least an hour. That place is always packed. And no they do not accept reservations. Enjoy!

I don&#39;t eat here often due to the high price tag.  For me it&#39;s more of a special occasions restaurant and even then Cheesecake Factoy isn&#39;t at the top of my list.  You receive huge portions of food but anything I have had has just been average.  I do appreciate that the staff is very knowledgeable about most everything on their huge menu, which is helpful and comforting all in the same breath.  I was a bit disappointed that our large party of 17 had a dinner reservation at 5:00 but were not seated until 6:15.  Though apologetic, I almost felt as if we were rushed during our entire visit.  I understand they always seem busy but we did already wait over an hour past the reservation time so I don&#39;t want to wolf down my flatbread and salad so quickly I can&#39;t pretend they taste what they are worth.  The red sangria is quite good... that probably is worth the price. And under 200 calories!

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory.  My colleagues love it, as well as most other chain restaurants; I think it&#39;s just another chain restaurant with a lot of mediocre food.  I got the jambalaya pasta on a recent visit.  The pasta was overcooked.

This is easily my favorite chain restaurant in town! Cheesecake is my all time favorite food, so right away they&#39;re getting like 100 extra cool points in my book. But add to that delicious food, and score one for the mall restaurant!<br>Getting the worst parts out of the way first....this place is attached to Keystone Mall, so there are obviously some downsides. Pick the wrong time to go, and you could be waiting a very long time for a seat. Granted there&#39;s a whole mall to wander around while you wait...but who wants to shop when you&#39;re hungry and there&#39;s a big glass case of cheesecake staring you in the face!!! Parking isn&#39;t always the easiest either. This really isn&#39;t the Factory&#39;s fault...but it&#39;s still kind of inconvenient.<br>Once you get in, and get a seat though, it makes it all worth it. My go to meal here is the Crusted Chicken Romano. Kind of like a fancy Chicken Parmesan, crusted with cheese instead of bread crumbs. The portion size is huge too, so there&#39;s always leftovers for a late night snack.<br>Last time I went I switched it up and instead had the Fish &amp; Chips. Other than there being just a little too much salt on the fish, it was a dish worthy of any English pub.<br><br>Finally...the cheesecake. Oh the delicious cheesecake. Just saying that word makes me start to drool and my heart start to race a little more. If I had to choose between a woman and a cheesecake....... well let&#39;s just say it would get kinda awkward. I have yet to meet one that I did not like. Everyone has their favorite flavor, and they have it here. Whether it&#39;s a fruit topping, mixed with chocolate, or even just a plain one...I&#39;ve never had one that disappoints. It is usually a little difficult to make it through both a meal and desert. But they are always more than happy to box up a slice for you to take home. The extra plus side of that is when you take it home they usually put more of the homemade whipped cream in the box than that do on the plates. So score big for that one.

One of my favorite restaurants in Indy<br>I have been coming here for years, it&#39;s impeccable in all areas. Every employee is clean, crisp, and knowledgable about their massively endless menu. When a rare mistake is made.... they immediately take care of it and make it up to the customer in some way. They care about their customers, they want to make sure each person has a good experience and fully enjoys their meal. I know this location is one of the best in the country. As far as food you must try the pineapple upside down cheesecake, it is seasonal but one of the best. Red velvet of course, vanilla bean, chocolate mouse, and oreo cheesecake.  if you are not in the cheesecake mood I suggest the lemonchello for dessert!! Sometimes I don&#39;t even get cheesecake I just get the lemonchello. Fresh strawberry martini is always a winning cocktail and the bomb pop martini is a must try if you are feeling daring. Avocado rolls, buffalo blasts, potstickers, are my favorite appetizers.  FYI the Caesar salad is spicy, if you don&#39;t like spice tell them no anchovies. There are anchovies in the dressing. The vegetable chopped salad is healthy but has a lot of flavor, it is one of my favs when I am trying to eat clean. Try the Pasta Carbonara, I switch it to bow-tie pasta,

Just had Easter at this Cheesecake factory.  I love the variety on the menu.  I had the caramel chicken for my entree and it is my favorite entree.  The cheesecakes are amazing.  I have tried several and all have been wonderful.  The red velvet and banana cream are my favorite cheesecakes.  There is something for everyone on their menu.

A classic choice. Food is always great, seating not so much. I will never understand the close seating which makes a fine dining experience a not so fine one. The cheesecake is always on par, you get what you pay for.

I will never again go to this location. I was wiling and ready to wait awhile for a table, Knowing it was saturday night, but we got there kind of early and they said about an 1hr and 20 min wait. So we took the pager and walked a few stores and came back a lil early expecting that normally you get seated earlier than later. Well at the time they estimated I went and re-checked. I was taking my two little cousins and they were getting impatient. The hostess told me they were running a little behind, so maybe about 20 more min.... So i went back 20 min later... They said they were really behind, we got there at like 5:30pm. So two hours later and no clue on how much longer, they literally would tell me how much longer. I have been a restaurant employee and I know its not an exact science, but that is really lying to people! Not to mention I think they were favoring parties that did not have children and making families sit in one area. Honestly its always busy and noisy regardless of where you are in there. It was disgusting that they wouldn&#39;t give people a better estimate. If its 3 hours, say 3 hours, there is a whole freaking MALL there to walk to kill time!

Geez ... This place is so loud that I couldn&#39;t hear what my wife was talking about. The chicken was like leather and the salad was dry. Expensive dinner for the slim value this place offers. I won&#39;t be back.

After working at The Cheesecake Factory in Boulder, CO for 2 years, I still enjoy the food. I took my girlfriend here on a date and we had an absolutely lovely dinner. We ordered avocado egg rolls and sweet corn tamale cakes as appetizers, a Santa Fe salad for our main entree, and the AMAZING ultimate red velvet cheesecake for dessert. Our waiter, Justin, took great care of us and joked around a bit, making for a very nice atmosphere. Our drinks were kept full, the food was served fresh and delicious, and the restaurant ambiance was very nice. I am impressed!
Let down that they don&#39;t serve Bourbon steak that was marinated for 36hrs! Not top place n e more...not willing to wait for hrs for just the name &#34;Cheesecake&#34;.

Been to Cheesecake Factory many times but at this location, it was a first.  Came with some friends for a Saturday night dinner.  Was expecting a long wait so we weren&#39;t surprised when the wait was about 75 mins long.  What was upsetting, however, was this black guy that came in about 30 seconds after us and decided to be a jerk and cut us in the line to get his name on the waitlist.  And even more so, the lady taking the names didn&#39;t acknowledge us before him, even though we had been waiting first.  This place is way too crowded to just have one person taking names.  Overall, I enjoy CK and would return to locations I&#39;m used to, but at this particular location, Saturday night was a first and a last.

I&#39;ve been here multiple times, as I got used to having a CF in LA and San Jose and miss it in Lafayette. The service has always been excellent, and the food delicious. My favorite is the key lime cheesecake. Tastes like a creamier key lime pie. Delicious! The only thing I wish they&#39;d improve is the host station.

There is nothing significantly wrong with the Cheesecake Factory; it is a pleasant and adequate dining experience at a reasonable price for the food and service provided. However, on all counts save one, there is nothing that brings it to a level above fine.<br>Even on a Wednesday The Cheesecake Factory pulses with life. Like undersea vents every faux old-world corner is teeming with organisms. One can have a little fun playing Cousteau in the front of the restaurant whispering back and forth about the fauna. Don&#39;t forget to stop by the cheesecake case to gawk salaciously at the evening&#39;s options for a happy ending. The service was mercifully lacking in schmoozing and chit-chat, but rather was efficient and brisk.<br>The food is well executed and of good quality. The portions are so large that in combination with the size of the booth and height of the ceiling that they foster a lilliputian perspective. I felt like I was mounting an expedition  to scale each plate, just taking bites on my way to the summit. <br>The bread before the meal was a baguette that was as good as those I buy at the store, but no better. Our appetizer was a Tex-Mex eggroll, which is analogous to various southwest eggrolls that are offered in other establishments. Insomuch as an eggroll stuffed with beans, corn, and cheese can be delicate, they were delicate, properly fried, crispy, of light density, and served with a complimentary slightly acidic avocado-flavored sauce.<br>The chicken-stuffed tortillas were as good as you might expect and served with a standard coating of cheese, dollop of sour cream and side of black beans. The real star of that plate were the browned and sweetened corn cakes that seemed like a cross between a tamale and sweet cornbread; the musky corn aroma melded nicely with the sweetness and caramelized exterior.<br>Fish and chips are a constant boondoggle for me. I am drawn to them like a moth to flame, but I rarely get exactly what I want. I wasn&#39;t wholly disappointed, but neither was I entirely satiated by the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s offering. The fish was of a fine quality and the breading was crispy; it needed salt and acidity, but those were available to be added in the form of ketchup, malt vinegar, and tartar sauce. The chips (pronounced &#39;fries&#39; in the U.S.) were unremarkable and could have been warmer, though perhaps they simply seemed cool relative to the scalding steam bursts inside the fish. The mountain of cole slaw made standard errors; it was lacking in salt, sweetness, and acidity, and was rather bland and creamy.<br>The banana cream cheesecake was almost pornographic. Something like being smothered with a heady mix of real whipped cream, banana cream, and Bavarian cream. It was garnished with fresh slices of banana whose room temperature warmth provided a nice counterpoint to the near frozen temperature of the cake. The portion was easily large enough for two people to share with shame enough to go around, but I ate it myself anyway.<br>As stated before, there&#39;s nothing wrong with the cheesecake factory. The gaudy unpretentious atmosphere ironically creates its own level of accessible pretension. The food is fine, neither disappointing nor surprising. The genuine appeal comes from the near prurient interest in the cheesecake; much like, though more so than, the rest of the restaurant, the artless indelicacy of the enormous slices of cheesecake make for a gauche and unrefined pleasure.

It&#39;s a franchise, so what can I say? Consistently good service and good food at slightly high prices. I&#39;ve eaten at this particular location four or five times in the last year and never been disappointed.

No gluten free menu, but the staff is knowledgeable and willing to double check things. My favorite dish, unfortunately, is breaded and I am yet to find a gf dish that makes me crave cheesecake factory, so I mostly go along with friends instead of dragging friends there.

i&#39;ve had to force myself to never go here again. not at any fault of the restaurant. but i did finally happen to glance upon the calories in most of their dishes/desserts and they are really really really bad bad bad. upward of 1200 calories for some of the cheesecakes.. and nearly 2000 for meals! noooo thank you! and dont think you can get away with the salads either. they&#39;re horribly high in calories too. <br>with that said, in the past when i wasnt caring about becoming totally obese, i really really liked any of the pizzas, &amp; salads. the keylime and tuxedo cheesecakes are the best they offer. and believe me. i&#39;ve tasted nearly all of them.  service is usually efficient. just DONT go on friday nights. ive waited in lines and watched people literally pass out.  go in for lunch at like 11 or 2! you&#39;ll get in and out in no time.
I have been to several Cheesecake Factory&#39;s but I have to say this was my worst experence.  The food was below average and the waitress was not on top of her game.
The orange chicken was delicious. Waitress was always there to check on us. Of course you can&#39;t forget dessert, chocolate cheesecake was amazing.
way to big of a menu which makes turning tables a HUGE problem. The cheesecake of course is to die for but some of the dishes they have make me wonder what were they thinking

OK, so maybe it is one of the most oppressive chains out there -- the servings tend to be huge, which makes the rather high price not so outrageous -- but the food tends to be consistent ( that chain thing again) and well-prepared, and although their menu is vast, it certainly offer plenty of options.   I have never had the cheesecake.

Our family had dinner at the Cheesecake Factory last night for my 50th birthday.  My daughter, her husband and the grandchildren arrived at 4:45 and put our name in for a table for 7 and we were told it would be an hour and 20 minute wait.  It was really more like an hour and 35 minutes but oh well all the dining facilities looked busy ( I am calling it a dining facility because I can&#39;t spell restauraunt). I had the Tuscan Chicken off of the weight management menu because I am trying to lose some stubborn belly fat.  I work out like crazy but only my hips got smaller not my waist, but what are you going to do you know I am 50.  The chicken was a little dry but the sauce and faro were good.  I had some of the brown bread.  I just love the bread and butter;p;. it is the best.  The grandchildren split the children&#39;s chicken and fruit and they ate everything on there plates and lots of bread and butter.  My grandchildren are happy to just eat butter so they had a couple of pats.  We did not stay for cheesecake even though it is The Cheesecake Factory because I bought a cake from Classic Cakes of Carmel because it is my favorite place to get a birthday cake from.  I got a two layer raspberry cake with butter cream frosting.   It was wonderful.  I am really glad we did not go to TGFs though (even though we never go there because when we closed on our first house in 1994 my husband got a staple stuck in his lip from his salad, though the manager said sorry and comped my husband&#39;s meal, we just have not wanted to go there) .  Any way when my husband went to the parking lot to get the cake and there were 10 police cars and mall security and the police had their weapons drawn at TGFs so I am really glad I did not go there.  Anyway because the bread and salads are so good I will go back to the Cheesecake Factory even if the chicken was a little dry.

i have been to this location several times over several years. My first visit there was perfect - service was timely and friendly, food was delicious. Overall, the experience was phenomenal. However, as time has passed, my experiences have gone downhill. On my most recent visit, the waiter was more focused on the table next to my date and I, my drink did not arrive until after my dinner had (as well as being asked for) and the sugar rim was crusted on, the pasta was undercooked and the waiter got part of my date&#39;s order wrong. Also, waiter charged my date for a drink he had already paid for at the bar and it was a hassle getting it taken off the bill. It was $100 (tip included) for the two of us, and I could have gotten a much more satisfying meal and service for half the price at another restaurant.

I LOVE Cheesecake Factory. By far my favorite chain restaurant. This location is comparable to all the others I&#39;ve been to. We had great service, great dinner and awesome cheescake. Tried the avocado egg rolls for the first time...AMAZING!!!

Decent food, but high prices. They have huge portions, but you should definitely get a slice of cheesecake to go if you didn&#39;t leave room. A small step up from Friday&#39;s, but not a bad choice when you live in the city of chain restaurants.
